analyzed: gang cung zad gzugs 'das ba dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dang / rags pa dang / phra ba dang / dang pa dang / bzang po dang / nye ba dang / ring ba de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas gzugs kyi phung po'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes bya ba bzhin du mdo sde las mos pa la yang 'das pa dang /
translated: The S≈´tra says: ‚ÄúWhatever form there is, whether past, future or present, internal or external, gross or subtle, inferior or refined, far or near, all that one sums up in the aggregate of form.‚Äù

original: da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / nang dang / phyi dang / rags pa dang / phra ba dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po dang / nye ba dang ring ba zhes phye nas bstan te /
analyzed: da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / nang dang / phyi dang / rags pa dang / phra ba dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po dang / nye ba dang ring ba zhes phye nas bstan te /
translated: In the same way, the S≈´tra teaches that belief is classified as past, future or present, internal or external, gross or subtle, inferior or refined, far or near.

original: de ltar mos pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dpe bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar mos pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dpe bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In order to demonstrate the characteristics of aspiration, two verses are begun.

original: skyes dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skyes dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: las dang / 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog la sogs pa la yid ches pa 'das ba'i dus su byung ba dang / da ltar gyi dus su 'byung ba la skyes pa'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las dang / 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog la sogs pa la yid ches pa 'das ba'i dus su byung ba dang / da ltar gyi dus su 'byung ba la skyes pa'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Faith in action, result, the Truths, the Three Jewels, etc., which has arisen in the past and is arising in the present is called ‚Äúarisen aspiration.‚Äù

original: las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa la yid ches ba'i dad pa ma 'ongs pa nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba la ma skyes pa'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa la yid ches ba'i dad pa ma 'ongs pa nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba la ma skyes pa'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Faith in action, result, etc., which has not yet arisen, but will arise in the future, is called ‚Äúun-arisen aspiration.‚Äù

original: mos pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos yin te /
analyzed: mos pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos yin te /
translated: Aspiration is a mental event.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos ches mos pa ni theg pa chen po'i chos mos dmigs nas 'di ni de bzhin du bden no zhes dad cing yid ches par 'gyur ba'i 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos ches mos pa ni theg pa chen po'i chos mos dmigs nas 'di ni de bzhin du bden no zhes dad cing yid ches par 'gyur ba'i 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Aspiration is a mental event which, having taken hold of the Mahayana teachings, is a conviction and faith that ‚Äúthis is just so.‚Äù

original: 'di ni nang gi mos pas so //
analyzed: 'di ni nang gi mos pas so //
translated: This is internal aspiration.
Action

original: dang 'bras bu la sogs pa la yid ches pa ni mos pa dang 'das pa'i dus su byung ba la dmigs nas dga' ba skyes te /
analyzed: dang 'bras bu la sogs pa la yid ches pa ni mos pa dang 'das pa'i dus su byung ba la dmigs nas dga' ba skyes te /
translated: Faith in the result, etc. is interest.üîΩInterest that has arisen previously is relished with the thought, ‚ÄúIt is good.‚Äù

original: mos pa sngon du byung ba ni legs so zhes ro myang ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / mngon par dga' bar byed pa ni gzung bar 'gyur ba'i mos pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mos pa sngon du byung ba ni legs so zhes ro myang ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / mngon par dga' bar byed pa ni gzung bar 'gyur ba'i mos pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Interest that is to be grasped is interest that is generated by taking delight in rejoicing in the good deeds of others and in the Buddhas of the past.

original: 'dis ni phyi rol gyi mos pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyi rol gyi mos pa bstan to //
translated: This is external interest.

original: nam dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan pa'i bslab pa las mos pa dang / dad pa skyes pa ni grogs las blangs pa'i mos pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nam dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan pa'i bslab pa las mos pa dang / dad pa skyes pa ni grogs las blangs pa'i mos pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Interest that is generated by the teaching of a spiritual teacher and by faith in the training is called interest that is taken up from a friend.

original: de ni mos pa rags pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mos pa rags pa'o //
translated: This is gross interest.

original: bdag nyid la mos pa dang / dad pa'i sa bon dang / rigs yod pa las mos pa skyes pa ni bdag nyid kyi mos pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid la mos pa dang / dad pa'i sa bon dang / rigs yod pa las mos pa skyes pa ni bdag nyid kyi mos pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Interest that is generated from the seed of faith and from the spiritual gene is called interest that is one‚Äôs own.

original: mos pa 'di ni phra ba'o //
analyzed: mos pa 'di ni phra ba'o //
translated: This interest is subtle.

original: mu stegs pa'i chos bdag dang sems can yod par bshad pa la yid ches shing dad pa'i mos pa ni nor pa'i mos pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mu stegs pa'i chos bdag dang sems can yod par bshad pa la yid ches shing dad pa'i mos pa ni nor pa'i mos pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Faithful and devoted interest in the teachings of the tirthikas, which explain the existence of a self and a sentient being, is called interest in error.

original: 'di ni mos pa ngan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mos pa ngan pa'o //
translated: This is bad interest.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal bar 'chad pa la yid ches pa'i mos pa ni gzhan du ma nor ba'i mos pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal bar 'chad pa la yid ches pa'i mos pa ni gzhan du ma nor ba'i mos pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Faithful and devoted interest in the teachings of the Tathagata, which explain impermanence and suffering, is called interest that is not erroneous.

original: mos pa de ni bzang po'o //
analyzed: mos pa de ni bzang po'o //
translated: This is good interest.

original: mos pa skye ba'i rgyu rkyen kun tshogs nas mos pa skyes par gyur pa dang mngon du mos ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mos pa skye ba'i rgyu rkyen kun tshogs nas mos pa skyes par gyur pa dang mngon du mos ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Interest that has arisen, having assembled all the causes and conditions for the arising of interest, is called manifest interest.

original: 'di ni mos pa nye ba'o //üîΩmos pa skye ba'i rgyu rkyen ma tshogs pas /
analyzed: 'di ni mos pa nye ba'o // mos pa skye ba'i rgyu rkyen ma tshogs pas /
translated: This is proximate interest.

original: mos pa mngon du ma skyes pa de ni gzhan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mos pa mngon du ma skyes pa de ni gzhan zhes bya ste /
translated: Interest that has not arisen, because the causes and conditions for the arising of interest have not assembled, is called distant.

original: 'di ni mos pa ring ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mos pa ring ba'o //
translated: This is distant interest.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas dam pa'i chos nyan pa las mos pa 'byung ba ni sgra spyod pa'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas dam pa'i chos nyan pa las mos pa 'byung ba ni sgra spyod pa'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Interest that arises from listening to the holy Dharma in dependence on a spiritual master is called interest in terms of engagement with sound.

original: ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams rig pa bzhis sems dang sems las byung ba'i mos pa la ni tshol ba'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams rig pa bzhis sems dang sems las byung ba'i mos pa la ni tshol ba'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The interest that is born of the four kinds of thorough search for the teachings one has heard, by means of the four kinds of thorough search, is called the interest of thorough search.

original: sgom sgom ste chos kyi don rtogs pa las byung ba'i mos pa la ni lta ba'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgom sgom ste chos kyi don rtogs pa las byung ba'i mos pa la ni lta ba'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The interest that arises from the realization of the meaning of the teachings through meditation is called the interest of view.

original: mos pa skyes kyang bdud dang mu stegs la sogs pas drangs nas mos pa gyur na ni 'phrog pa'i mos pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mos pa skyes kyang bdud dang mu stegs la sogs pas drangs nas mos pa gyur na ni 'phrog pa'i mos pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The interest that is aroused but then carried off by demons, non-Buddhists, and so on, is called the interest of being carried off.

original: 'di ni mos pa chung du'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mos pa chung du'o //
translated: This is lesser interest.

original: skabs su dad pa yang 'byung la ma dad pa yang 'byung ba la ni mos pa yang rnam par 'dres pa'i mos pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skabs su dad pa yang 'byung la ma dad pa yang 'byung ba la ni mos pa yang rnam par 'dres pa'i mos pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The interest that is sometimes faith and sometimes lack of faith is called the interest of being mixed.

original: 'di ni mos pa 'bring ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni mos pa 'bring ngo //
translated: This is middling interest.

original: dad pa 'ba' zhig rgyun du 'byung gi ma dad pa ni mi 'byung ba'i mos pa la ni mi mthun phyogs ma 'dres pa'i mos pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dad pa 'ba' zhig rgyun du 'byung gi ma dad pa ni mi 'byung ba'i mos pa la ni mi mthun phyogs ma 'dres pa'i mos pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The interest that is faith alone, occurring continuously, without lack of faith, is called the interest of being unadulterated.

original: de ni mos pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de ni mos pa chen po'o //
translated: This is greater interest.

original: skabs su dad pa yang 'byung /
analyzed: skabs su dad pa yang 'byung /
translated: Sometimes faith occurs,

original: nyan @148b thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos la mos pa ni chung du'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan @148b thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos la mos pa ni chung du'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Interest in the teachings of the disciples and hermit buddhas is called ‚Äúlesser interest.‚Äù

original: theg pa chen po'i chos tha dad pa ni rgya che ba'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos tha dad pa ni rgya che ba'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Interest in the teachings of the Great Vehicle is called ‚Äúvast interest.‚Äù

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa dred nas sa bcu man chad yon tan khyad par can gong ma thob par mos pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa las bar du gcod pa yod pa'i mos pa ni bsgribs pa'i mos pa zhes bya'o //üîΩyon tan gong ma thob bar bya ba la /
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa dred nas sa bcu man chad yon tan khyad par can gong ma thob par mos pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa las bar du gcod pa yod pa'i mos pa ni bsgribs pa'i mos pa zhes bya'o // yon tan gong ma thob bar bya ba la /
translated: Interest that is obstructed by the afflictions of desire, etc., from the stage of action in faith up to the tenth stage, in the attainment of the superior qualities of the higher stages, is called ‚Äúobstructed interest.‚Äù

original: bar du gcod pa med pa'i mos pa ni ma bsgribs pa'i mos pa zhes bya'o //üîΩmos pa gus pa dang bcas pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba'i mos pa ni ldan pa'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa med pa'i mos pa ni ma bsgribs pa'i mos pa zhes bya'o // mos pa gus pa dang bcas pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba'i mos pa ni ldan pa'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Interest that is unobstructed in the attainment of the superior qualities of the higher stages is called ‚Äúunobstructed interest.‚ÄùüîΩInterest that is accompanied by respect and that occurs uninterruptedly is called ‚Äúendowed interest.‚Äù

original: mos pa gus pa dang bcas pa dang / rgyun 'chad pa la ni mi ldan pa'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mos pa gus pa dang bcas pa dang / rgyun 'chad pa la ni mi ldan pa'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Interest that is not accompanied by respect and that occurs in an interrupted manner is called ‚Äúnon-endowed interest.‚Äù

original: sa dang por chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i mos pa spyod pa'i sar bskal pa grangs med pa gcig tu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa dang ldan pa la ni tshogs bsags pa'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang por chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i mos pa spyod pa'i sar bskal pa grangs med pa gcig tu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa dang ldan pa la ni tshogs bsags pa'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The interest of bodhisattvas on the level of earnest aspiration, who are endowed with the accumulations of merit and wisdom gathered over one measureless kalpa and who are the cause for realizing the expanse of reality on the first bodhisattva level, is known as the interest of those who have accumulated merit.

original: chos kyi dbyings rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu bskal pa grangs med pa gcig tu bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa dang ldan pa'i mos pa med pa ni tshogs med pa'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu bskal pa grangs med pa gcig tu bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa dang ldan pa'i mos pa med pa ni tshogs med pa'i mos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The interest of those who have not accumulated merit is the interest of those who are not endowed with the accumulations of merit and wisdom gathered over one measureless kalpa, which is the cause for realizing the expanse of reality.

original: sa dang po nas sa bdun man chad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i mos pa ni brtan par zhugs pa'i mos pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa dang po nas sa bdun man chad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i mos pa ni brtan par zhugs pa'i mos pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The interest of bodhisattvas from the first to the seventh level is known as the interest of those who have entered stability.

original: mos pa la bri ba dang nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mos pa la bri ba dang nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because their interest is free of decline and diminution.

original: sa brgyad nas sa bcu'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa'i mos pa la ni ring du song ba'i mos pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa brgyad nas sa bcu'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa'i mos pa la ni ring du song ba'i mos pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The interest of bodhisattvas from the eighth to the tenth level is known as the interest of those who have gone far.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa dang ldan pa'i mos pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa dang ldan pa'i mos pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is interest that is accompanied by spontaneous non-imagination.

original: mos pa'i bar du gcod pa la tshigs su bcad pa gsum mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mos pa'i bar du gcod pa la tshigs su bcad pa gsum mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Three verses on the hindrances to interest.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis mos pa'i mtshan nyid dang rab tu dbye ba bstan nas tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis mos pa phye ste bshad pa de dag gis bgegs dang bar du gcod pa ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis mos pa'i mtshan nyid dang rab tu dbye ba bstan nas tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis mos pa phye ste bshad pa de dag gis bgegs dang bar du gcod pa ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having taught the characteristic and classification of interest in two verses, he teaches the hindrances and obstacles to interest in three verses, by analyzing interest.

original: yid la mi byed pa mang po dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid la mi byed pa mang po dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Abundant lack of attention,üîΩAbundant attention to the opposite,üîΩLack of the power of virtue,üîΩand lack of the power of the cause.

original: skyes pa'i mos pa la ni yid la mi byed pa mang bar bar du gcod de /
analyzed: skyes pa'i mos pa la ni yid la mi byed pa mang bar bar du gcod de /
translated: Abundant lack of attention is an obstacle to nascent interest.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'das pa dang da ltar gyi dus su mos pa 'byung ba la yang de nyid la mngon sum du ma byas na med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar gyi dus su mos pa 'byung ba la yang de nyid la mngon sum du ma byas na med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because interest that has arisen in the past and present is lost if it is not made manifest.üîΩAbundant attention to the opposite is an obstacle to developed interest.üîΩWhy?

original: le lo zhes bya ba la ma skyes pa'i mos pa la ni le lo bar du gcod de bskyed par bya ba'i phyir @149a * //
analyzed: le lo zhes bya ba la ma skyes pa'i mos pa la ni le lo bar du gcod de bskyed par bya ba'i phyir @149a * //
translated: Laziness is an obstruction to the interest that has not yet arisen, because it prevents the arising of interest.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams te /
translated: One must apply diligence.

original: gzhan na skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩrnal 'byor 'khrugs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan na skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // rnal 'byor 'khrugs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Interest will not arise in the absence of diligence.üîΩThe disturbance of yoga is an obstruction to the interest that has arisen, because it prevents the increase of interest.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i mos pa la ni rnal 'byor 'khrugs pa bar du gcod de rnal 'byor 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i sems bskyed pa la gzung ba'i dngos po la chags pa dang da ltar gyi mos pa'i sems bskyed pa la ni
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i mos pa la ni rnal 'byor 'khrugs pa bar du gcod de rnal 'byor 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i sems bskyed pa la gzung ba'i dngos po la chags pa dang da ltar gyi mos pa'i sems bskyed pa la ni
translated: The disturbance of yoga is the attachment to the object of apprehension in the past generation of the mind, and the attachment to the object of apprehension in the present generation of the mind.

original: 'dzin pa'i dngos por chags pa ni rnal 'byor 'khrugs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i dngos por chags pa ni rnal 'byor 'khrugs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the disturbance of yoga.

original: de ltar gyur na gzung 'dzin dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis thob pas bar du gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na gzung 'dzin dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis thob pas bar du gcod pa yin no //
translated: In this way, it is an obstruction to the attainment of concentration free from subject and object.

original: grogs po ngan dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: grogs po ngan dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Bad friends are an obstruction to the interest that has arisen, because they prevent the increase of interest.

original: grogs las blangs pa'i mos pa la ni grogs po ngan pas bar du gcod de /
analyzed: grogs las blangs pa'i mos pa la ni grogs po ngan pas bar du gcod de /
translated: Interest that is acquired from a friend is obstructed by a bad friend.

original: sngon dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yang dag par 'dzin du bcug kyang phyis sdig pa'i grogs pos blangs pa'i chos 'dzin du bcug pas sngar gzung ba chud zos pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdge gzhan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sngon dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yang dag par 'dzin du bcug kyang phyis sdig pa'i grogs pos blangs pa'i chos 'dzin du bcug pas sngar gzung ba chud zos pa'i phyir ro // dge gzhan zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even though one has been made to take it up by a spiritual master, later a bad friend makes one take up a false Dharma, and so the former interest is lost.

original: bdag nyid las byung ba'i mos pa la ni dge ba gzhan la bar du gcod de /
analyzed: bdag nyid las byung ba'i mos pa la ni dge ba gzhan la bar du gcod de /
translated: Interest that arises from virtue is obstructed by the lack of other virtues.

original: bdag la mos pa'i sa bon dang rigs yod kyang de ldang zhing skye bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba cher ma bsags na rigs yod pas kyang skye bar mi 'gyur bas na bar du gcod do //üîΩtshul bzhin ma yin pha yid la byed ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag la mos pa'i sa bon dang rigs yod kyang de ldang zhing skye bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba cher ma bsags na rigs yod pas kyang skye bar mi 'gyur bas na bar du gcod do // tshul bzhin ma yin pha yid la byed ces bya ba la /
translated: Even though one has the seed and the potential for interest in the self, if one does not accumulate a great deal of virtue that will bring it forth and make it grow, it will not arise, even though one has the potential for it, and so it is obstructed.

original: ma nor ba'i mos pa la ni tshul bzhin ma yin pas yid la byed pa bar du gcod de /
analyzed: ma nor ba'i mos pa la ni tshul bzhin ma yin pas yid la byed pa bar du gcod de /
translated: Incorrect attention is an obstruction to interest that arises from nonerror.

original: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag tu yid la byas na bdag med pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs par yid la byed pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag tu yid la byas na bdag med pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs par yid la byed pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one mentally attends to permanence, happiness, purity, and a self, then one will not mentally attend to the absence of a self, impermanence, and so on.

original: bag med pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bag med pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Carelessness.

original: mngon du ba'i mos pa la ni bag med pas bar du gcod de /
analyzed: mngon du ba'i mos pa la ni bag med pas bar du gcod de /
translated: Carelessness obstructs manifest interest.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: mngon du ba'i mos pa ni ma chags pa dang / zha mi sdang ba dang / gti mug pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi rkyen las skye la /
analyzed: mngon du ba'i mos pa ni ma chags pa dang / zha mi sdang ba dang / gti mug pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi rkyen las skye la /
translated: Manifest interest arises from the conditions of nonattachment, nonhatred, nondelusion, and effort.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang le lo bzhi ni bag med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang le lo bzhi ni bag med pa yin te /
translated: The four‚Äîattachment, hatred, delusion, and laziness‚Äîare carelessness.

original: bag med pa de byung na mngon du ba'i mos pa de mi 'byung bas bar du gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: bag med pa de byung na mngon du ba'i mos pa de mi 'byung bas bar du gcod pa yin no //
translated: When that carelessness occurs, manifest interest does not occur, and so it is an obstruction.

original: thos nyung ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thos nyung ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Little learning.

original: sgra spyod pa'i mos pa la ni thos pa nyung bas par du gcod do //
analyzed: sgra spyod pa'i mos pa la ni thos pa nyung bas par du gcod do //
translated: Little learning obstructs interest that is based on the practice of grammar.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: bkri ba'i don gyi mdo sde tsam thos kyi nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde ma thos na stong pa dang bdag med par bshad pa thos pa dang / skrag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bkri ba'i don gyi mdo sde tsam thos kyi nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde ma thos na stong pa dang bdag med par bshad pa thos pa dang / skrag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one hears only the sutras of interpretable meaning and does not hear the sutras of definitive meaning, one is frightened when one hears the explanations of emptiness and selflessness.

original: thos dang bsam pa nyung @149b dus dga' //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thos dang bsam pa nyung @149b dus dga' // zhes bya ba la /
translated: One is pleased with little hearing and reflection.

original: tshol ba'i mos pa la ni thos pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa dang / thos pa la yang cung zad tsam gyis bsam pa chog par 'dzin pa bar du gcod do /
analyzed: tshol ba'i mos pa la ni thos pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa dang / thos pa la yang cung zad tsam gyis bsam pa chog par 'dzin pa bar du gcod do /
translated: In the case of the devotion of searching, the obstacles are: to be satisfied with just a little hearing, and to be satisfied with just a little reflection on what one has heard.üîΩIn the case of the devotion of reflection, the obstacles are: not to reflect on what one has heard, and not to do much reflection on what one has reflected on.

original: thos pa de la ma bsams pa dang / bsams pa la yang bsam pa rgya cher ma byas na ni bsams pa'i don kun rtogs par mi 'gyur bas bar du gcod do //
analyzed: thos pa de la ma bsams pa dang / bsams pa la yang bsam pa rgya cher ma byas na ni bsams pa'i don kun rtogs par mi 'gyur bas bar du gcod do //
translated: One does not understand the meaning of what one has reflected on.üîΩOne is proud with mere calm.

original: zhi ba tsam gyis nga rgyal dang // zhes bya ba la lta ba'i mos pa la ni bsams pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa dang / zhi gnas bsgoms pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin cing nga rgyal byas te /
analyzed: zhi ba tsam gyis nga rgyal dang // zhes bya ba la lta ba'i mos pa la ni bsams pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa dang / zhi gnas bsgoms pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin cing nga rgyal byas te /
translated: In the case of the devotion of view, the obstacles are: to be satisfied with mere reflection, and to be proud with mere cultivation of serenity.

original: lhag mthong mi bsgom par bar du gcod de /
analyzed: lhag mthong mi bsgom par bar du gcod de /
translated: It is an obstruction to not cultivating insight.

original: bsams pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa la ma bsgoms na bsgom pas mthong bar bya ba'i don gzhan gyis 'phrogs par yang 'gyur la ma dad pa dang dad par na bden pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir bar du gcod do //
analyzed: bsams pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa la ma bsgoms na bsgom pas mthong bar bya ba'i don gzhan gyis 'phrogs par yang 'gyur la ma dad pa dang dad par na bden pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir bar du gcod do //
translated: If one is satisfied with mere reflection, and does not cultivate insight, then the meaning to be seen by cultivation will be stolen by others. And it is an obstruction to not cultivating insight, because one will not realize the truth if one is not faithful, or if one‚Äôs faith is mixed with lack of faith.

original: ma 'dres pa yang de bzhin rigs //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa yang de bzhin rigs //
translated: The unmixed is known to be the same.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩde bzhin du 'phrogs pa dang rnam par 'dres pa'i rigs pa la ni 'dres par ma byas pas bar du gcod de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / de bzhin du 'phrogs pa dang rnam par 'dres pa'i rigs pa la ni 'dres par ma byas pas bar du gcod de /
translated: The meaning of this verse is as follows.

original: yang nas yang du goms par byas shing 'dris par ma byas na mos pa gzhan gyis 'phrogs par yang 'gyur la ma dad pa dang dad par 'dres pa'i mtshan ma 'byung bas ma 'dres pa la yang bar du gcod do //
analyzed: yang nas yang du goms par byas shing 'dris par ma byas na mos pa gzhan gyis 'phrogs par yang 'gyur la ma dad pa dang dad par 'dres pa'i mtshan ma 'byung bas ma 'dres pa la yang bar du gcod do //
translated: It is an obstruction to the unmixed, because if one is satisfied with mere reflection, and does not cultivate insight, then the meaning to be seen by cultivation will be stolen by others. And it is an obstruction to the unmixed, because if one does not repeatedly cultivate and familiarize oneself with the unmixed, then one‚Äôs interest will be stolen by others, and the signs of a mixture of lack of faith and faith will arise.

original: mi skyo ba dang zhes bya ba la theg pa chung du'i mos pa la ni 'khor ba'i mtha'i rkyen gyis mi skyo bar bar du gcod de 'khor ba'i chos kyis mi skyo ba med de 'khor bar dga' nas 'khor ba las 'das pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa
analyzed: mi skyo ba dang zhes bya ba la theg pa chung du'i mos pa la ni 'khor ba'i mtha'i rkyen gyis mi skyo bar bar du gcod de 'khor ba'i chos kyis mi skyo ba med de 'khor bar dga' nas 'khor ba las 'das pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa
translated: Not being discouraged means that interest in the Basic Vehicle is interrupted by discouragement at the length of time it takes to reach the end of samsara. Without being discouraged by the phenomena of samsara, one is not interested in samsara and so one does not transcend samsara to attain nirvana.

original: mi 'thob pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin du skye zhes bya ba la /üîΩrgya chen po theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa la ni 'khor bar skyo bar bar du gcod de /
analyzed: mi 'thob pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin du skye zhes bya ba la / rgya chen po theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa la ni 'khor bar skyo bar bar du gcod de /
translated: Non-discouragement is an obstruction to interest in the Great Vehicle, because one is discouraged by the length of time required for the bodhisattva stages and the perfections to be completed.

original: 'khor bar skyo bar 'gyur pa na 'khor ba na bdag dang gzhan gyi don mi byed cing mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor bar skyo bar 'gyur pa na 'khor ba na bdag dang gzhan gyi don mi byed cing mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Discouragement is an obstruction to interest in the extensive Dharma of the Great Vehicle, because one is discouraged by samsara and does not work for the sake of oneself and others in samsara, but rather for the sake of nirvana.

original: ma bsgribs pa'i mos pa ni bsgribs pa'i mos pas bar du gcod de /
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa'i mos pa ni bsgribs pa'i mos pas bar du gcod de /
translated: Unimpeded interest is obstructed by impeded interest.

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa drod nas sa bcu man chad du khyad par du 'gro ba'i mos pa la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i mos pa yod par gyur na sgrib pa med pa'i mos pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa drod nas sa bcu man chad du khyad par du 'gro ba'i mos pa la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i mos pa yod par gyur na sgrib pa med pa'i mos pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The interest of those on the stage of action in faith, from the stage of heat up to the tenth stage, is superior. But if it is accompanied by attachment and hostility, interest free from obscurations does not occur.

original: mi ldan pa zhas bya ba la ldan pa'i mos pa la ni mi ldan pa'i mos pa bar du gcod de /üîΩgus par byed pa med pa dang / rtag par byed pa med pa'i mos pa byung na gus pa dang bcas pa dang / @150a * //
analyzed: mi ldan pa zhas bya ba la ldan pa'i mos pa la ni mi ldan pa'i mos pa bar du gcod de / gus par byed pa med pa dang / rtag par byed pa med pa'i mos pa byung na gus pa dang bcas pa dang / @150a * //
translated: Interest not associated with faith is an obstruction to interest associated with faith.

original: rtag pa dang bcas pa'i mos pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang bcas pa'i mos pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If interest without respect and without constancy occurs, interest with respect and with constancy does not occur.

original: tshogs rnams bsags pa dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mos pa ni tshogs ma bsags pas bar du gcod de /
analyzed: tshogs rnams bsags pa dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mos pa ni tshogs ma bsags pas bar du gcod de /
translated: Interest in the accumulation of the collections is an obstruction to interest in the non-accumulation of the collections.

original: sa dang po thob par 'gyur pa'i rgyu bskal ba grangs med pa gcig tu bsod nams dang ye shes bsags pa med nas dang por chos kyi dbyings rtogs par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bskal pa grangs med pa gcig tu bsags pa'i tshogs dang
analyzed: sa dang po thob par 'gyur pa'i rgyu bskal ba grangs med pa gcig tu bsod nams dang ye shes bsags pa med nas dang por chos kyi dbyings rtogs par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bskal pa grangs med pa gcig tu bsags pa'i tshogs dang
translated: Without having accumulated merit and wisdom for one measureless kalpa, the cause for attaining the first bhumi, they will accumulate the accumulations of merit and wisdom for one measureless kalpa, which is the cause for realizing the dharmadhatu for the first time.üîΩ

original: mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not have the equipment of merit and wisdom which is the cause of attaining the first stage, having accumulated merit and wisdom for one incalculable eon, and because they do not have the equipment of merit and wisdom which is accumulated for one incalculable eon, beginning with the realization of the Dharma element.

original: mos pa'i bar du gcod par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba la yid mi bde ba mang po nas brtsams te /
analyzed: mos pa'i bar du gcod par bya // zhes bya ba la yid mi bde ba mang po nas brtsams te /
translated: The obstructions to interest

original: tshogs ma bsags pa'i bar du ni 'di dag mos pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i bar du gcod pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshogs ma bsags pa'i bar du ni 'di dag mos pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i bar du gcod pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The obstructions to the various kinds of interest should be understood as beginning with the many kinds of mental unhappiness and ending with the lack of equipment.üîΩFive verses on the virtues of interest

original: mos pa'i yon tan la tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste zhes bya ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis mos pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan /
analyzed: mos pa'i yon tan la tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste zhes bya ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis mos pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan /
translated: Two verses show the varieties of interest;

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis mos pa'i bar du gcod pa bstan te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis mos pa'i bar du gcod pa bstan te /
translated: three verses show the obstructions to interest.

original: da ni tshigs su bcad pa lngas mos pa'i yon tan rab tu phye ba la bar chad de dag gis bar du gcod par ma byas na mos pa yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ston to zhes bya ba'i yon tan no //
analyzed: da ni tshigs su bcad pa lngas mos pa'i yon tan rab tu phye ba la bar chad de dag gis bar du gcod par ma byas na mos pa yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ston to zhes bya ba'i yon tan no //
translated: Now, in five verses, the qualities of interest are distinguished. It is shown that if one is not obstructed by those obstructions, interest becomes endowed with good qualities.

original: bsod nams che zhing zhes bya ba la skyes pa'i mos pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bsod nams che zhing zhes bya ba la skyes pa'i mos pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is a great merit, etc. There are two kinds of generated interest:

original: da ltar gyi mos pa dang 'das pa'i mos pa gnyis las /
analyzed: da ltar gyi mos pa dang 'das pa'i mos pa gnyis las /
translated: present interest and past interest.

original: da ltar gyi mos pa la ni bsod nams che ba'i yon tan 'thob ste /
analyzed: da ltar gyi mos pa la ni bsod nams che ba'i yon tan 'thob ste /
translated: Present interest is endowed with the quality of great merit.

original: da ltar gyi dus na theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa skyes ma thag tu bsod nams kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus na theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa skyes ma thag tu bsod nams kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, in the present, as soon as one generates interest in the teaching of the universal vehicle, the collection of merit increases immeasurably.

original: 'gyod pa med pa'i bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gyod pa med pa'i bya ba la /
translated: It is a deed without regret.

original: 'das pa'i mos pa ni 'gyod pa med pa'i yon tan 'thob ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i mos pa ni 'gyod pa med pa'i yon tan 'thob ste /
translated: Past interest is endowed with the quality of being without regret.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngon theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa byug ba mthong na dga' ba'i khyad par skye ba'i sems gdung ba mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa byug ba mthong na dga' ba'i khyad par skye ba'i sems gdung ba mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because in the past, when he saw someone who was devoted to the Mahayana teachings, he did not generate the mental anguish of jealousy.

original: yid bde ba chen po ste zhes bya ba la gzung ba'i mos pa dang / 'dzin pa'i mos pa gnyis la ni yid bde ba dang bde ba chen po'i yon tan 'thob ste /
analyzed: yid bde ba chen po ste zhes bya ba la gzung ba'i mos pa dang / 'dzin pa'i mos pa gnyis la ni yid bde ba dang bde ba chen po'i yon tan 'thob ste /
translated: Great mental well-being means that one who is devoted to the object to be grasped and the subject that grasps it attains the qualities of mental well-being and great bliss.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gzung ba'i dngos po la dngos por ma chags pa de kho na phyogs gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba thob pas yid bde ba'i yon tan 'thob bo //
analyzed: gzung ba'i dngos po la dngos por ma chags pa de kho na phyogs gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba thob pas yid bde ba'i yon tan 'thob bo //
translated: One who is not attached to the object to be grasped as a real thing attains the quality of mental well-being by attaining the bliss of one-pointed concentration on that very thing.

original: 'dzin pa la dngos po la chags pa spangs na de ma thag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba 'thob ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa la dngos po la chags pa spangs na de ma thag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba 'thob ste /
translated: One who abandons attachment to the subject that grasps as a real thing attains the bliss of the immediately subsequent concentration.

original: de bas na bde ba chen @150b po'i yon tan 'thob bo //
analyzed: de bas na bde ba chen @150b po'i yon tan 'thob bo //
translated: Therefore, one attains the quality of great bliss.

original: chud mi za dang zhes bya ba la grogs las blangs pa'i mos pa la bar du gcod pa rnams kyis bar chad ma byas pa chud mi za ba'i yon tan 'thob ste /
analyzed: chud mi za dang zhes bya ba la grogs las blangs pa'i mos pa la bar du gcod pa rnams kyis bar chad ma byas pa chud mi za ba'i yon tan 'thob ste /
translated: The line and non-wastage means that if the interest that one has taken up from a friend is not interrupted by hindrances, one acquires the quality of non-wastage.

original: 'gyur ba med pa dang / nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa dang / nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is immutable and does not deteriorate.

original: brtan pa dang zhes bya ba la bdag nyid kyi mos pa la bar du gcod pa rnams kyis bar chad ma byas na brtan pa'i yon tan 'thob bo //
analyzed: brtan pa dang zhes bya ba la bdag nyid kyi mos pa la bar du gcod pa rnams kyis bar chad ma byas na brtan pa'i yon tan 'thob bo //
translated: The line and firmness means that if the interest that one has taken up oneself is not interrupted by hindrances, one acquires the quality of firmness.

original: nyams pa dang med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩkhyad par 'gro dang de bzhin du //
analyzed: nyams pa dang med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // khyad par 'gro dang de bzhin du //
translated: Because it does not deteriorate and does not disappear.

original: zhes bya ba la nor pa med pa dang / mngon du ba dang / sgra spyod pa dang / tshol ba dang / lta ba dang / 'phrogs pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i mos pa rnams la gal te de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bar du ma bcad na khyad par du 'gro ba'i yon tan 'thob ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la nor pa med pa dang / mngon du ba dang / sgra spyod pa dang / tshol ba dang / lta ba dang / 'phrogs pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i mos pa rnams la gal te de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bar du ma bcad na khyad par du 'gro ba'i yon tan 'thob ste /
translated: The line and progress means that if the interest that one has in the absence of error, manifestation, verbal expression, investigation, view, appropriation, and unadulterated interest is not interrupted by their adverse elements, one acquires the quality of progress.

original: nor pa med pa'i mos pa la ni nor bas par chad ma byas na nor ba med pa 'bring las nor ba med pa chen po skye bar 'gyur ba dang / mngon du ba la bag med bar bar chad ma byas na mngon du ba 'bring las mngon du ba chen po skye bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: nor pa med pa'i mos pa la ni nor bas par chad ma byas na nor ba med pa 'bring las nor ba med pa chen po skye bar 'gyur ba dang / mngon du ba la bag med bar bar chad ma byas na mngon du ba 'bring las mngon du ba chen po skye bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: And in regard to manifest interest, if it is not obstructed by heedlessness, then from medium manifest interest, great manifest interest arises.

original: de bzhin lhag ma rnams la yang bar du gcod pas bar chad ma byas na 'bring las chen po skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin lhag ma rnams la yang bar du gcod pas bar chad ma byas na 'bring las chen po skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And so for the rest, if they are not obstructed by their respective obstructions, then from medium interest, great interest arises.

original: chos rnams mngon par rtogs pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos rnams mngon par rtogs pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: In regard to the clear realization of the Dharma,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis ma 'dres pa'i mos pa la bar du gcod pa'i chos kyis bar chad ma byas na chos rnams mngon par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis ma 'dres pa'i mos pa la bar du gcod pa'i chos kyis bar chad ma byas na chos rnams mngon par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: if interest that is unadulterated by counteragents is not obstructed by factors that obstruct it, then the Dharma is clearly realized.

original: sa dang por 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa dang por 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that one attains the first stage.

original: bdag dang gzhan don thob pa'i mchog / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan don thob pa'i mchog / ces bya ba la /
translated: In regard to the attainment of the highest good of self and other,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa la mos pa la bar du gcod pas bar chad ma byas na bdag gis don mchog thob par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa la mos pa la bar du gcod pas bar chad ma byas na bdag gis don mchog thob par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If there is no obstacle to the interest of the disciples, one attains the supreme goal.

original: theg pa chen po mos pa la bar du gcod pas bar chad ma byas na bdag dang gzhan gyi don mchog 'thob par 'gyur te mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: theg pa chen po mos pa la bar du gcod pas bar chad ma byas na bdag dang gzhan gyi don mchog 'thob par 'gyur te mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If there is no obstacle to the interest in the Great Vehicle, one attains the supreme goal of oneself and others, i.e. one attains the nirvana that is not a state of inactivity.

original: mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba la sgrib pa med pa'i mos pa dang ldan pa'i mos pa dang / tshogs bsags pa'i mos pa dang / brtan par zhugs pa'i mos pa dang / ring du song ba'i mos pa rnams la bar du gcod pa'i chos kyis bar chad ma byas na mngon par shes pa myur pa'i yon tan 'thob ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba la sgrib pa med pa'i mos pa dang ldan pa'i mos pa dang / tshogs bsags pa'i mos pa dang / brtan par zhugs pa'i mos pa dang / ring du song ba'i mos pa rnams la bar du gcod pa'i chos kyis bar chad ma byas na mngon par shes pa myur pa'i yon tan 'thob ste /
translated: As for the superknowledges, if there is no obstacle to the interest that is associated with unobstructed interest, to the interest that is the accumulation of the stores, to the interest that is the entry into stability, and to the interest that is the far-reaching step, then one attains the quality of swift superknowledge.

original: sgrib pa med pa dang ldan pa dang tshogs bsags pa gsum gyis dang po rno ba'i mchog thob /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa dang ldan pa dang tshogs bsags pa gsum gyis dang po rno ba'i mchog thob /
translated: By means of the three, i.e. the unobstructed, the accumulation of the stores, and the entry into stability, one attains the first, i.e. the sharpest.

original: @151a * // brtan par zhugs pa dang / ring du song ba nyid kyis myur du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @151a * // brtan par zhugs pa dang / ring du song ba nyid kyis myur du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that one attains the gnosis of omniscience quickly by entering the stages of firm abiding and going far.

original: de dag ni mos par mi 'gyur ba'i yon tan no zhes bya ba la bsod nams che ba nas mngon par shes pa myur ba'i bar dag gi yon tan bshad pa de dag ni mos pa rab tu dbye ba'i yon tan yin no zhes bya ba'i don to
analyzed: de dag ni mos par mi 'gyur ba'i yon tan no zhes bya ba la bsod nams che ba nas mngon par shes pa myur ba'i bar dag gi yon tan bshad pa de dag ni mos pa rab tu dbye ba'i yon tan yin no zhes bya ba'i don to
translated: These are the qualities of non-degeneration. The qualities explained from great merit up to quick superknowledge are the qualities of the distinctions of interest.

original: // de yan chad du mos pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba dang / mos pa'i bar du gcod pa dang / mos pa'i yon tan bstan nas de tshigs su bcad pa gsum dang rkang pa gcig gis 'jig rten pa'i mos pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mos pa pas byang chub sems dpa'i mos pa khyad zhugs par bstan nas de nas theg pa chen po'i mos pa sgrub dgos pa ston te /
analyzed: // de yan chad du mos pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba dang / mos pa'i bar du gcod pa dang / mos pa'i yon tan bstan nas de tshigs su bcad pa gsum dang rkang pa gcig gis 'jig rten pa'i mos pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mos pa pas byang chub sems dpa'i mos pa khyad zhugs par bstan nas de nas theg pa chen po'i mos pa sgrub dgos pa ston te /
translated: From here on, after teaching the characteristics, distinctions, hindrances to interest, and qualities of interest in three verses and one quarter, he teaches the superiority of the bodhisattva's interest over worldly interest and transcendent interest in three verses and one quarter. Then, he teaches the necessity of accomplishing interest in the Great Vehicle.

original: de la yang dang po'i tshigs bcad gcig gis ni don mdo tsam du bstan /
analyzed: de la yang dang po'i tshigs bcad gcig gis ni don mdo tsam du bstan /
translated: The first verse presents the meaning in brief;

original: de'i lhag ma rnams kyis don de nyid zhib tu 'chad do //
analyzed: de'i lhag ma rnams kyis don de nyid zhib tu 'chad do //
translated: the remaining verses explain that very meaning in detail.

original: de bas mos pa'i rjes la chos btsal ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas mos pa'i rjes la chos btsal ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, after interest, the section on the investigation of the Dharma is begun.

original: dmigs pa'ang yongs su tshol ba tshigs su @154b bcad pa bzhi'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa'ang yongs su tshol ba tshigs su @154b bcad pa bzhi'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The investigation of the object is four verses.

original: chos btsal ba la yang rnam pa gsum btsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: chos btsal ba la yang rnam pa gsum btsal bar bya ste /
translated: The investigation of the Dharma is also to be investigated in three ways.

original: dmigs pa yongs su btsal ba dang / dmigs pa rnyed pa yongs su btsal ba dang / yid la byed pa yongs su btsal ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa yongs su btsal ba dang / dmigs pa rnyed pa yongs su btsal ba dang / yid la byed pa yongs su btsal ba'o //
translated: The investigation of the object, the investigation of the discovery of the object, and the investigation of mental attention.

original: de las nyan pa'i shes rab dang / bsam pa'i shes rab dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis yul gang la dmigs par bya ba'i dmigs pa rje btsal te /
analyzed: de las nyan pa'i shes rab dang / bsam pa'i shes rab dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis yul gang la dmigs par bya ba'i dmigs pa rje btsal te /
translated: The object is investigated by the wisdom of listening, the wisdom of reflection, and the wisdom of meditation.

original: yul 'di ni dmigs par bya'o zhes shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis dmigs par bya ba'i yul btsal ba bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa bzhi rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul 'di ni dmigs par bya'o zhes shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis dmigs par bya ba'i yul btsal ba bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa bzhi rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The four verses are composed in order to demonstrate the object of investigation by the three kinds of wisdom, i.e., ‚ÄúThis is the object of investigation.‚Äù

original: sde snod dag ni gsum mam gnyis kyang rung //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sde snod dag ni gsum mam gnyis kyang rung // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: shes rab rnam gsum gyis dmigs par bya ba'i yul ni rgya cher bshad na sde snod gsum gyi chos dag ste /
translated: The object of investigation by the three kinds of wisdom is the Dharma of the three collections, if explained extensively.

analyzed: sde snod gsum ni mdo sde'i sde snod dang / 'dul ba'i sde snod dang / mngon pa'i sde snod do //

original: dmigs par bya ba'i yul mdor bstan na ni theg pa chung du dang / theg pa mchog gi bye brag dang / sde snod rnam pa gnyis su gzhag ste /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i yul mdor bstan na ni theg pa chung du dang / theg pa mchog gi bye brag dang / sde snod rnam pa gnyis su gzhag ste /
translated: The object of meditation is briefly indicated as the Lesser Vehicle and the Great Vehicle, and as the two collections of scriptures.

original: nyan thos kyi sde snod dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod do //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sde snod dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod do //
translated: The collection of scriptures of the Disciples and the collection of scriptures of the Bodhisattvas.

original: de la gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis la shin tu rgyas pa dang / skyes pa rabs kyi sde snod ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis la shin tu rgyas pa dang / skyes pa rabs kyi sde snod ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ces bya'o //
translated: The Vaipulya and the Jataka collections of scriptures are called the collection of scriptures of the Bodhisattvas.

original: lhag ma rnams las phal cher ni nyan thos kyi sde snod de /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams las phal cher ni nyan thos kyi sde snod de /
translated: The rest of the scriptures are for the most part the collection of scriptures of the Disciples.

original: phal cher smos pa ni lhag ma la theg pa chen po dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i chos can thun mong du gyur pa'ang yod par ston to //
analyzed: phal cher smos pa ni lhag ma la theg pa chen po dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i chos can thun mong du gyur pa'ang yod par ston to //
translated: The expression for the most part indicates that there are some scriptures common to both the Great Vehicle and the Disciple Vehicle.

original: ci'i phyir gsum po dang / gnyis po de dag la sde snod ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gsum po dang / gnyis po de dag la sde snod ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why are these three and these two called collections?

original: de'i phyir bsdu ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsdu ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are collections.

original: dper na snod gang du 'bru bre bcu shong zhing 'dus pa'i snod de la snod ces bya ba dang 'dra bar gsum po dang gnyis po 'dir yang gsung rab yang lag bcu gnyis kyi don dang tshig thams cad 'dus pas sde snod ces bya'o //
analyzed: dper na snod gang du 'bru bre bcu shong zhing 'dus pa'i snod de la snod ces bya ba dang 'dra bar gsum po dang gnyis po 'dir yang gsung rab yang lag bcu gnyis kyi don dang tshig thams cad 'dus pas sde snod ces bya'o //
translated: For example, just as a container that can hold ten measures of grain is called a ‚Äúmeasure,‚Äù so too, since all the meanings and words of the twelve branches of excellent speech are included in these three or two, they are called ‚Äúbaskets.‚Äù

original: yang na phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi chos nas sku dang ye shes la sogs pa'i bar du shes par bya ba'i don thams cad 'dus pas ni de'i phyir sde snod ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi chos nas sku dang ye shes la sogs pa'i bar du shes par bya ba'i don thams cad 'dus pas ni de'i phyir sde snod ces bya'o //
translated: Or, since all the meanings to be known, from the phenomena of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases up to the bodies and gnoses, are included in them, they are called ‚Äúbaskets.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir sde snod gsum du gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sde snod gsum du gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are they posited as three baskets?

original: de'i phyir rgyu yang dgur 'dod do //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu yang dgur 'dod do // zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, nine causes are asserted.

original: sde snod gsum du bzhag na ni rgyu rnam pa gu'i phyir sde snod gsum du gzhag par 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩsde snod gsum du gzhag pa la @155a * //
analyzed: sde snod gsum du bzhag na ni rgyu rnam pa gu'i phyir sde snod gsum du gzhag par 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to // sde snod gsum du gzhag pa la @155a * //
translated: If the baskets are posited as three, they are posited as three baskets for nine types of causes.

original: dgos pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: dgos pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of positing three baskets?

original: de'i phyir rnam par grol zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par grol zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, liberation is stated.

original: sde snod gsum du gzhag pa ni sems can rnams 'khor ba las 'byung zhing mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas thob par bya ba'i phyir sde snod gsum du gzhag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sde snod gsum du gzhag pa ni sems can rnams 'khor ba las 'byung zhing mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas thob par bya ba'i phyir sde snod gsum du gzhag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The three scriptural collections are established for the purpose of causing sentient beings to emerge from cyclic existence and attain nirvana, and to attain buddhahood.

original: ji ltar grol bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar grol bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one become liberated?

original: de'i phyir / bag chags shes byed zhi bar byed pa dang // rab tu rtogs par zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bag chags shes byed zhi bar byed pa dang // rab tu rtogs par zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúthe elimination of the object of habitual tendencies, and complete realization.

original: rnam par grol bar byed pa ni sde snod gsum mnyan pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis rnam par grol bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par grol bar byed pa ni sde snod gsum mnyan pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis rnam par grol bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Liberation is accomplished by the wisdom arisen from listening, reflection, and meditation on the three scriptural collections.

original: de la mnyan pa'i shes rab kyis ni bag chags su byed /
analyzed: de la mnyan pa'i shes rab kyis ni bag chags su byed /
translated: By the wisdom arisen from listening, one creates habitual tendencies.

original: nam thos pa'i dus na chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i mos pa'i bag chags 'jog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam thos pa'i dus na chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i mos pa'i bag chags 'jog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at the time of listening, one establishes the habitual tendencies of interest arisen from the cause of the pure realm of phenomena.

original: bsam pa'i shes rab kyis ni shes par byed /
analyzed: bsam pa'i shes rab kyis ni shes par byed /

original: de ji lta ji ltar bsam pa de lta de ltar de dag gi don rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ji lta ji ltar bsam pa de lta de ltar de dag gi don rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one understands the meaning of the teachings just as one has reflected on them.

original: chos rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab can ni bsgom pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab can ni bsgom pa la 'jug ste /
translated: The wise one who possesses the realization of the teachings enters into meditation.

original: bsgom pa la zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid zhi gnas 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa la zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid zhi gnas 'thob par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: zhi gnas kyi stobs kyis ni nyon mongs pa zhi bar byed de nyon mongs pa rnams 'jil bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob pas sems rtse gcig tu gyur na lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid kyi shes rab skye bar 'gyur te /

original: shes rab kyis ni bden pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni bden pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed de /
translated: By wisdom, one realizes the truth just as it is.

original: bden pa rtogs na mthong ba dang bsgom pas spangs bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rtsa ba nas 'byin pas na de ltar rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa rtogs na mthong ba dang bsgom pas spangs bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rtsa ba nas 'byin pas na de ltar rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one realizes the truth, one becomes completely liberated, because one uproots the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of cultivation.

original: rgyu dgu'i phyir te zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rgyu dgu'i phyir te zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: For nine reasons. There are three kinds of afflictions:

original: the tshom nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / 'dod pa la chags pas rjes su sbyor ba'i mtha' dang / bdag ngal ba la rjes su sbyor ba mtha'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / bdag nyid lta ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang lnga ste /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag spangs pa'i phyir sde snod gsum bshad de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The three collections are explained for the sake of abandoning those afflictions.

original: the tshom gyi gnyen po ni mdo yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: the tshom gyi gnyen po ni mdo yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The antidote to doubt is the sutra collection.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams la the tshom gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por ni mdo sde'i sde snod bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams la the tshom gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por ni mdo sde'i sde snod bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the explanation of the Sutra Pitaka is the antidote to the affliction of doubt in regard to phenomena such as the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, etc.

original: @155b ji ltar the tshom gyi gnyen por 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: @155b ji ltar the tshom gyi gnyen por 'gyur ro zhe na /

original: de'i phyir / gang don gang la the tshom za ba de la rnam par gdon mi za bar bya ba'i phung po bshad pas so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang don gang la the tshom za ba de la rnam par gdon mi za bar bya ba'i phung po bshad pas so zhes bya ba smos te /

original: gang zhes bya ba ni gang zag gang zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩdon gang la zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched de /
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni gang zag gang zhes bya ba'i don to // don gang la zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched de /

analyzed: the tshom za ba ni yin nam ma yin snyam du yid gnyis za ba'o //

analyzed: gdon mi za bar bya ba'i don ni the tshom za ba de dag gi the tshom med par byas nas /

analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid gtan la phab par shes par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: mdo sde bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: Attachment to pleasure is that which the Bhagav√•n did not permit, but which one indulges in by transgressing the verses of the precepts, in order to be attached to and intoxicated with various possessions and so on.

analyzed: ngal ba la rjes su sbyor ba'i mtha'o zhes bya ba smos te /
