analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes tshol ba tsam du zad de /
translated: Sravakas merely seek the wisdom of elimination and nonarising.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa mi tshol bas na sde snod gsum ma shes kyang zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes 'thob ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa mi tshol bas na sde snod gsum ma shes kyang zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes 'thob ste /
translated: Since they do not seek omniscience, they do not know the three scriptural collections, yet they attain the intuition of elimination and nonorigination.

original: rgyu gang gis 'thob ce na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis 'thob ce na /
translated: By what cause do they attain it?

original: tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam gyi don shes pas kyang zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes 'thob par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam gyi don shes pas kyang zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes 'thob par 'gyur ro//
translated: They attain the intuition of elimination and nonorigination by knowing the meaning of just one verse.

original: gnas rnams dang ni mtshan nyid dang // chos don ston phyir mdo yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩgnas dang mtshan nyid dang chos kyi don to //
analyzed: gnas rnams dang ni mtshan nyid dang // chos don ston phyir mdo yin no // zhes bya ba la / gnas dang mtshan nyid dang chos kyi don to //
translated: A sutra is so called because it teaches the bases, the characteristics, the teaching, and the meaning.

original: rnam pa bzhi ston pa'i phyir mdo sde zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi ston pa'i phyir mdo sde zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called a sutra because it teaches four topics:üîΩthe bases, the characteristics, the teaching, and the meaning.

original: de la gnas la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la gnas la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The bases are threefold:

original: yul gang du bshad pa dang / gang gis bshad pa dang / gang gi don du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: yul gang du bshad pa dang / gang gis bshad pa dang / gang gi don du bshad pa'o //
translated: the place where the teaching is given, the teacher, and the audience for whom the teaching is given.

original: de yang mdo sde de dag las /
analyzed: de yang mdo sde de dag las /
translated: And that is taught in those sutras.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na dge slong dang / byang chub sems dpa' mang po dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na dge slong dang / byang chub sems dpa' mang po dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus have I heard at one time the Lord was dwelling in Rajagriha with a great assembly of many thousands of monks and bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar na rgyal po'i khab la sogs pa yul gang du bshad pa de yang gnas yin par bstan to //üîΩbcom ldan 'das gang gis bshad pa'i don bstan pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyang gnas yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyal po'i khab la sogs pa yul gang du bshad pa de yang gnas yin par bstan to // bcom ldan 'das gang gis bshad pa'i don bstan pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyang gnas yin par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the place where the teaching was given, such as Rajagriha, is also taught to be the setting.üîΩThe Lord by whom the teaching was given is also taught to be the setting.

original: gang zag gang gi don du chos bshad pa'i gang zag de yang gnas yin par bstan to //
analyzed: gang zag gang gi don du chos bshad pa'i gang zag de yang gnas yin par bstan to //
translated: The person for whose benefit the teaching was given is also taught to be the setting.

original: mtshan nyid la rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩkun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan @158a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid la rnam pa gnyis te / kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan @158a * //
translated: There are two kinds of characteristics:

original: nyid dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: nyid dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: the characteristics of conventional truth and the characteristics of ultimate truth.

original: de la bum pa dang snam bu dang gang zag ces bya ba la sogs pa tshig tu brjod cing bsam du rung ba rnams ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la bum pa dang snam bu dang gang zag ces bya ba la sogs pa tshig tu brjod cing bsam du rung ba rnams ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of conventional truth is that which is suitable to be expressed in words and conceived by the mind, such as a pot, a cloth, a person, and so on.

original: brjod du mi rung zhing bsam du mi rung ba rnams ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: brjod du mi rung zhing bsam du mi rung ba rnams ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of ultimate truth is that which is not suitable to be expressed in words and conceived by the mind.

original: yang brjod pa dang brjod pa las gzhan pa'i dbang po spyod yul du gyur pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang brjod pa dang brjod pa las gzhan pa'i dbang po spyod yul du gyur pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, that which is the domain of the sense faculties, other than what is expressed in words, is called conventional truth.

original: brjod pa las gzhan pa la mi ltos pa ni dbang po spyod yul du ma gyur pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa las gzhan pa la mi ltos pa ni dbang po spyod yul du ma gyur pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which does not depend on what is expressed in words, and is not the domain of the sense faculties, is called ultimate truth.

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa ni dmigs pa'i yul du gyur pa rnams ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa ni dmigs pa'i yul du gyur pa rnams ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, that which is the object of observation of affliction is called conventional truth.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The dharmadhatu and nonconceptual wisdom are called ultimate truth.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang zas bzhi dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la sogs pa ni chos zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang zas bzhi dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la sogs pa ni chos zhes bya ste /
translated: The aggregates, elements, sense bases, four nutriments, dependent origination, etc. are called phenomena.

original: zas bzhi ni kham gyi zas dang / re ba dang / yid la byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i zas so //
analyzed: zas bzhi ni kham gyi zas dang / re ba dang / yid la byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i zas so //
translated: The four nutriments are: oral food, contact, mental volition, and consciousness.

original: dgongs pa bzhi pa ni don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa bzhi pa ni don zhes bya'o //
translated: The fourth intention is called the meaning.

original: mngon du ni rgyun mi 'chad /
analyzed: mngon du ni rgyun mi 'chad /
translated: The manifest is the uninterrupted.

original: zil gnon rtogs phyir mngon pa'i chos //
analyzed: zil gnon rtogs phyir mngon pa'i chos //
translated: The manifest teaching is for the sake of overcoming and realization.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: mngon pa'i chos ston pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par ston pa dang zil gyis gnon pa dang / rtogs par byed pas mngon pa'i chos zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon pa'i chos ston pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par ston pa dang zil gyis gnon pa dang / rtogs par byed pas mngon pa'i chos zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the manifest teaching is called the manifest teaching because it teaches the manifest, it teaches uninterruptedly, it overcomes, and it causes realization.

original: de la bden pa bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la sogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bstan pas chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos mngon du byed pas na mngon pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la bden pa bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la sogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bstan pas chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos mngon du byed pas na mngon pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: The Abhidharma is so called because it teaches the path to nirvana, such as the four noble truths, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the three doors of liberation, etc., and because it makes the dharmas of nirvana manifest.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa ni rnam pa mang po'i don te /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa ni rnam pa mang po'i don te /
translated: The term ‚Äúcontinuously‚Äù has many meanings.

original: chos gcig pa yang gzugs yod pa dang / gzugs med pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa dang / bltar yod pa dang / bltar med pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa mang du 'chad pa'i phyir mngon pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos gcig pa yang gzugs yod pa dang / gzugs med pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa dang / bltar yod pa dang / bltar med pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa mang du 'chad pa'i phyir mngon pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the Abhidharma because it explains a single dharma in many ways, such as ‚Äúform exists‚Äù and ‚Äúform does not exist,‚Äù ‚Äúform is visible‚Äù and ‚Äúform is invisible,‚Äù ‚Äúform is perceptible‚Äù and ‚Äúform is imperceptible,‚Äù etc.

original: mngon pa'i chos la mkhas na rtsod pa dang rtsod pa'i gzhi la sogs pa la mkhas pas rtsod pa thams cad zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: mngon pa'i chos la mkhas na rtsod pa dang rtsod pa'i gzhi la sogs pa la mkhas pas rtsod pa thams cad zhi bar byed do //
translated: If one is skilled in the Abhidharma, one will be skilled in debate and the basis of debate, etc., and will be able to pacify all disputes.

original: phas kyi rgol ba zil gyis gnon pas na mngon pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba zil gyis gnon pas na mngon pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called Abhidharma because it overwhelms opponents.

original: mngon pa'i chos la mkhas na mdo sde rnams kyi don rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon pa'i chos la mkhas na mdo sde rnams kyi don rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If one is skilled in the Abhidharma, one will understand the meaning of the s≈´tras.

original: @158b mdo sde'i don rtogs par byed ba'i phyir mngon pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @158b mdo sde'i don rtogs par byed ba'i phyir mngon pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called Abhidharma because it causes one to understand the meaning of the s≈´tras.

original: ltung ba skye dang bslang ba dang // dbyung ba'i chos ni 'dul ba sta //
analyzed: ltung ba skye dang bslang ba dang // dbyung ba'i chos ni 'dul ba sta //
translated: The Dharma of downfalls, origination, lifting, and expulsion is the Vinaya.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩgang na ltung bas dang ltung ba skye ba dang / bslang ba dang dbyung ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / gang na ltung bas dang ltung ba skye ba dang / bslang ba dang dbyung ba ste /
translated: As it is said.üîΩIn the Vinaya, the four dharmas of downfalls, the origination of downfalls, lifting, and expulsion occur.

original: chos rnam pa bzhi 'byung bas de la 'dul pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos rnam pa bzhi 'byung bas de la 'dul pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is called Vinaya.

original: gang zag dang ni bcas pa dang // rab tu dbye ba nges pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang zag dang ni bcas pa dang // rab tu dbye ba nges pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of persons, inclusion, and classification,

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩrnam pa gzhan du yang gang zag dang bcas pa dang / rnam par dbye ba yang des pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / rnam pa gzhan du yang gang zag dang bcas pa dang / rnam par dbye ba yang des pa ste /
translated: it is the Vinaya.

original: chos rnam pa bzhi 'byung ba la 'dul ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos rnam pa bzhi 'byung ba la 'dul ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In another way, it is called Vinaya because of the four dharmas of persons, inclusion, and classification.

original: de la ltung ba ni ltung ba'i sde lnga'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ni ltung ba'i sde lnga'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The downfalls are the five classes of downfalls.

original: ltung ba sde lnga ni phas pham pa dang / dge 'dun gyi lhag ma dang / nyes pa sbom po dang / so sor bshags pa dang / ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba sde lnga ni phas pham pa dang / dge 'dun gyi lhag ma dang / nyes pa sbom po dang / so sor bshags pa dang / ltung ba'o //
translated: The five classes of downfalls are: the defeating offenses, the residual faults, the serious faults, the offenses to be specifically confessed, and the downfalls.

original: ltung ba skye ba ni mi shes pa dang / bag med pa dang nyon mongs pa mang ba dang / ma gus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ltung ba skye ba ni mi shes pa dang / bag med pa dang nyon mongs pa mang ba dang / ma gus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The arising of downfalls is due to ignorance, carelessness, great afflictions, and lack of respect.

original: rgyu bzhi las ltung ba skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu bzhi las ltung ba skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Downfalls arise from four causes.

original: rgyu bzhi ni mi shes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu bzhi ni mi shes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The four causes are ignorance, etc.

original: de la mi shes pa ni ci tsam gyis ni phas pham par 'gyur /
analyzed: de la mi shes pa ni ci tsam gyis ni phas pham par 'gyur /
translated: Among them, ignorance is not knowing how much is required for a defeating offense,

original: ci tsam gyis ni ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci tsam gyis ni ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: how much is required for a downfall,

original: phas pham pa ni gang ltung ba ni gang yin pa mi shes pas ltung ba skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phas pham pa ni gang ltung ba ni gang yin pa mi shes pas ltung ba skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: what is a defeating offense, and what is a downfall.

original: bag med pa ni byis pa dang bu mo dang khyim na gnas pa dag dang / bya ba ngan pa dag la zhugs pas ltung ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bag med pa ni byis pa dang bu mo dang khyim na gnas pa dag dang / bya ba ngan pa dag la zhugs pas ltung ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Carelessness is the arising of downfalls due to being engaged in childish activities, in women, and in household affairs.

original: nyon mongs pa mang ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa shas che bas nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur nas ltung ba byung ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mang ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa shas che bas nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur nas ltung ba byung ba'o //
translated: Those with many afflictions are those who have fallen due to being under the influence of afflictions, such as strong attachment and aversion.

original: ma gus pa ni dang po nyid tshangs par spyod pa nyid 'dod pa'i phyir rab tu byung ba ni ma yin gyi rgyal po'am rkun po la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa'am 'tsho ba tsam gyi don du rab tu byung bas bslab pa blangs nas yang tshul khrims la ma
analyzed: ma gus pa ni dang po nyid tshangs par spyod pa nyid 'dod pa'i phyir rab tu byung ba ni ma yin gyi rgyal po'am rkun po la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa'am 'tsho ba tsam gyi don du rab tu byung bas bslab pa blangs nas yang tshul khrims la ma
translated: Those with disrespect are those who do not first desire pure conduct, but go forth due to fear of kings, thieves, and so on, or for the sake of mere livelihood. Having taken the precepts, they are disrespectful to ethics,

original: gus te / tshod yod par 'dzin pa dang le lo byed pas ltung ba byung bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gus te / tshod yod par 'dzin pa dang le lo byed pas ltung ba byung bar gyur pa'o //
translated: holding to moderation and being lazy, and so they fall.

original: bslang ba ni bsam pa ste /
analyzed: bslang ba ni bsam pa ste /
translated: Those who are restored are those who are restored by intention

original: chad pa'i las kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chad pa'i las kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: but not by the act of punishment.

original: chad pa'i las kyis nyes pa las thar bar byed pa las ni 'byung bar zhes bya ba'i ltung ba dang nyes pa la sogs pa gang byung na sems kyis 'gyod pa bskyed cing phyin chad mi bya bar bsdams pas nyes pa las thar bar gyur pa la ming
analyzed: chad pa'i las kyis nyes pa las thar bar byed pa las ni 'byung bar zhes bya ba'i ltung ba dang nyes pa la sogs pa gang byung na sems kyis 'gyod pa bskyed cing phyin chad mi bya bar bsdams pas nyes pa las thar bar gyur pa la ming
translated: The origin of the training is the origin of the downfalls and faults. When any downfalls or faults occur, one should arouse regret in one's mind and restrain oneself from further transgressions. By this means one is freed from faults.

original: du bslab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: du bslab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called training.

original: dbyung ba ni rnam pa bdun te zhes bya ba la /üîΩltung ba sde lnga las gang yang rung ba de las byung ba'i @159a * //üîΩthabs rnam pa bdun yod de /
analyzed: dbyung ba ni rnam pa bdun te zhes bya ba la / ltung ba sde lnga las gang yang rung ba de las byung ba'i @159a * // thabs rnam pa bdun yod de /
translated: The cessation of the training is the seven means of cessation.

original: rnam pa bdun ni so sor bshags pa dang / chad pa las khas len pa dang / bsgyur ba dang / dgrol ba dang / gnas yongs su gyur pa dang / yang dag par so sor rtog pa dang chos nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun ni so sor bshags pa dang / chad pa las khas len pa dang / bsgyur ba dang / dgrol ba dang / gnas yongs su gyur pa dang / yang dag par so sor rtog pa dang chos nyid thob pa'o //
translated: The seven means of cessation are confession, accepting the penalty, changing one's behavior, being dismissed from the order, changing one's status, right conceptualization, and attaining the real nature.

original: de la so sor bshags pa dang zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: de la so sor bshags pa dang zhes bya ba la ;
translated: The confession of downfalls is to confess them to one's preceptor or another monk.üîΩ The acceptance of the penalty is to accept the penalty imposed by the community for one's downfall.

original: ltung ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa byung ba na dge slong gcig gam gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi la sogs pa'i mdun du mthol nas nyes pa las thar bar byed ba ni so sor bshags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa byung ba na dge slong gcig gam gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi la sogs pa'i mdun du mthol nas nyes pa las thar bar byed ba ni so sor bshags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When a transgression such as a downfall occurs, one confesses it in the presence of one, two, three, or four monks, and is thereby released from the transgression. This is called confession.

original: bslab pa byin pa la sogs pa la chad pa'i las khas len pa dang zhes bya ba la dge slong 'ga' zhig gis 'dod chags kyi dbang gis rab tu gzir nas sems 'khrugs par 'gyur bzhin du mi tshangs par spyod pa'i chos byas pa las phyis 'gyod pa
analyzed: bslab pa byin pa la sogs pa la chad pa'i las khas len pa dang zhes bya ba la dge slong 'ga' zhig gis 'dod chags kyi dbang gis rab tu gzir nas sems 'khrugs par 'gyur bzhin du mi tshangs par spyod pa'i chos byas pa las phyis 'gyod pa
translated: Accepting the penalty, etc. means that if a certain monk, tormented by the power of passion, commits an impure act while his mind is disturbed, later he may feel great regret,

original: chen po skyes nas sems la gcags par gyur te nyes pa gcig tsam yang mi 'chab pa'i sems thob nas nyes pa kun bshags nas de chad pa'i las khas len du bcug la de nas bslab pa slar sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: chen po skyes nas sems la gcags par gyur te nyes pa gcig tsam yang mi 'chab pa'i sems thob nas nyes pa kun bshags nas de chad pa'i las khas len du bcug la de nas bslab pa slar sbyin par bya ste /
translated: and his mind may be tormented. If he attains a state of mind in which he does not conceal even a single transgression, he confesses all his transgressions, accepts the penalty, and then the training is given again.

original: de la chad pa'i las ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa thams cad kyi tha mar bzhag cing tha mar za ba sbyin pa dang / dge sbyong thams cad kyi dang por bzhag cing dang por bza' ba sbyin pa la sogs pa 'chad pa'i las byed du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: de la chad pa'i las ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa thams cad kyi tha mar bzhag cing tha mar za ba sbyin pa dang / dge sbyong thams cad kyi dang por bzhag cing dang por bza' ba sbyin pa la sogs pa 'chad pa'i las byed du gzhug pa'o //
translated: The action of cutting off is to make one enter the action of cutting off, such as the giving of the last portion of food to all who are fully ordained, and the giving of the first portion of food to all who are fully ordained.

original: bslab pa las rnam grangs kyi gnang ba'i phyir bsgyur ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bslab pa las rnam grangs kyi gnang ba'i phyir bsgyur ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The action of changing is because of the permission in the precepts.

original: bsgyur bas dbyung ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis phyi dro'i kha zas bza' bar mi gnang ngo zhes bslab par byed pa las rnam grangs gzhan gyis bza' bar gnang ba yang yod de lam du son pa la dus zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsgyur bas dbyung ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis phyi dro'i kha zas bza' bar mi gnang ngo zhes bslab par byed pa las rnam grangs gzhan gyis bza' bar gnang ba yang yod de lam du son pa la dus zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Changing means that there is permission to eat in another way, such as eating in the evening, although the Blessed One has prohibited eating in the evening, because of the precepts. For example, at the proper time for those who are traveling and so on.

original: dge 'dun tshogs pa bslab pa'i gnas dgrol ba'i phyir dgrol ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge 'dun tshogs pa bslab pa'i gnas dgrol ba'i phyir dgrol ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The action of releasing is for the sake of releasing the precepts of the assembled Sa·πÖgha.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Releasing means that the Blessed One said to the noble Nanda:

analyzed: de'i phyir / don gnyis kyis ni gnyis ka'i rnyed // ces bya ba smos te /

original: don gnyis kyis ni phyi nang gnyis kyi de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gnyis kyis ni phyi nang gnyis kyi de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: By two reasons, the objective reference of the reality of both the external and internal is found.

original: don gnyis kyis ni gzung ba'i don dang 'dzin pa'i don tha dad pa ma yin par mthong ba dang / 'dzin pa'i don las gzung ba'i don tha dad pa ma yin par mthong pa'o //
analyzed: don gnyis kyis ni gzung ba'i don dang 'dzin pa'i don tha dad pa ma yin par mthong ba dang / 'dzin pa'i don las gzung ba'i don tha dad pa ma yin par mthong pa'o //
translated: By two reasons, one sees that the objective reference of the perceived and the objective reference of the perceiver are not different, and one sees that the objective reference of the perceiver is not different from the objective reference of the perceived.

original: de la gal te 'dzin pa ste sems las /
analyzed: de la gal te 'dzin pa ste sems las /
translated: If one sees that the apprehended,üîΩthat is, external objects, do not exist separately from the apprehending mind,

original: gzung ba ste phyi'i yul rnams logs shig na yod pa ma yin par mthong nas sems tsam du mthong nas gzung ba'i g-yeng ba spangs pas phyi'i dmigs pa rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzung ba ste phyi'i yul rnams logs shig na yod pa ma yin par mthong nas sems tsam du mthong nas gzung ba'i g-yeng ba spangs pas phyi'i dmigs pa rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: and sees that they are mind only, one abandons distraction by the apprehended and is said to find the external objective.

original: 'di ni bzod pa'i dus na'o //üîΩgal te gzung ba ste /üîΩphyi'i yul la 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni bzod pa'i dus na'o // gal te gzung ba ste / phyi'i yul la 'dzin pa ste /
translated: This is during the time of acceptance.üîΩIf one sees that the apprehending mindüîΩand the apprehended,

original: nang gi sems tha dad pa ma yin pa mthong ste /
analyzed: nang gi sems tha dad pa ma yin pa mthong ste /
translated: that is, external objects, are not different,

original: phyi'i yul med pa bzhin du nang gi sems kyang med do zhes khong du chud nas 'dzin pa la g-yeng ba spangs pas nang gi dmigs pa rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyi'i yul med pa bzhin du nang gi sems kyang med do zhes khong du chud nas 'dzin pa la g-yeng ba spangs pas nang gi dmigs pa rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: and understands that just as there are no external objects, so there is no internal mind, one abandons distraction by the apprehender and is said to find the internal objective.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi dus na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi dus na'o //
translated: This is during the time of the supreme mundane quality.

original: phyi dang nang gnyis ka'i de bzhin nyid rnyed par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gnyis ka'i de bzhin nyid rnyed par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one find the suchness of both the external and the internal?üîΩTherefore it says:

original: de'i phyir / gnyis po dag ni mi dmigs pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gnyis po dag ni mi dmigs pa //
translated: The nonapprehension of the two

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.üîΩüîΩ

original: nang gi chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du rtogs nas snang ba gzung ba yang mi dmigs 'dzin pa yang mi dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nang gi chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du rtogs nas snang ba gzung ba yang mi dmigs 'dzin pa yang mi dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: Having realized that the internal is the characteristic of the all-pervading dharmadhatu, the appearance of the object is not perceived and the appearance of the subject is not perceived.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la gnas par 'gyur na phyi nang thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la gnas par 'gyur na phyi nang thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one abides in nondual gnosis, one is said to have found the object of observation of the suchness of all internal and external things.

original: 'di ni sa dang po'i dus na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sa dang po'i dus na'o //
translated: This is at the time of the first bhumi.

original: drod dang spyi bo'i tshe na ni phyi nang gi de bzhin nyid mngon sum du ma gyur pas dmigs pa rnyed par mi bshad do //
analyzed: drod dang spyi bo'i tshe na ni phyi nang gi de bzhin nyid mngon sum du ma gyur pas dmigs pa rnyed par mi bshad do //
translated: At the time of heat and the peak, since the suchness of internal and external things is not directly perceived, it is not explained that the object of observation is found.

original: lus la sogs pa ni phyi nang ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa ni phyi nang ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The internal and external are the body and so on.

original: lus te phung po lnga la ni nang zhes bya /
analyzed: lus te phung po lnga la ni nang zhes bya /
translated: The five aggregates, the body, are called the internal.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug la ni phyi zhes bya'o //üîΩde gnyis kyi de bzhin nyid la de gnyis so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug la ni phyi zhes bya'o // de gnyis kyi de bzhin nyid la de gnyis so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The six objects such as form are called the external.üîΩThe suchness of those two is the two.

original: phyi nang gnyis kyi de bzhin nyid rnam pa gnyis la gnyis ka'i zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyi nang gnyis kyi de bzhin nyid rnam pa gnyis la gnyis ka'i zhes bya ste /
translated: The suchness of both the internal and the external is the two.

original: phyi'i de bzhin nyid dang nang gi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: phyi'i de bzhin nyid dang nang gi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the external and the suchness of the internal.

original: smras pa de stong pa nyid ni ro gcig par zad na ni ci'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su gzhag ce na /
analyzed: smras pa de stong pa nyid ni ro gcig par zad na ni ci'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su gzhag ce na /
translated: Objection: If emptiness is just of one taste, why is it posited as twofold?

original: lan du @161b de bzhin nyid rnam pa gnyis su dbye ba med mod kyi /
analyzed: lan du @161b de bzhin nyid rnam pa gnyis su dbye ba med mod kyi /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says: Although suchness is not divided into two,

original: phyi nang gi chos chos can rnam pa gnyis su tha dad pas chos nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis su gzhag ste /
analyzed: phyi nang gi chos chos can rnam pa gnyis su tha dad pas chos nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis su gzhag ste /
translated: the reality of the two kinds of phenomena is posited as twofold because the phenomena of the internal and the external are divided into two kinds.

original: dper na bum pa'i nam mkha' dang / gnas khang gi nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa'i nam mkha' dang / gnas khang gi nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, there is the space in a vase and the space in a house.

original: gzung ba'i don nas 'dzin pa'i don tha dad pa ma yin par mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzung ba'i don nas 'dzin pa'i don tha dad pa ma yin par mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Seeing that the object of apprehension and the object of the apprehender are not different,

original: rnam par shes pa nyid gnyis lta bur rnam par snang ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid gnyis lta bur rnam par snang ste /
translated: consciousness itself appears as if it were dual.

original: gzung ba'i phyi'i yul la ma gtogs par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched byis pas btags pa lta bur logs shig na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba'i phyi'i yul la ma gtogs par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched byis pas btags pa lta bur logs shig na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Apart from the apprehended, the external object, there is no separate apprehender, such as the internal sense faculties, the eyes, etc., as imagined by the naive.

original: yul dang 'dra bar sems kyang med par mthong na nang gi dmigs pa rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yul dang 'dra bar sems kyang med par mthong na nang gi dmigs pa rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one sees that the mind is also non-existent, like the object, this is called ‚Äúattaining the internal objective support.‚Äù

original: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog gi dus na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog gi dus na'o //
translated: This is at the time of the supreme mundane state.

original: 'jig rten pa'i don las gzung ba'i don tha dad pa ma yin par mthong ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i don las gzung ba'i don tha dad pa ma yin par mthong ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚Äú Seeing that the object apprehended is not different from the object universal‚Äù means

original: sems nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i don du snang bar zad kyi sems las ma gtogs pa'i don gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes mthong na phyi'i dmigs pa rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i don du snang bar zad kyi sems las ma gtogs pa'i don gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes mthong na phyi'i dmigs pa rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: that one sees that the mind itself appears as the object such as form, etc., and that apart from the mind there is no other object. This is called ‚Äúattaining the external objective support.‚Äù

original: 'di bzod pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: 'di bzod pa'i dus na'o //
translated: This is at the time of receptivity.

original: phyi dang nang dang phyi nang thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dmigs pa rnyed pa bstan nas da ni ji ltar na chos la dmigs pa rnyed par 'gyur ba de bstan te /
analyzed: phyi dang nang dang phyi nang thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dmigs pa rnyed pa bstan nas da ni ji ltar na chos la dmigs pa rnyed par 'gyur ba de bstan te /
translated: Having explained the attainment of the objective supports of internal, external, and all internal and external suchness, now he explains how one attains the objective support of the Dharma.

original: de'i phyir / chos la dmigs pa rnyed pa ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / chos la dmigs pa rnyed pa ni //
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúAttaining the objective support of the Dharma‚Äù

original: thos pa la sogs pa shes rab gsum gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa shes rab gsum gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: chos ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is the twelve branches of the scriptures and so forth.

original: chos de dag la dmigs pa rnyed de /
analyzed: chos de dag la dmigs pa rnyed de /
translated: One finds the object of reference in those Dharmas.

original: don mngon du 'gyur ba yang don rnam pa gsum gyis 'gyur te /
analyzed: don mngon du 'gyur ba yang don rnam pa gsum gyis 'gyur te /
translated: The actualization of the meaning is also threefold:

original: thos pa'i shes rab dang / bsam pa'i shes rab dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab gsum gyis mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thos pa'i shes rab dang / bsam pa'i shes rab dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab gsum gyis mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: it is actualized by the three kinds of wisdom, the wisdom of hearing, the wisdom of reflection, and the wisdom of cultivation.

original: thos pa'i shes rab kyis ji ltar mngon sum du 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thos pa'i shes rab kyis ji ltar mngon sum du 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how it is actualized by the wisdom of hearing, he says:

original: yid kyi rtog pas bshad pa bzhin //üîΩdad pa la ni rab 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: yid kyi rtog pas bshad pa bzhin // dad pa la ni rab 'dzin phyir //
translated: As it is explained by the conceptualization of the mind,

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: because of the firm adherence to faith,üîΩThe ear consciousness is non-conceptual, and therefore it is not able to understand the meaning.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa yin pas des don rtogs par mi nus pas na yid kyi rtog pa zhes bya bas rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rjes las byung ba rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shesüîΩpa la yid kyi rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa yin pas des don rtogs par mi nus pas na yid kyi rtog pa zhes bya bas rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rjes las byung ba rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shesüîΩpa la yid kyi rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the conceptualization of the mind is the conceptual mind that arises subsequent to the ear consciousness.

original: gang gi tshe sems g-yengs pa med par chos nyan pa dang / sems rtse gcig pas chos nyan pa dang rna blags te chos nyan pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis chos @162a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems g-yengs pa med par chos nyan pa dang / sems rtse gcig pas chos nyan pa dang rna blags te chos nyan pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis chos @162a * //
translated: When listening to the Dharma, one should listen without a distracted mind, with a one-pointed mind, with ears attuned, and with a mind in meditative equipoise.üîΩ

original: nyan pa na ;
analyzed: nyan pa na ;
translated: When one listens to the Dharma without a distracted mind, listens to the Dharma with a one-pointed mind, listens to the Dharma with an attentive ear, and listens to the Dharma with a mind in equipoise,

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis chos thams cad sems las byung ngo zhes bshad pa bzhin du dad pa dang mos pas de bzhin du 'dzin te /
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis chos thams cad sems las byung ngo zhes bshad pa bzhin du dad pa dang mos pas de bzhin du 'dzin te /
translated: then, as the preceptors and teachers explain that all phenomena arise from the mind, one should understand them in that way with faith and interest.

original: ming dang tshig dang yi ge la sogs pa 'di de dag thams cad sems las snang bar zad do zhes nyan pa'i bye brag byed cing yid ches par gyur na thos pa'i shes rab kyis chos la dmigs pa rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ming dang tshig dang yi ge la sogs pa 'di de dag thams cad sems las snang bar zad do zhes nyan pa'i bye brag byed cing yid ches par gyur na thos pa'i shes rab kyis chos la dmigs pa rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one listens with the specific understanding that all these names, phrases, syllables, and so forth are merely appearances from the mind, and one becomes convinced, it is called attaining the object of Dharma through the wisdom of listening.

original: sems kyi shes rab kyis ji ltar dmigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems kyi shes rab kyis ji ltar dmigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how the object is attained through the wisdom of reflection,

original: rtog pa las ni don snang dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rtog pa las ni don snang dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, From conceptualization, the appearance of objects.

original: gang gi tshe sems pa la zhugs pa ni yid kyi rtog pa nyid la sa don gyi dngos po 'di dag snang bar zad kyi yid kyi rtog pa ma rtogs par don 'di dag tha dad pas logs na yod pa ma yin no zhes mthong ba de'i tshe
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems pa la zhugs pa ni yid kyi rtog pa nyid la sa don gyi dngos po 'di dag snang bar zad kyi yid kyi rtog pa ma rtogs par don 'di dag tha dad pas logs na yod pa ma yin no zhes mthong ba de'i tshe
translated: When one engages in mental contemplation, one sees that these things that appear as objects are merely mental concepts, and that apart from mental concepts, these objects do not exist separately.

original: thos pa'i shes rab kyis chos la dmigs pa rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thos pa'i shes rab kyis chos la dmigs pa rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: At that time, one is said to have attained the object of reference of the wisdom of hearing.

original: gong du phyi dang nang gi dmigs pa rnyed pa'i skabs su bshad pa ltar na gzung ba'i don las 'dzin pa'i don tha dad pa ma yin par mthong ba dang ; 'dzin pa'i don las gzung ba'i don tha dad pa ma yin par mthong na /
analyzed: gong du phyi dang nang gi dmigs pa rnyed pa'i skabs su bshad pa ltar na gzung ba'i don las 'dzin pa'i don tha dad pa ma yin par mthong ba dang ; 'dzin pa'i don las gzung ba'i don tha dad pa ma yin par mthong na /
translated: As explained above in the context of attaining the outer and inner objects of reference, if one sees that the object of apprehension is not separate from the object of reference, and that the object of reference is not separate from the object of apprehension,

original: sems pa'i shes rab kyis chos la dmigs pa rnyed pa gzhag go //
analyzed: sems pa'i shes rab kyis chos la dmigs pa rnyed pa gzhag go //
translated: one is said to have attained the object of reference of the wisdom of mental contemplation.

original: bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis chos la dmigs pa ji ltar rnyed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis chos la dmigs pa ji ltar rnyed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how one attains the object of reference of the wisdom of meditation, it is said:

original: sems kyis ming la gnas pas so //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: sems kyis ming la gnas pas so //üîΩzhes smos te /
translated: Because the mind abides in the name.

original: sems kyis zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems kyis zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the mind‚Äù means by the wisdom of meditation.

original: ming gi sgras ni tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs med pa'i phung po la bya ste /
analyzed: ming gi sgras ni tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs med pa'i phung po la bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúname‚Äù refers to the formless aggregates of feeling, etc.

original: gang gi tshe gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis mi dmigs par gyur nas dmigs su med pa'i de bzhin nyid tsam las gnas par gyur na ming la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis mi dmigs par gyur nas dmigs su med pa'i de bzhin nyid tsam las gnas par gyur na ming la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one abides in the suchness that is the non-apprehension of the duality of object and subject, then one is said to abide in name.

original: de ltar gyur na bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis chos la dmigs pa rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis chos la dmigs pa rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When that occurs, it is said that the wisdom of meditation has attained the object of reference that is the Dharma.

original: de yang gong du phyi nang thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rtogs pa'i gnyis su med pa'i dmigs pa rnyed pa ltar rnyed na bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis chos la dmigs pa rnyed par gzhag go //
analyzed: de yang gong du phyi nang thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rtogs pa'i gnyis su med pa'i dmigs pa rnyed pa ltar rnyed na bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis chos la dmigs pa rnyed par gzhag go //
translated: Moreover, if one attains it in the same way that one previously attained the nondual object of reference that is the suchness of all internal and external things, then the wisdom of meditation is said to have attained the object of reference that is the Dharma.

original: dmigs pa rnam pa gsum rnyed par sngar smras pa de la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam pa gsum rnyed par sngar smras pa de la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding in that‚Äù refers to the attainment of the three kinds of objects of reference that were previously mentioned.

original: chos la dmigs pa rnyed pa dang / nang gi dmigs pa rnyed pa dang / phyi'i dmigs pa rnyed pa dang / phyi nang thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa 'byung bas na sngar smras pa'i phyi nang gi dmigs pa rnyed pa la sogs pa rnyed pa rnam gsum bshad @162b pa yang chos la dmigs pa rnyed pa kho na las 'byung bas na de dag
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa rnyed pa dang / nang gi dmigs pa rnyed pa dang / phyi'i dmigs pa rnyed pa dang / phyi nang thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa 'byung bas na sngar smras pa'i phyi nang gi dmigs pa rnyed pa la sogs pa rnyed pa rnam gsum bshad @162b pa yang chos la dmigs pa rnyed pa kho na las 'byung bas na de dag
translated: The three types of attainment mentioned above, the attainment of the internal objective, the attainment of the external objective, and the attainment of the objective of the reality of all internal and external things, arise from the attainment of the objective of the teaching.

original: kyang chos la dmigs pa rnyed pa la gnas shing brten to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kyang chos la dmigs pa rnyed pa la gnas shing brten to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, these three types of attainment are based on and depend on the attainment of the objective of the teaching.

original: yid la byed pa yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid la byed pa yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are five verses investigating attention.

original: dmigs pa rnyed pa'i skabs kyi rjes la yid la byed pa yongs su tshol ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: dmigs pa rnyed pa'i skabs kyi rjes la yid la byed pa yongs su tshol ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the section on the attainment of the objective and the section on the investigation of attention?

original: gong du bshad pa ltar dmigs pa rnyed par gyur na de ni yid la byed par rnyed pa dang ting nge 'dzin rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar dmigs pa rnyed par gyur na de ni yid la byed par rnyed pa dang ting nge 'dzin rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: As explained above, when one finds the meditative object, that is called finding attention and finding concentration.

original: de bas na dmigs pa rnyed pa'i rjes la yid la byed pa yongs su tshol ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na dmigs pa rnyed pa'i rjes la yid la byed pa yongs su tshol ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, it is relevant to explain the section on seeking attention after finding the meditative object.

original: yang na yid la byed pa'i khyad par gang dang ldan na gong du bshad pa'i dmigs pa de rnyed par gyur pa'i yid la byed pa'i khyad par te gtan la dbab dgos te /
analyzed: yang na yid la byed pa'i khyad par gang dang ldan na gong du bshad pa'i dmigs pa de rnyed par gyur pa'i yid la byed pa'i khyad par te gtan la dbab dgos te /
translated: Or, when one has the special attention explained above, it is necessary to ascertain the special attention that finds the meditative object.

original: de bas na dmigs pa rnyed pa'i rjes la yid la byed pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na dmigs pa rnyed pa'i rjes la yid la byed pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, it is relevant to explain the section on attention after finding the meditative object.

original: de la rnal 'byor pa'i yid la byed pa ni rnam pa bco brgyad yod de /üîΩde la yang spyir bstan pa dang / khyad par du bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor pa'i yid la byed pa ni rnam pa bco brgyad yod de / de la yang spyir bstan pa dang / khyad par du bstan pa ste /
translated: There are eighteen types of attention of the yogi.

analyzed: rnam pa bdun te zhes bya ba la tha dad par dmigs pa yid la byed pa la rnam pa bdun yod pa dang / yongs su shes pa'i yid la byed pa'i rnam pa lnga yod pa dang / bsgoms pa'i rnam pa lnga yid la byed pa ni bzhi dang sum cu rtsa bdun yod pa dang /

original: chung ngu'i yid la byed pa dang / rgya chen po yid la byed pa dang / 'di dag ni yid la byed pa rnam pa bco brgyad do zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: attention that is small, and attention that is vast.

original: rnal 'byor rnams kyi yid la byed //üîΩde ltar thams cad rang bzhin 'dod //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rnams kyi yid la byed // de ltar thams cad rang bzhin 'dod //
translated: The attention of the yogis isüîΩall of these, and more.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Thus, all is considered to be of the nature of the eighteen.üîΩThe attention of the yogis is all of these, and more.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yid la byed pa ni gong du bshad pa ltar mdor bsdus pa dang / rgyas par bshad pa thams cad kyang rnam pa bco brgyad kyi rang bzhin du zad par 'dod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yid la byed pa ni gong du bshad pa ltar mdor bsdus pa dang / rgyas par bshad pa thams cad kyang rnam pa bco brgyad kyi rang bzhin du zad par 'dod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this verse is that all of the above, whether summarized or explained in detail, is considered to be of the nature of the eighteen.

original: de la rigs nges pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs su nges pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la rigs nges pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs su nges pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Among these, the attention of certainty of lineage is the attention of those whose lineage is certain as sravakas, etc.

original: nyan thos kyi rigs nges pas nyan thos kyi chos bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs nges pas rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la dmigs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs nges pas gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa la dmigs pa ni rigs nges pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs nges pas nyan thos kyi chos bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs nges pas rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la dmigs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs nges pas gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa la dmigs pa ni rigs nges pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The attention of certainty of lineage is the attention of those whose lineage is certain as sravakas, because they focus on the sravaka doctrine, the four noble truths; it is the attention of those whose lineage is certain as pratyekabuddhas, because they focus on the pratyekabuddha doctrine, dependent origination; and it is the attention of those whose lineage is certain as bodhisattvas, because they focus on the doctrine of the bodhisattva, the selflessness of the person and of phenomena.

original: bya ba byed pa ni gang tshogs bsags pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa ni gang tshogs bsags pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The performance of function is the accumulation of the collections.

original: sa dang po na chos kyi dbyings rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu mos pas spyod pa'i sar bskal pa grangs med pa gcig tu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa rnams kyi yid la byed pa la ni bya ba byed pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o//
analyzed: sa dang po na chos kyi dbyings rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu mos pas spyod pa'i sar bskal pa grangs med pa gcig tu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa rnams kyi yid la byed pa la ni bya ba byed pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o//
translated: On the first stage, the mental attention of those who have accumulated the collections of merit and knowledge for one incalculable eon on the stage of action in faith, the cause for the realization of the reality realm, is called the mental attention of the performance of function.

original: gnas rnam par dbye ba ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas rnam par dbye ba ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The classification of abodes is as follows.

original: gnas rnam par dbye ba'i yid la byad pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gnas rnam par dbye ba'i yid la byad pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The mental attention of the classification of abodes is twofold:

original: gnod pa dang bcas pa'i gnas dang gnod pa med pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: gnod pa dang bcas pa'i gnas dang gnod pa med pa'i gnas so //
translated: the abode with injury and the abode without injury.

original: gang gnod pa dang bcas pa'i gnas ni khyim na gnas pa'i gnas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gnod pa dang bcas pa'i gnas ni khyim na gnas pa'i gnas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The abode with injury is the abode of the householder.

original: gnod pa dang bcas pa'i gnas ni khyim na @163b gnas pa rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: gnod pa dang bcas pa'i gnas ni khyim na @163b gnas pa rnams la bya ste /
translated: The abode with injury is for householders.

original: de dag gi yid la byed pa bu smad gso ba dang so nam gyi bya ba mang pos rtag tu dkrugs pas na gnod pa dang bcas pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi yid la byed pa bu smad gso ba dang so nam gyi bya ba mang pos rtag tu dkrugs pas na gnod pa dang bcas pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: Their minds are always disturbed by the many activities of raising children and farming, so it is called a place of injury.

original: rab tu byung ba'i gnas ni gnod pa med pa'o zhes bya ba la rab tu byung ba rnams la bu smad gso ba dang so nam bya ba'i 'khrugs pa med pas na gnod pa med pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i gnas ni gnod pa med pa'o zhes bya ba la rab tu byung ba rnams la bu smad gso ba dang so nam bya ba'i 'khrugs pa med pas na gnod pa med pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: The life of renunciation is a place without injury, because those who have renounced the life of the householder are not disturbed by the activities of raising children and farming, so it is called a place without injury.

original: mos pa la 'jog pa ni gang sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mos pa la 'jog pa ni gang sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The attention of conviction is that of those who are mindful of the Buddha.

original: gang sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / yid la byed pa ni mos pa la 'jog pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / yid la byed pa ni mos pa la 'jog pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The attention of those who are mindful of the Buddha and who keep that in mind is called the attention of conviction.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran par bya ba la yang theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i bstan bcos kyi nang nas rnam pa dus sangs rgyas rjes su dran par bya zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran par bya ba la yang theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i bstan bcos kyi nang nas rnam pa dus sangs rgyas rjes su dran par bya zhe na /
translated: As for the mindfulness of the Buddha, how many aspects does the mindfulness of the Buddha have?

original: mdor na rnam pa bdun lta bur sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: mdor na rnam pa bdun lta bur sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgoms te /
translated: In brief, one should cultivate recollection of the Buddha in seven aspects.

original: rnam pa bdun ni sangs rgyas rnams chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun ni sangs rgyas rnams chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba yin te /
translated: The Buddhas are masters of all phenomena,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med par 'jug pa'i 'jig rten gyi mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes rjes su dran par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med par 'jug pa'i 'jig rten gyi mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes rjes su dran par bya'o //
translated: and they possess the superknowledges of the world, which are unobstructed in all world systems.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa'i sku ste de bzhin nyid rtag tu dri ma med par gyur pa dang ldan no zhes rjes su dran par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa'i sku ste de bzhin nyid rtag tu dri ma med par gyur pa dang ldan no zhes rjes su dran par bya'o //
translated: One should recollect the TathƒÅgatas as having a permanent body, because they are always endowed with the stainless suchness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mchog tu kha nam tho ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mchog tu kha nam tho ba med pa yin te /
translated: The TathƒÅgatas are supremely free of faults,

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa yin no zhes rjes su dran par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa yin no zhes rjes su dran par bya'o //
translated: because they have eliminated the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni lhun gyis grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni lhun gyis grub pa yin te /
translated: The TathƒÅgatas are spontaneous,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad lhun gyis grub cing rgyun mi 'chad par mdzad do zhes rjes su dran par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad lhun gyis grub cing rgyun mi 'chad par mdzad do zhes rjes su dran par bya'o //
translated: One should recollect that all the deeds of the Buddha are spontaneously accomplished and uninterrupted.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni longs spyod chen po yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni longs spyod chen po yin te /
translated: The Tathagata is of great enjoyment,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rab tu rnam par dag pa'i longs spyod dang ldan pa yin no rjes su dran par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rab tu rnam par dag pa'i longs spyod dang ldan pa yin no rjes su dran par bya'o //
translated: endowed with the enjoyment of the perfectly pure Buddha-land.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gos pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gos pa med pa yin te /
translated: The Tathagata is uncontaminated,

original: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyis ma gos pa'o zhes rjes su dran par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyis ma gos pa'o zhes rjes su dran par bya'o //
translated: uncontaminated by the eight worldly dharmas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni don chen po yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni don chen po yin te /
translated: The Tathagata is of great meaning,

original: mngon par sangs rgyas pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa chen po bstan pa'i thabs kyis sems can smin pa dang grol bar mdzad pa yin no zhes rjes su dran par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par sangs rgyas pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa chen po bstan pa'i thabs kyis sems can smin pa dang grol bar mdzad pa yin no zhes rjes su dran par bya'o //
translated: having manifested Buddhahood, he matures and liberates beings by the method of demonstrating the Great Nirvana.

original: 'dod pa bskyed pa na gang de la yid ches pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa bskyed pa na gang de la yid ches pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: When generating the desire, it is said that one should have confidence in that.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa zhes yid ches pa dang / de'i chos ni legs par bshad @164a * //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa zhes yid ches pa dang / de'i chos ni legs par bshad @164a * //
translated: Thus, one generates the wish to believe that the Bhagavan Buddha is a tathagata, an arhat and his Dharma is well spoken.

original: pa yin no zhes yid ches pa la 'dod pa bskyed pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa yin no zhes yid ches pa la 'dod pa bskyed pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called attention that generates the wish to believe.

original: yang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa sku gsum gyi ngo bo yin no zhes yid ches pa dang / chos la yang bshad pa'i chos ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos gsal bar ston par byed pa yin te sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i lam du gyur pa yin /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa sku gsum gyi ngo bo yin no zhes yid ches pa dang / chos la yang bshad pa'i chos ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos gsal bar ston par byed pa yin te sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i lam du gyur pa yin /
translated: Alternatively, one generates the wish to believe that the Bhagavan Buddha is the nature of the three bodies, possessing the qualities of the powers and so on and abandoning the obscurations of affliction and the obscurations to knowing and that the Dharma is the Dharma of realization, which is the clear explanation of the Dharma of nirvana and the Dharma of practice, which is the path that obtains nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal spangs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes yid ches pa dang / dge 'dun yang 'khor ba'i 'dam las rgal ba dang / 'khor ba'i 'dam las rgal bar gyur pa'i lam la gnas pa yin no zhes yid ches pa ni 'dod pa bskyed pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //üîΩting nge 'dzin la gnas pa ni gang nye bar gyur pa dang / ngo bo'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal spangs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes yid ches pa dang / dge 'dun yang 'khor ba'i 'dam las rgal ba dang / 'khor ba'i 'dam las rgal bar gyur pa'i lam la gnas pa yin no zhes yid ches pa ni 'dod pa bskyed pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o // ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa ni gang nye bar gyur pa dang / ngo bo'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The attention that generates desire is called the attention of generating desire.üîΩThe attention of abiding in concentration is the attention of abiding in concentration that is proximate and the attention of abiding in concentration that is the nature of concentration.üîΩThe attention of abiding in concentration that is proximate is the concentration that is the access to the first absorption.

original: bsam gtan dang po la 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyer bsdogs su gyur pa dang rtsa ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsam gtan dang po nas bzhi pa man chad ngo bo nyid ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa rnams la ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i yid la byed pa
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyer bsdogs su gyur pa dang rtsa ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsam gtan dang po nas bzhi pa man chad ngo bo nyid ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa rnams la ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i yid la byed pa
translated: The attention of abiding in concentration that is the nature of concentration is the concentration of the first absorption up to the fourth absorption.

original: zhes bya'o // de la nye bar gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin la ni chung ngu'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de la nye bar gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin la ni chung ngu'i gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the concentration of the summit of cyclic existence.

original: ngo bo'i ting nge 'dzin la rdzogs pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo'i ting nge 'dzin la rdzogs pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: The concentration of the summit of cyclic existence is the highest of all concentrations.

original: ting nge 'dzin de dag nyid la rnam pa gsum gzhag ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de dag nyid la rnam pa gsum gzhag ste /
translated: The concentrations are also established as three types:

original: de'i phyir rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: that with applied thought and sustained thought, that without applied thought but with sustained thought, and that without applied thought and without sustained thought.

original: nyer bsdogs dang bsam gtan dang po la ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs dang bsam gtan dang po la ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: The preparatory stage and the first absorption are called the concentration with applied thought and sustained thought.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang bar gyi bsam gtan rnams la rnam par mi rtog cing dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang bar gyi bsam gtan rnams la rnam par mi rtog cing dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: The second absorption and the intermediate concentrations are called the concentration without applied thought but with sustained thought.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa la ni rnam par mi rtog mi dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa la ni rnam par mi rtog mi dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas zhes bya'o //
translated: The third and fourth absorptions are called the concentration without applied thought and without sustained thought.

original: shes pa dang ldan pas ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyu dang rnal 'byor gyi shes pa dang ldan pa ste zhes bya ba la rnal 'byor gyi rgyu dang rnal 'byor gyi shes pa dang ldan pa gnyis la shes pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang ldan pas ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyu dang rnal 'byor gyi shes pa dang ldan pa ste zhes bya ba la rnal 'byor gyi rgyu dang rnal 'byor gyi shes pa dang ldan pa gnyis la shes pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The two, possessing the cause of yoga and possessing the knowledge of yoga, are called the mental attention of one who possesses knowledge.üîΩMoreover, they are, respectively, the wisdoms of hearing, contemplation, and meditation.

original: de'ang rim bzhin thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba la thos pa'i shes rab dang / bsam pa'i shes rab gnyis la ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'ang rim bzhin thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba la thos pa'i shes rab dang / bsam pa'i shes rab gnyis la ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyu zhes bya ste /
translated: The two, the wisdom of hearing and the wisdom of contemplation, are called the cause of yoga.

original: zhi @164b gnas dang lhag mthong gi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi @164b gnas dang lhag mthong gi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the cause of serenity and insight.

original: shes rab la ni rnal 'byor gyi shes rab dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab la ni rnal 'byor gyi shes rab dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The wisdom of meditation is called the knowledge of yoga.üîΩBecause it is the cause of serenity and insight.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rgyur gyur bsgom pa'i shes rab la ni rnal 'byor gyi shes rab dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rgyur gyur bsgom pa'i shes rab la ni rnal 'byor gyi shes rab dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The wisdom of meditation is called the knowledge of yoga.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it meditates on serenity and insight.

original: ma 'dres par dmigs pa rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma 'dres par dmigs pa rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are five kinds of unmixed objects of meditation.

original: 'dres par dmigs pa yid la byed pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: 'dres par dmigs pa yid la byed pa lnga yod de /
translated: There are five kinds of attention that have a mixed object of meditation.

original: mdo sde la 'dres par dmigs pa dang / ched du brjod pa la 'dres par dmigs pa dang / gleng gzhi la 'dres par dmigs pa dang / 'dzin pa la 'dres par dmigs pa dang / 'chad pa la 'dres par dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde la 'dres par dmigs pa dang / ched du brjod pa la 'dres par dmigs pa dang / gleng gzhi la 'dres par dmigs pa dang / 'dzin pa la 'dres par dmigs pa dang / 'chad pa la 'dres par dmigs pa'o //
translated: There is attention that has a s≈´tra as its object of meditation, attention that has a verse summary as its object of meditation, attention that has a prose summary as its object of meditation, attention that has a mnemonic as its object of meditation, and attention that has an expository prose work as its object of meditation.üîΩS≈´tra meansüîΩall the s≈´tras that have been taught. When the meaning of all the s≈´tras is collected into one, it is said that the meaning of all the s≈´tras is just this much.üîΩOr, it is said that the meaning of all the s≈´tras is just this much.

original: mdo sde dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo sde dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Verse summary meansüîΩall the verse summaries that have been taught. When the meaning of all the verse summaries is collected into one, it is said that the meaning of all the verse summaries is just this much.üîΩOr, it is said that the meaning of all the verse summaries is just this much.üîΩProse summary meansüîΩall the prose summaries that have been taught. When the meaning of all the prose summaries is collected into one, it is said that the meaning of all the prose summaries is just this much.üîΩOr, it is said that the meaning of all the prose summaries is just this much.üîΩMnemonic meansüîΩall the mnemonic verses that have been taught. When the meaning of all the mnemonic verses is collected into one, it is said that the meaning of all the mnemonic verses is just this much.

original: ji snyed du mdo sde 'byung ba thams cad kyi don gcig tu bsdus nas mdo sde 'byung ba thams cad kyi don 'di tsam du 'byung bar zad do zhe'am /
analyzed: ji snyed du mdo sde 'byung ba thams cad kyi don gcig tu bsdus nas mdo sde 'byung ba thams cad kyi don 'di tsam du 'byung bar zad do zhe'am /
translated: Or, it is said that the meaning of all the mnemonic verses is just this much.

original: ston par zad do zhes dmigs pa ni mdo sde la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ston par zad do zhes dmigs pa ni mdo sde la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Expository prose work meansüîΩall the expository prose works that have been taught. When the meaning of all the expository prose works is collected into one, it is said that the meaning of all the expository prose works is just this much.

original: ched du brjod pa dang zhes bya ba la ji snyed du ched du brjod pa rgya cher bshad par bya ba rnams kyis don gcig tu bsdus na 'di skad du ston par zad ce'am /
analyzed: ched du brjod pa dang zhes bya ba la ji snyed du ched du brjod pa rgya cher bshad par bya ba rnams kyis don gcig tu bsdus na 'di skad du ston par zad ce'am /
translated: Or, it is said that the meaning of all the expository prose works is just this much.

original: thams cad kyang stong pa'i don zhes dmigs pa ni ched du brjod pa la 'dres par dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang stong pa'i don zhes dmigs pa ni ched du brjod pa la 'dres par dmigs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of all is empty is the mixed observation of the expression of purpose.

original: gleng gzhi rnams zhes bya ba la ji snyed gleng gzhi rgya cher bshad pa thams cad kyi don bsdus na 'di skad du 'chad par zad ce'am /
analyzed: gleng gzhi rnams zhes bya ba la ji snyed gleng gzhi rgya cher bshad pa thams cad kyi don bsdus na 'di skad du 'chad par zad ce'am /
translated: As for the nidanas, if one were to summarize the meaning of all the nidanas that are extensively explained, it would be no more than this explanation, or it would be no more than the meaning of all.

original: thams cad kyi don yang ston par zad do zhes dmigs pa ni gleng gzhi la 'dres par dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi don yang ston par zad do zhes dmigs pa ni gleng gzhi la 'dres par dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The observation that the meaning of all is taught is called the mixed observation of the nidanas.

original: 'dzin gnas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dzin gnas zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the holding and the abiding,

original: ji tsam du mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi thad nas chos dang don gzung ba de dag thams cad mdor bsdus na 'di skad du ston par zad do zhes dmigs pa ni 'dzin pa la 'dres par dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi thad nas chos dang don gzung ba de dag thams cad mdor bsdus na 'di skad du ston par zad do zhes dmigs pa ni 'dzin pa la 'dres par dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: to the extent that one holds the Dharma and its meaning from the presence of the preceptor and the master, if one were to summarize all of that, it would be no more than this teaching. The observation of this is called the mixed observation of the holding.

original: zad pa'i bar du dmigs pa 'dres par dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zad pa'i bar du dmigs pa 'dres par dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The observation of the mixed observation up to the exhaustion is as follows.

original: ji tsam du bdag gis gzhan la bshad pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang 'phags pa dag gis bshad pa thams cad kyang don mdor bsdus na thams cad kyang 'di skad du 'byung bar zad do zhe'am /
analyzed: ji tsam du bdag gis gzhan la bshad pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang 'phags pa dag gis bshad pa thams cad kyang don mdor bsdus na thams cad kyang 'di skad du 'byung bar zad do zhe'am /
translated: Or, all of it is just taught.

original: thams cad kyang ston par zad do zhes dmigs pa ni 'chad pa 'dres par dmigs pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang ston par zad do zhes dmigs pa ni 'chad pa 'dres par dmigs pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: To observe in this way is called observing the mixing of the explanation.

original: ming la dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ming la dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Observing the name and observing the phrase.

original: ming ni lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin zhes bya /
analyzed: ming ni lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin zhes bya /
translated: Name is like Devadatta and Yajnadatta.

original: gzugs dang sgra zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Form and sound are called name.

original: chos 'di la 'di skad ces bya zhes @165a * //
analyzed: chos 'di la 'di skad ces bya zhes @165a * //
translated: In this Dharma, it is called such and such.

original: dmigs pa ni ming la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni ming la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Observing this is called observing the name.

original: tshig la dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshig la dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Observing the phrase.

original: ming mang po 'dus pa la tshig ces bya ste /
analyzed: ming mang po 'dus pa la tshig ces bya ste /
translated: Many names gathered together are called a phrase.

original: dper na 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, All conditioned things are impermanent.üîΩ In this sutra, there are this many phrases.

original: mdo sde 'di'i nang nas tshig 'di snyed cig 'byung zhe'am /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di'i nang nas tshig 'di snyed cig 'byung zhe'am /
translated: Or, In this Dharma, there are this many phrases.

original: tshig 'di'i don ni 'di yin no zhes dmigs pa zhes bya'o //üîΩyi ge la dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshig 'di'i don ni 'di yin no zhes dmigs pa zhes bya'o // yi ge la dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of this word is to focus on.üîΩ Focusing on letters means

original: aa dang ka la sogs pa la dmigs pa la yi ge la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: aa dang ka la sogs pa la dmigs pa la yi ge la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: focusing on the letters a, ka, and so on.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa la dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa la dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Focusing on the selflessness of persons means

original: phung po lnga tsam du zad kyi phung po lnga'i nang nas mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag dang sems can med do zhes dmigs pa ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga tsam du zad kyi phung po lnga'i nang nas mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag dang sems can med do zhes dmigs pa ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: focusing on the fact that the five aggregates are all there are, and that the self and sentient beings imputed by the tƒ´rthikas are nonexistent. This is called focusing on the selflessness of persons.

original: chos la bdag med pa la dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa la dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Focusing on the selflessness of phenomena means

original: phung po la sogs pa'i kun brtags kyi chos rnams kyang rmi lam gyi gzugs dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i kun brtags kyi chos rnams kyang rmi lam gyi gzugs dang 'dra ste /
translated: focusing on the fact that imputed phenomena such as the aggregates are like forms in a dream,üîΩand that they are essenceless. This is called focusing on the selflessness of phenomena.

original: rang bzhin med do zhes dmigs pa ni chos bdag med pa la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin med do zhes dmigs pa ni chos bdag med pa la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Focusing on physical phenomena meansüîΩfocusing on the fact that the five sense objects are like reflections,üîΩand that they are essenceless. This is called focusing on physical phenomena.üîΩ Focusing on nonphysical phenomena meansüîΩfocusing on the fact that the five mental phenomena are like illusions,üîΩand that they are essenceless. This is called focusing on nonphysical phenomena.üîΩ Focusing on the formless meansüîΩfocusing on the fact that the four formless states are like mirages,üîΩand that they are essenceless. This is called focusing on the formless.üîΩ Focusing on the past meansüîΩfocusing on the fact that the past is like a dream,üîΩand that it is essenceless. This is called focusing on the past.üîΩ Focusing on the future meansüîΩfocusing on the fact that the future is like a mirage,üîΩand that it is essenceless. This is called focusing on the future.üîΩ Focusing on the present means

original: gzugs can gyi chos la dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs can gyi chos la dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: focusing on the fact that the present is like a visual distortion,üîΩand that it is essenceless. This is called focusing on the present.

original: bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis ka'i lus la mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dmigs pa ni gzugs can gyi chos la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis ka'i lus la mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dmigs pa ni gzugs can gyi chos la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The observation of the body of self, other, or both as impure, etc. is called the observation of material dharmas.

original: gzugs med pa'i chos la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i chos la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The observation of immaterial dharmas is as follows:

original: tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal bar dmigs pa dang / sems mi rtag par dmigs pa dang / chos la bdag med par dmigs pa ni gzugs med pa'i chos la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal bar dmigs pa dang / sems mi rtag par dmigs pa dang / chos la bdag med par dmigs pa ni gzugs med pa'i chos la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The observation of all feelings as suffering, the observation of mind as impermanent, and the observation of dharmas as selfless is called the observation of immaterial dharmas.

original: yongs su shes pa'i nges pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i nges pa ni /
translated: The certainty of complete knowledge is as follows:

original: rnam pa lnga ltar shes na /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ltar shes na /
translated: When one knows the five aspects,

original: yongs su shes pa'i nges pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i nges pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: it is called the mental attention of the certainty of complete knowledge.

original: de la yongs su shes par byed pa'i dngos po ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la yongs su shes par byed pa'i dngos po ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The object of complete knowledge is suffering.

original: yongs su shes pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni shes par bya ba'i yul la bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni shes par bya ba'i yul la bya'o //
translated: The object of complete knowledge is the object of knowledge.

original: de yang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de yang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa la bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the five appropriated aggregates are included in the truth of suffering.

original: yongs su shes par byed pa'i don ni de nyid mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su shes par byed pa'i don ni de nyid mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
