translated: The meaning of ‚Äúshould be fully understood‚Äù is that very [truth of suffering] is impermanent, suffering, empty, and selfless.

original: phung po lnga la ji ltar yongs su shes par bya ba ni don zhes bya ste //
analyzed: phung po lnga la ji ltar yongs su shes par bya ba ni don zhes bya ste //
translated: How is the five aggregates to be fully understood? It is called the meaning.

original: de yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be known in four aspects such as impermanence and so forth.

original: de la skad cig ma re re la 'jig pas @165b na mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de la skad cig ma re re la 'jig pas @165b na mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Therein, it is impermanent because it perishes every moment.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum dang ldan pas na sdug bsngal pa'o //üîΩphung po'i nang na mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag med rtag pa med pas na stong pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum dang ldan pas na sdug bsngal pa'o // phung po'i nang na mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag med rtag pa med pas na stong pa'o //
translated: It is suffering because it possesses the three types of suffering.üîΩIt is empty because the aggregates do not have the self that is imagined by the tƒ´rthikas to be permanent.

original: phung po nyid mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag rtag pa'i rang bzhin med pas na bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: phung po nyid mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag rtag pa'i rang bzhin med pas na bdag med pa'o //
translated: It is selfless because the aggregates themselves do not have the nature of the self that is imagined by the tƒ´rthikas to be permanent.

original: yongs su shes par byed pa ni lam mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su shes par byed pa ni lam mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The path is that which causes complete understanding.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la mi rtag pa la sogs pa lta bur shes par byed pa ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad de /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la mi rtag pa la sogs pa lta bur shes par byed pa ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad de /
translated: The eightfold noble path causes one to understand the five aggregates as impermanent, etc.

original: de la yang yang dag pa'i lta bas mi rtag pa la sogs pa lta bur shes par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la yang yang dag pa'i lta bas mi rtag pa la sogs pa lta bur shes par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one causes understanding by means of the correct view, etc.

original: yongs su shes par byed pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par grol ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su shes par byed pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par grol ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Liberation is the result of that which causes complete understanding.

original: yang dag pa'o lta bas phung po lnga la mi rtag pa la sogs pa lta bur shes par byas /
analyzed: yang dag pa'o lta bas phung po lnga la mi rtag pa la sogs pa lta bur shes par byas /
translated: Having caused understanding of the five aggregates as impermanent, etc. by means of the correct view,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /üîΩsems rnam par grol ba ni yongs su shes par byed pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur te / sems rnam par grol ba ni yongs su shes par byed pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: one becomes liberated from the afflictions such as passion, etc.üîΩThe liberated mind is the result of that which causes complete understanding.

original: de rab tu rig pa ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de rab tu rig pa ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The knowledge and vision of liberation is the knowledge of the liberated mind.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems rnam par grol nas de'i 'og tu sems rnam par grol lo zhes sems rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba skyes pa la ni de rab tu rig pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems rnam par grol nas de'i 'og tu sems rnam par grol lo zhes sems rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba skyes pa la ni de rab tu rig pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: After the mind is liberated from attachment and so on, the knowledge seeing the mind liberated arises, and that is called ‚Äúfully understanding.‚Äù

original: bsgom pa'i rnam pa la zhugs pa yid la byed pa la bsgom pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang / bsgom pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun yod pas las bsgom pa'i rnam pa bzhi po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rnam pa la zhugs pa yid la byed pa la bsgom pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang / bsgom pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun yod pas las bsgom pa'i rnam pa bzhi po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The four aspects of meditation and the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment are included in the mental activity of engaging in the aspects of meditation.

original: gang la bdag med pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang la bdag med pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To explain the four aspects of meditation, it says, ‚ÄúMeditation on the aspect of selflessness,‚Äù and so on.

original: nyan thos rnams ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas gang zag la bdag med pa'i rnam pa bsgom ste /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas gang zag la bdag med pa'i rnam pa bsgom ste /
translated: From the level of devoted engagement, ≈õrƒÅvakas meditate on the aspect of the selflessness of persons.

original: phung po lnga tsam du zad de /
analyzed: phung po lnga tsam du zad de /
translated: They think, ‚ÄúThe five aggregates are exhausted.

original: mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag ni med la phung po lnga nyid la yang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag ni med la phung po lnga nyid la yang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The self imagined by the heterodox does not exist. But the five aggregates are impermanent, painful, empty, and insubstantial.

original: chos la bdag med pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Cultivation of the aspects of the selflessness of dharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas chos la bdag med pa'i rnam par bsgoms te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas chos la bdag med pa'i rnam par bsgoms te /
translated: The bodhisattvas cultivate the aspects of the selflessness of dharmas from the stage of action in faith.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag kyang rmi lam gyi gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du sems las byung bar zad do zhes bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag kyang rmi lam gyi gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du sems las byung bar zad do zhes bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They cultivate the idea that these dharmas, form, etc., are only mind, like the forms, etc., in a dream.

original: mthong ba'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Cultivation of the aspects of seeing.

original: @166a * // nyan thos mthong ba'i lam skyes te //
analyzed: @166a * // nyan thos mthong ba'i lam skyes te //
translated: The sravakas, having generated the path of seeing,üîΩattain the stage of the enterer into the stream.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa thob pa dang // byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i lam skyes te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa thob pa dang // byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i lam skyes te /
translated: The bodhisattvas, having generated the path of seeing,

original: sa dang po thob pa'i tshe na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa bzod pa brgyad la gnas pa ni mthong ba'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa'i tshe na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa bzod pa brgyad la gnas pa ni mthong ba'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is abiding in the eight acceptances, such as the acceptance of the cognition of the teaching with regard to suffering, at the time of attaining the first stage, that is called cultivation of the aspects of seeing.

original: ye shes kyi rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ba la mthong ba'i lam de nyid kyi dus na ye shes rnam pa brgyad la gnas pa'i tshe na ni ye shes kyi rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ba la mthong ba'i lam de nyid kyi dus na ye shes rnam pa brgyad la gnas pa'i tshe na ni ye shes kyi rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Cultivation of the aspects of intuition is when one is abiding in the eight aspects of intuition at the time of the path of seeing.

original: yang na zhi gnas bsgom pa la gnas pa'i tshe na ni mthong ba'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na zhi gnas bsgom pa la gnas pa'i tshe na ni mthong ba'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, when one is abiding in the cultivation of serenity, that is called cultivation of the aspects of seeing.

original: lhag mthong bsgom pa'i dus na ni ye shes kyi rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong bsgom pa'i dus na ni ye shes kyi rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is cultivating insight, that is called cultivation of the aspects of intuition.

original: de las bsgom pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las bsgom pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun no zhes bya ba la /
translated: From that, there are thirty-seven aspects of cultivation.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa la /
translated: In the cultivation of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment,

original: bsgom pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun zhes bya ste /
translated: there are thirty-seven aspects of cultivation.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi nas brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi nas brtsams te /
translated: The thirty-seven factors of enlightenment are the four applications of mindfulness, etc.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad kyi bar du'o //
translated: The eightfold noble path is the path of seeing.

original: mi sdug pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Cultivation of the aspects of impurity.

original: nang gi lus dang phyi'i lus dang / phyi nang gnyis ka'i lus la klad pa'i rgyas nas rkang pa'i mthil gyi bar du khrag dang rnag la sogs pas gang bar dmigs pa dang / rnam par bsngos pa dang / bam pa la sogs pa bsgom pa ni mi sdug pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nang gi lus dang phyi'i lus dang / phyi nang gnyis ka'i lus la klad pa'i rgyas nas rkang pa'i mthil gyi bar du khrag dang rnag la sogs pas gang bar dmigs pa dang / rnam par bsngos pa dang / bam pa la sogs pa bsgom pa ni mi sdug pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The cultivation of the aspects of impurity is the cultivation of the internal body, the external body, and the internal-external body, from the soles of the feet upward and from the top of the head downward, as filled with various kinds of impurities, such as blood, pus, etc., and as a skeleton, etc.

original: 'dis ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan to //
translated: This is the application of mindfulness to the body.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Cultivation of the aspects of suffering.

original: tshor ba bde ba dang / tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang / tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa rnams rtag tu sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes bsgom pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba dang / tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang / tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa rnams rtag tu sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes bsgom pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The contemplation that pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant feelings are always suffering is called the contemplation of the aspect of suffering.

original: de la tshor ba bde ba yang nam zhig na sdug bsngal gyi rgyur 'gyur bas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang / tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang / tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang ldan pas tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la tshor ba bde ba yang nam zhig na sdug bsngal gyi rgyur 'gyur bas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang / tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang / tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang ldan pas tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Since pleasant feelings are at some time the cause of suffering, they are associated with the suffering of change. Unpleasant feelings are associated with the suffering of suffering. Neither pleasant nor unpleasant feelings are associated with the suffering of the karmic predispositions. Thus, all feelings are said to be suffering.

original: 'dis ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan to //
translated: This is the teaching on the application of mindfulness to feelings.

original: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The contemplation of the aspect of impermanence.

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad dang / sems las byung ba rnams @166b ni skad cig tu 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags med par 'gyur ba dang / skad cig tu zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang med par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad dang / sems las byung ba rnams @166b ni skad cig tu 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags med par 'gyur ba dang / skad cig tu zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang med par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: The eight consciousnesses and mental factors are momentary, sometimes associated with attachment and sometimes not, sometimes associated with anger and sometimes not,üîΩsometimes associated with delusion and sometimes not, sometimes peaceful and sometimes not.

original: skad cig tu gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug med par 'gyur ba dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes bsgom pa ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skad cig tu gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug med par 'gyur ba dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes bsgom pa ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called meditation on the aspect of impermanence.

original: 'dis ni sems dran pa nya bar gzhag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sems dran pa nya bar gzhag pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the establishment of mindfulness of mind.

original: bdag med pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Meditation on the aspect of selflessness.

original: chos rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of phenomena:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos dang rnam par byang ba'i chos so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos dang rnam par byang ba'i chos so //
translated: afflicted phenomena and purified phenomena.

original: 'khor ba'i dus na ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos dang ldan par zad /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i dus na ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos dang ldan par zad /
translated: At the time of cyclic existence, one is simply endowed with afflicted phenomena such as attachment.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na ni dad pa la sogs ba rnam par byang ba'i chos dang ldan par zad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i bdag rtag pa gang yang med do zhes bsgom pa ni bdag med pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na ni dad pa la sogs ba rnam par byang ba'i chos dang ldan par zad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i bdag rtag pa gang yang med do zhes bsgom pa ni bdag med pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called meditation on the aspect of selflessness.

original: 'dis ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the application of mindfulness to phenomena.

original: 'dis ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bstan to //
translated: This teaches the four applications of mindfulness.

original: rab tu thob pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab tu thob pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Meditation on the aspect of complete attainment.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi mtshan nyid dge ba ma skyes pa rnams bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi mtshan nyid dge ba ma skyes pa rnams bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to generate the wholesome states of superior morality, superior mind, and superior wisdom that have not yet arisen,

original: mos pa bskyod 'bad brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni rab tu thob pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mos pa bskyod 'bad brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni rab tu thob pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: one generates interest, makes effort, and exerts diligence. This is called meditation on the aspect of complete attainment.

original: 'dis ni yang dag par spong ba'i rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'dis ni yang dag par spong ba'i rnam pa gcig go //
translated: This is one aspect of the correct abandonments.

original: brten pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brten pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Cultivation of the aspects of reliance means

original: bslab pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid dbye ba'i chos skye ba rnams 'phel ba dang / rgyas pa dang rgya cher 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir yang nas yang du de la bsgom pa ni bstan pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid dbye ba'i chos skye ba rnams 'phel ba dang / rgyas pa dang rgya cher 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir yang nas yang du de la bsgom pa ni bstan pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: that one cultivates again and again in order to increase, expand, and extend the wholesome factors that have arisen, which are characterized by the three trainings. This is called cultivation of the aspects of reliance.

original: 'dis ni yang dag pa'i spong ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni yang dag pa'i spong ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second right abandonment.

original: gdon pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gdon pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Cultivation of the aspects of expulsion means

original: bslab pa gsum gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: that in order to abandon the arisen unfavorable factors, which are sinful, unwholesome factors that are adverse to the three trainings,

original: mos pa bskyed 'bad brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni 'don pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mos pa bskyed 'bad brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni 'don pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: one generates aspiration, exerts effort, and strives. This is called cultivation of the aspects of expulsion.

original: 'dis ni yang dag pa'i spong pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni yang dag pa'i spong pa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third right abandonment.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos spangs pa yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag rgyun du skye ba las skye ba'i rgyun gcad pa'o //üîΩyang sdig pa'i chos de dag gi sa bon @167a * //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos spangs pa yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag rgyun du skye ba las skye ba'i rgyun gcad pa'o // yang sdig pa'i chos de dag gi sa bon @167a * //
translated: Abandoning evil, non-virtuous dharmas is the cutting off of the continuity of the arising of those evil, non-virtuous dharmas.

original: spangs pa nyid kyis spangs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: spangs pa nyid kyis spangs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it is called ‚Äúabandoning‚Äù by the very abandonment of the seeds of those evil dharmas.

original: gzhan du na sdig pa'i chos skyes zin pa rnams ni spang du med de /
analyzed: gzhan du na sdig pa'i chos skyes zin pa rnams ni spang du med de /
translated: Otherwise, the already arisen evil dharmas cannot be abandoned,

original: rang nyid skyes ma thag tu 'gag par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: rang nyid skyes ma thag tu 'gag par 'gyur bas so //
translated: because they cease immediately upon arising.

original: gnyen po rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyen po rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Cultivating the aspects of the antidote is as follows:

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir de'i gnyen po 'dod chags kyi gnyen por mi gtsang ba bsgom pa dang / zhe sdang gi gnyen por byams pa bsgom pa dang gti mug gi gnyen por rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bsgom pa ni gnyen po'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir de'i gnyen po 'dod chags kyi gnyen por mi gtsang ba bsgom pa dang / zhe sdang gi gnyen por byams pa bsgom pa dang gti mug gi gnyen por rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bsgom pa ni gnyen po'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: In order to not produce the non-virtuous dharmas that have not arisen, one cultivates their antidotes‚Äîfor example, cultivating impurity as the antidote to desire, cultivating loving-kindness as the antidote to anger, and cultivating dependent origination as the antidote to delusion. This is called ‚Äúcultivating the aspects of the antidote.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the fourth right abandonment.

original: de la gnyen po la bsgom na bag chags bcom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gnyen po la bsgom na bag chags bcom par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one cultivates the antidotes, the latent propensities are destroyed.

original: bag chags bcom na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bag chags bcom na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: When the latent propensities are destroyed, the non-arising of unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen occurs.

original: ma skyes pa spong ba'i thabs kyang de lta bu'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa spong ba'i thabs kyang de lta bu'o //
translated: The method of abandoning what has not yet arisen is like that.

original: 'di yan chad yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi bstan to //
analyzed: 'di yan chad yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi bstan to //
translated: Up to here, the four right abandonments are taught.

original: bshad do // chog par 'dzin pa'i gnyen po yid la byed pa'i bsgom pa ni dad pa bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bshad do // chog par 'dzin pa'i gnyen po yid la byed pa'i bsgom pa ni dad pa bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cultivation of attention as the antidote to contentment is the generation of faith.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi tsam gyi dge bas chog par 'dzin cing dge ba rgya chen po dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa mi tshol la de'i gnyen po yid la byed pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi tsam gyi dge bas chog par 'dzin cing dge ba rgya chen po dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa mi tshol la de'i gnyen po yid la byed pa bsgoms te /
translated: One is content with just the virtue of the four right abandonments, and does not seek vast virtue, samƒÅdhi, and so on. Cultivating attention as the antidote to that,

original: de'i gnyen po yid la byed pa yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po yid la byed pa yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: what is that attention as the antidote?

original: dad pa skyes pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa skyes pa'o //
translated: It is the generation of faith.

original: dad pa skyes pa ni ting nge 'dzin dang / dag ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dad pa skyes pa ni ting nge 'dzin dang / dag ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Faith is the basis of meditative concentration,

original: mos pa dang dga' ba dang spro ba bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: mos pa dang dga' ba dang spro ba bskyed pa ste /
translated: and the basis of purification is the generation of great interest, joy, and delight.

original: 'dis ni mos pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mos pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that interest is the basis of spiritual power.

original: g-yeng ba dang the tshom gyi gnyen po yid la byed pa bsgom pa ni nam 'bad pa dang brtson 'grus rtsom pa na rim bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: g-yeng ba dang the tshom gyi gnyen po yid la byed pa bsgom pa ni nam 'bad pa dang brtson 'grus rtsom pa na rim bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cultivation of attention as the antidote to distraction and doubt is in order to initiate effort and enthusiasm.

original: ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa na 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la sems g-yeng bas g-yengs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa na 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la sems g-yeng bas g-yengs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one enters into meditative concentration, the mind is distracted by the five sense pleasures, and so it is called distraction.

original: bsgom pa'i yul dang shes bya'i dngos po yin nam ma yin no snyam du yid gnyis za ba ni the tshom zhes bya ste /üîΩg-yeng ba'i gnyen por ni 'bad pa yid la bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i yul dang shes bya'i dngos po yin nam ma yin no snyam du yid gnyis za ba ni the tshom zhes bya ste / g-yeng ba'i gnyen por ni 'bad pa yid la bya'o //
translated: Doubt is the uncertainty about whether or not the object of meditation and the thing to be known are real.üîΩThe antidote to distraction is the attention to effort.

original: the tshom gyi gnyen por ni brtson 'grus yid la bya ste /
analyzed: the tshom gyi gnyen por ni brtson 'grus yid la bya ste /
translated: The antidote to doubt is the attention to enthusiasm.

original: rim bzhin no //
analyzed: rim bzhin no //
translated: This is in order.

original: ji ltar gnyen por 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyen por 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How are they antidotes?

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dus na phyi'i yul la sems g-yengs shing phyad par gyur pa dang / mi g-yengs par gyur pa'i phyir 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dus na phyi'i yul la sems g-yengs shing phyad par gyur pa dang / mi g-yengs par gyur pa'i phyir 'bad par bya'o //
translated: When one is in samƒÅdhi, one should strive to not be distracted by external objects, and to not be distracted.

original: nam the tshom du gyur ba na ma btsal te /
analyzed: nam the tshom du gyur ba na ma btsal te /
translated: When one is doubtful, one should not seek.

original: le lo'i dbang du byas na ni the tshom las thar @167b bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: le lo'i dbang du byas na ni the tshom las thar @167b bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one is under the power of laziness, one will not be liberated from doubt.

original: brtson 'grus bskyed pa la yang nas yang du gzig cing brtags te dpyad na the tshom me dpar 'gyur pas /
analyzed: brtson 'grus bskyed pa la yang nas yang du gzig cing brtags te dpyad na the tshom me dpar 'gyur pas /
translated: When one generates effort, one should repeatedly observe, investigate, and analyze, so that doubt will be eliminated.

original: the tshom gyi gnyen por ni brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: the tshom gyi gnyen por ni brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: Therefore, one should generate effort as the antidote to doubt.

original: rgod pa'i gnyen por ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa ni nam sems rab tu 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgod pa'i gnyen por ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa ni nam sems rab tu 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cultivation of samƒÅdhi as the antidote to agitation is as follows: When the mind is agitated, one should focus the mind.

original: sngon rtsed mo byas pa dang / bgod pa la sogs pa dran nas sems 'phros par gyur pa ni rgod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sngon rtsed mo byas pa dang / bgod pa la sogs pa dran nas sems 'phros par gyur pa ni rgod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one recalls past play, laughter, and so on, and the mind becomes excited, that is called ‚Äúagitation.‚Äù

original: de'i gnyen por ni zhi gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom mo zhi gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa na sems rab tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por ni zhi gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom mo zhi gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa na sems rab tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one cultivates the samadhi of serenity, one ‚Äúholds the mind in check‚Äù

original: sems g-yengs pa las zhi gnas kyis brlan nas /
analyzed: sems g-yengs pa las zhi gnas kyis brlan nas /
translated: because, through serenity, the distracted mind is moistened and

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi yul las brlan nas bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi yul las brlan nas bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: placed in the object of samadhi.üîΩThe antidote to depression is the cultivation of the aspects of samadhi.

original: zhum pa'i gnyen por ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par bsgom pa ni nam sems rab tu gzengs bstod do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhum pa'i gnyen por ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par bsgom pa ni nam sems rab tu gzengs bstod do zhes bya ba la /
translated: When the mind is uplifted,

original: zhum pa ni le lo'i dbang du gyur nas sems spro ba med pa dang gnyid dang / rmugs pa dang non pa ste /
analyzed: zhum pa ni le lo'i dbang du gyur nas sems spro ba med pa dang gnyid dang / rmugs pa dang non pa ste /
translated: Depression is overcome by the power of laziness, and the mind is without enthusiasm, oppressed by sleepiness and torpor.

original: de'i gnyen por ni lhag mthong gi ting nge 'dzin bsgom mo //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por ni lhag mthong gi ting nge 'dzin bsgom mo //
translated: The antidote to that is the cultivation of the samadhi of insight.

original: nam lhag mthong gi ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa ni sems rab tu gzengs bstod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nam lhag mthong gi ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa ni sems rab tu gzengs bstod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one cultivates the samadhi of insight, one ‚Äúuplifts the mind.‚Äù

original: rmugs par gyur pa dang lhag mthong gis de bzhin gshegs pa pa'i yon tan nam ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bur bsams nas /
analyzed: rmugs par gyur pa dang lhag mthong gis de bzhin gshegs pa pa'i yon tan nam ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bur bsams nas /
translated: and with insight, one should generate the characteristic of a bright, elated mind, thinking of the qualities of the Tathagata or the result of samadhi.

original: sems spro ba dang gsal ba'i mtshan nyid bskyed par bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems spro ba dang gsal ba'i mtshan nyid bskyed par bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, ‚Äúone should generate the characteristic of a bright, elated mind.‚Äù

original: de dag rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang rim bzhin du sbyar ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang rim bzhin du sbyar ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are to be connected respectively with the four bases of psychic power.

original: chog par 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mi mos pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bstan to //üîΩg-yeng ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni brtson 'grus rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bstan to //üîΩrgod pa'i gnyen por zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bstan to //
analyzed: chog par 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mi mos pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bstan to // g-yeng ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni brtson 'grus rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bstan to // rgod pa'i gnyen por zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bstan to //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúone who is satisfied,‚Äù etc., teaches the base of psychic power of lack of desire.üîΩThe statement, ‚Äúone who is distracted,‚Äù etc., teaches the base of psychic power of effort.üîΩThe statement, ‚Äúthe antidote to agitation,‚Äù etc., teaches the base of psychic power of mind.

original: zhum pa'i gnyen por zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni spyod pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhum pa'i gnyen por zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni spyod pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bstan to //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúthe antidote to depression,‚Äù etc., teaches the base of psychic power of investigation.

original: rim bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: rim bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: They are to be connected respectively with the four bases of psychic power.

original: sems gnas pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa la yid ches pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems gnas pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa la yid ches pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: By means of mental stability, one cultivates the attitude of confidence in the excellence of the supramundane.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi thob ste /üîΩ'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa la sems gnas pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi thob ste / 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa la sems gnas pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: One obtains the four bases of supernormal power.üîΩOr else, one obtains the four mundane meditative concentrations and is said to have mental stability.

original: mos pa spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi thob pa la sems gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi thob pa la sems gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, one obtains the four supramundane meditative concentrations and is said to have mental stability.

original: sa dang por gnyis su med pa'i ye shes thob pa la ni 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ste /üîΩde'i tshe bsod nams @168a * //
analyzed: sa dang por gnyis su med pa'i ye shes thob pa la ni 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ste / de'i tshe bsod nams @168a * //
translated: When one obtains nondualistic pristine awareness on the first spiritual level, this is called the supramundane.

original: dang ye shes kyi tshogs ni phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dang ye shes kyi tshogs ni phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: At that time, one is said to have the excellence of the accumulations of merit and pristine awareness.

original: 'jig rten gyi ting nge 'dzin thob pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi ting nge 'dzin thob pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In order to obtain the supramundane excellence by means of the attainment of the mundane meditative concentrations, one should cultivate the attitude of confidence in the excellence of the supramundane.

original: ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
translated: How does one cultivate it?

original: yid ches pa'i rnam par bsgoms te /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i rnam par bsgoms te /
translated: One cultivates it in the form of confidence.

original: sa dang po'i dus na bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs phun sum tshogs pa yin la /
analyzed: sa dang po'i dus na bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs phun sum tshogs pa yin la /
translated: At the time of the first stage, one has the perfect accumulation of merit and wisdom.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs de dag sgrub cing thob par byar rung ngo zhes sems pa ni yid ches pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs de dag sgrub cing thob par byar rung ngo zhes sems pa ni yid ches pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The thought that one can accomplish and attain those accumulations of merit and wisdom is called ‚Äúcultivating the aspect of conviction.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni dad pa'i dbang po bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dad pa'i dbang po bstan to //
translated: This shows the faculty of faith.üîΩJust as one cultivates the aspect of conviction, so too one cultivates the aspect of striving.

original: ji ltar yid ches pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa de bzhin du 'bad pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la dad pa'i dbang pos 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa la yod pa'i mtshan nyid du yid ches pa'i rnam pas bsgom pa
analyzed: ji ltar yid ches pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa de bzhin du 'bad pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la dad pa'i dbang pos 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa la yod pa'i mtshan nyid du yid ches pa'i rnam pas bsgom pa
translated: By means of the faculty of faith, one cultivates the aspect of conviction that the supramundane perfections exist.

original: de bzhin du brtson 'grus kyis kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa de la rtog pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir yang nas yang du goms par byed pa ni 'bad pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du brtson 'grus kyis kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa de la rtog pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir yang nas yang du goms par byed pa ni 'bad pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Similarly, by means of effort, one repeatedly cultivates the aspect of striving to realize and actualize those supramundane perfections.

original: 'dis ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po bstan te /
translated: This is the faculty of effort.

original: chos mi brjed pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la dad pa'i dbang pos yid ches par byas pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang pos mngon sum du byas pa'i chos de sems la ma rmugs shing sems la gsal bar snang ba'i mtshan nyid du bsgom pa ni sems mi brjed pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste //
analyzed: chos mi brjed pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la dad pa'i dbang pos yid ches par byas pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang pos mngon sum du byas pa'i chos de sems la ma rmugs shing sems la gsal bar snang ba'i mtshan nyid du bsgom pa ni sems mi brjed pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste //
translated: The cultivation of the aspect of non-forgetting of the teaching means that the teaching which is believed through the faculty of faith and realized through the faculty of effort is cultivated in the aspect of non-forgetting of the mind, with the characteristic of a clear appearance in the mind.

original: 'di ni dran pa'i dbang po bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni dran pa'i dbang po bstan to //
translated: This is the faculty of mindfulness.

original: sems gnas pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems gnas pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cultivation of the aspect of mental stability means that

original: dran pa'i dbang pos ma brjed par byas pa'i chos de nyid la sems gzhag ste /
analyzed: dran pa'i dbang pos ma brjed par byas pa'i chos de nyid la sems gzhag ste /
translated: the mind is placed on that very teaching which is not forgotten through the faculty of mindfulness.

original: rtse gcig tu bsgom pa ni sems gnas pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rtse gcig tu bsgom pa ni sems gnas pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The cultivation of one-pointedness is called the cultivation of the aspect of mental stability.

original: 'dis ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po bstan to //
translated: This is the faculty of concentration.

original: rab tu 'byed pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab tu 'byed pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cultivation of the aspect of discernment means that

original: de ltar sems rtse gcig tu bzhag na chos de dag gi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par shes pa'i shes rab skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar sems rtse gcig tu bzhag na chos de dag gi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par shes pa'i shes rab skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when the mind is one-pointedly placed in this way, the wisdom that unerringly knows the specific and general characteristics of those phenomena arises.

original: de ni rab tu 'byed pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rab tu 'byed pa'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called ‚Äúcultivating the aspect of thorough differentiation.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni shes rab kyi dbang po bstan to /
analyzed: 'dis ni shes rab kyi dbang po bstan to /
translated: This teaches the faculty of wisdom.

original: 'di yan chad du dbang po lnga bstan to //üîΩdbang po de dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcom pa'i yid la byed pa ni stobs rnams la'o zhes bya ba la @168b dad pa'i dbang po nas shes rab kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang po lnga po nyid la nam mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi 'phrogs shing
analyzed: 'di yan chad du dbang po lnga bstan to // dbang po de dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcom pa'i yid la byed pa ni stobs rnams la'o zhes bya ba la @168b dad pa'i dbang po nas shes rab kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang po lnga po nyid la nam mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi 'phrogs shing
translated: Up to this point, the five faculties have been taught.üîΩThe five powers are the mental attentions that conquer the discordant classes of those faculties.üîΩThe five faculties from faith to wisdom are the five powers when they are not overcome by their discordant classes,

original: de dag gi dbang du ma gyur la mi mthun pa'i phyogs chom sa pa'i tshul du yid la byed pa la ni stobs lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dbang du ma gyur la mi mthun pa'i phyogs chom sa pa'i tshul du yid la byed pa la ni stobs lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: when they are not under the control of those discordant classes, and when they are the mental attentions that conquer the discordant classes.

original: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ma dad pa dang / le lo dang dran pa nyams pa dang / g-yeng ba dang 'chal ba'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ma dad pa dang / le lo dang dran pa nyams pa dang / g-yeng ba dang 'chal ba'i shes rab ste /
translated: The adverse factors are lack of faith, laziness, loss of mindfulness, distraction, and poor understanding.

original: nam ma dad pas mi 'phrogs pa'i dus na ni dad pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nam ma dad pas mi 'phrogs pa'i dus na ni dad pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is not carried away by lack of faith, it is called the power of faith.

original: nam le los mi 'phrogs pa'i dus na ni brtson 'grus kyi stobs zhes bya'o //üîΩnam dran pa nyams pas mi 'phrogs pa'i dus na ni dran pa'i stobs zhes bya'o//
analyzed: nam le los mi 'phrogs pa'i dus na ni brtson 'grus kyi stobs zhes bya'o // nam dran pa nyams pas mi 'phrogs pa'i dus na ni dran pa'i stobs zhes bya'o//
translated: When one is not carried away by laziness, it is called the power of perseverance.üîΩWhen one is not carried away by loss of mindfulness, it is called the power of mindfulness.

original: nam g-yeng bas mi 'phrogs pa'i dus na ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nam g-yeng bas mi 'phrogs pa'i dus na ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is not carried away by distraction, it is called the power of concentration.

original: nam 'chal pa'i shes rab kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i dus na ni shes rab kyi stobs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nam 'chal pa'i shes rab kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i dus na ni shes rab kyi stobs zhes bya ste /
translated: When one is not carried away by poor understanding, it is called the power of wisdom.

original: 'di yan chad stobs lnga bshad do //
analyzed: 'di yan chad stobs lnga bshad do //
translated: Up to here, the five powers have been explained.

original: dbang po lnga dang stobs lnga la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang stobs lnga la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the five faculties and the five powers?

original: gang gis ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / dad pa la sogs pa gnyen po gnyis su 'dres mar 'byung ba na ni dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / dad pa la sogs pa gnyen po gnyis su 'dres mar 'byung ba na ni dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: When faith, etc., and their resistant tendencies, such as lack of faith, etc., arise mixed together, they are called faculties.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis ma 'dres par gnyen po 'ba' zhig 'byung ba na ni stobs zhes bya ste bye brag ni de yod do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis ma 'dres par gnyen po 'ba' zhig 'byung ba na ni stobs zhes bya ste bye brag ni de yod do //
translated: When the antidotes arise alone, without being mixed with their resistant tendencies, they are called powers. This is the difference.

original: yang dag byang chub rab tu snang ba rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag byang chub rab tu snang ba rnam pa la bsgom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cultivation of the illumination of perfect enlightenment.

original: zad pa mi skye ba'i ye shes la yang dag byang chub ces bya ste /
analyzed: zad pa mi skye ba'i ye shes la yang dag byang chub ces bya ste /
translated: Perfect enlightenment is the knowledge of elimination and nonarising.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa sngar spangs pa la ni bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa sngar spangs pa la ni bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Patience is the elimination of the passions that are to be eliminated by the path of insight and by the path of cultivation.

original: de phyin chad sems kyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa mi 'byung ba ni mi skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de phyin chad sems kyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa mi 'byung ba ni mi skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The nonarising of the passions in the mental continuum from then on is called nonarising.

original: yang na sa dang por chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du rtogs nas gzung 'dzin gnyis spangs te /
analyzed: yang na sa dang por chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du rtogs nas gzung 'dzin gnyis spangs te /
translated: Or else, having realized on the first stage that the realm of the Dharma is the characteristic of universal convertibility, one abandons the duality of subject and object.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes thob pa la yang dag byang chub ces bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes thob pa la yang dag byang chub ces bya ste /
translated: The attainment of nondual intuition is called correct enlightenment.

original: de sems la gsal zhing ma brjed par bsgom pa la ni yang dag byang chub snang ba'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de sems la gsal zhing ma brjed par bsgom pa la ni yang dag byang chub snang ba'i rnam pa la bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cultivation of that enlightenment in the mind, without forgetfulness, is called the cultivation of the aspect of the appearance of correct enlightenment.

original: de yang dran par byed pas na 'dis dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bstan to //
analyzed: de yang dran par byed pas na 'dis dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bstan to //
translated: Since it is the cause of the recollection of that, it is called the member of enlightenment that is correct recollection.

original: de nyid la rnam par 'byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /üîΩde nyid la zhes bya ba ni zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes sam /üîΩgnyis su med pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid la rnam par 'byed pa dang zhes bya ba la / de nyid la zhes bya ba ni zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes sam / gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
translated: It is said that it is discernment in regard to that.üîΩ In regard to that means in regard to the intuition of the nonarising of what has been extinguished, or in regard to nondual intuition.

original: ye shes de'i mtshan nyid mi brjed par byas pa nyid phyin ci ma log par shes pa ni rnam par 'byed @169a * //
analyzed: ye shes de'i mtshan nyid mi brjed par byas pa nyid phyin ci ma log par shes pa ni rnam par 'byed @169a * //
translated: The nonforgetfulness of the characteristic of that intuition is called nonerroneous knowledge.

original: pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called discernment.

original: de yang gang gi dus na shes she na sa dang po'i dus na shes te /
analyzed: de yang gang gi dus na shes she na sa dang po'i dus na shes te /
translated: When is it known? It is known at the time of the first stage,

original: de'i tshe chos kyi dbyings thas sa cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i tshe chos kyi dbyings thas sa cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because at that time one realizes the characteristic of the universal pervasion of the realm of the Dharma.

original: 'dis ni chos rab tu 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag bstan to //üîΩspro ba dang zhes bya bas chos kying byings rtogs pa de nyid la /
analyzed: 'dis ni chos rab tu 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag bstan to // spro ba dang zhes bya bas chos kying byings rtogs pa de nyid la /
translated: This shows the enlightenment factor of investigation of phenomena.

original: yang nas yang du goms par byed pa ni spro ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang nas yang du goms par byed pa ni spro ba zhes bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúExertion‚Äù means that, in order to repeatedly cultivate the realization of the realm of reality,üîΩone must exert oneself.

original: de yang brtson 'grus kyis byed pas na 'dis ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bstan to //üîΩyid bde ba dang zhes bya ba la /

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin bshad pa gang yang med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin bshad pa gang yang med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is no explanation of the nature of the path of meditation of serenity and insight.

original: da ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin bshad pa'i skabs su bab ste /
analyzed: da ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin bshad pa'i skabs su bab ste /
translated: Now is the occasion to explain the nature of the path of meditation of serenity and insight.

original: de gnyis kyi bshad pa ni gang yang med de /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi bshad pa ni gang yang med de /
translated: But there is no explanation of those two.

original: bshad mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bshad mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of that is that it is unnecessary to explain them.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gong du yid la byed pa bshad pa dang / 'og nas yid la byed pa 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams kyang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi char gtogs par zad de /
analyzed: gong du yid la byed pa bshad pa dang / 'og nas yid la byed pa 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams kyang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi char gtogs par zad de /
translated: Because the mental contemplations explained above and the mental contemplations to be explained below are included in serenity and insight.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong du 'dus pas logs shig tu bshad mi dgos so //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong du 'dus pas logs shig tu bshad mi dgos so //
translated: Since they are included in serenity and insight, it is unnecessary to explain them separately.

original: legs par yid la byed pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: legs par yid la byed pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Correct mental attention is twofold:

original: gnas ngan len bsal ba dang / lta ba'i mtshan ma bsal ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas ngan len bsal ba dang / lta ba'i mtshan ma bsal ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: the elimination of negative tendencies and the elimination of the signs of views.

original: yid la byed pa gang gis gnas ngan len sel bar byed pa dang / lta ba'i mtshan ma sel bar byed pa de la legs par yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa gang gis gnas ngan len sel bar byed pa dang / lta ba'i mtshan ma sel bar byed pa de la legs par yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That mental attention by which one eliminates negative tendencies and eliminates the signs of views is called correct mental attention.

original: de'ang gnas ngan len sel ba dang / lta ba sel ba'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis su bzhag go //
analyzed: de'ang gnas ngan len sel ba dang / lta ba sel ba'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis su bzhag go //
translated: Moreover, it is posited as twofold from the viewpoint of eliminating negative tendencies and eliminating views.

original: de la gnas ngan len rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gnas ngan len rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of negative tendencies:

original: lus kyi gnas ngan len dang / sems kyi gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: lus kyi gnas ngan len dang / sems kyi gnas ngan len to //
translated: negative tendencies of the body and negative tendencies of the mind.

original: de la lus kyi gnas ngan len ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la lus kyi gnas ngan len ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba byed pa'o //
translated: Negative tendencies of the body are nonvirtuous actions such as killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct.

original: sems kyi gnas ngan len ni ma lus mi dge ba spyod pa'i rgyu 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa sems la g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: sems kyi gnas ngan len ni ma lus mi dge ba spyod pa'i rgyu 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa sems la g-yo ba ste /
translated: Negative tendencies of the mind are the movements of the mind, such as attachment and hostility, that are the causes of engaging in nonvirtue.

original: chos @171a * //
analyzed: chos @171a * //
translated: 1. The Dharma is the cause of the path of seeing.

original: la bdag med par khong du chud pas ni gnas ngan len sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: la bdag med par khong du chud pas ni gnas ngan len sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: By understanding the selflessness of phenomena, one eliminates the negative reflex actions.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba bsnyems pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa'i bag chags la lta ba'i mtshan ma sel ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba bsnyems pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa'i bag chags la lta ba'i mtshan ma sel ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The elimination of the signs of views refers to the elimination of the habitual tendencies of the afflicted view of the self, extreme views, false views, esteeming views, and esteeming morality and asceticism.

original: gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud pas ni lta ba'i mtshan ma sel bar byed do //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud pas ni lta ba'i mtshan ma sel bar byed do //
translated: By understanding the selflessness of the person, one eliminates the signs of views.

original: yang dag par gnod pa ni gang chos kyi rgyu na las sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' las gdams pa 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag par gnod pa ni gang chos kyi rgyu na las sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' las gdams pa 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The correct harm is that which is the cause of the Dharma, the retention of the instructions from the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: theg pa chen po'i rigs la gnas pas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas mos pa spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi thob pa la chos kyi rgyun zhes bya ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i rigs la gnas pas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas mos pa spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi thob pa la chos kyi rgyun zhes bya ste /
translated: The stream of Dharma refers to the four concentrations of the stage of action in faith of one who, having the MahƒÅyƒÅna lineage, has generated the intention to become enlightened.

original: chos kyi rgyun la gnas pa des sa dang po thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi rgyun la gnas pa des sa dang po thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The one who is situated in the stream of Dharma, in order to attain the first stage,

original: sa dang po thob par 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi man ngag sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams las len cing 'dzin pa la yang dag par nod pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa dang po thob par 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi man ngag sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams las len cing 'dzin pa la yang dag par nod pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: should receive and hold the instructions for the samadhi that leads to attaining the first stage from the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas. This is called the mental attention of perfect reception.

original: sbyor ba can gyi yid la byed ba dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyor ba can gyi yid la byed ba dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the first mental attention of one who is engaged, it is said:

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul grangs nye bar rtogs pa'i sbyor ba can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul grangs nye bar rtogs pa'i sbyor ba can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The one who is engaged in the realization of the enumeration of the domain of samadhi, etc.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul ni mdo sde la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul ni mdo sde la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
translated: The domain of samadhi is the twelve branches of excellent speech such as the sutras.

original: gsung rab de ngag gi ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i grangs su yod ba rtogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin spyod yul grangs nye bar rtogs pa'i sbyor ba can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsung rab de ngag gi ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i grangs su yod ba rtogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin spyod yul grangs nye bar rtogs pa'i sbyor ba can zhes bya'o //
translated: The realization of the enumeration of those branches of excellent speech in terms of the number of words, phrases, and letters is called the one who is engaged in the realization of the enumeration of the domain of samadhi.

original: de nyid kyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that meaning, it is said:

original: gang gis mdo sde la sogs pa'i ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i grangs nye bar rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang gis mdo sde la sogs pa'i ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i grangs nye bar rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: One realizes the number of names, words, and letters of the sutras and so on.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa gang gis zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩyid la byed cing rtogs pa'i khyad par gang gis mdo sde la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis la gsung rab 'di'i nang nas ming gi grangs ni 'di snyed cig 'byung /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa gang gis zhes bya ba'i don to // yid la byed cing rtogs pa'i khyad par gang gis mdo sde la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis la gsung rab 'di'i nang nas ming gi grangs ni 'di snyed cig 'byung /
translated: By what? means by what mental attention.

original: tshig gi grangs ni 'di snyed cig 'byung /
analyzed: tshig gi grangs ni 'di snyed cig 'byung /
translated: By what specific mental attention and realization does one realize, In this scriptural collection, there are this many names, this many words, and this many letters of the twelve branches of scripture such as the sutras?

analyzed: yi ge'i grangs ni 'di snyed cig 'byung zhes rtogs pa ni grangs nye bar rtogs pa'i sbyor ba can zhes bya'o //

original: sbyor ba can gyi yid la byed pa gnyis las bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyor ba can gyi yid la byed pa gnyis las bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the two applications of mental attention,

original: 'jug pa nye bar rtogs pa'i sbyor ba can ni gang gis rnam pa gnyis la 'jug pa nye bar rtogs pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jug pa nye bar rtogs pa'i sbyor ba can ni gang gis rnam pa gnyis la 'jug pa nye bar rtogs pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the application of realizing engagement is stated: By what one realizes the engagement in two aspects... and so on.

analyzed: gang gis chos @171b gnyis kyi tshad khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba ni 'jug pa nye bar rtogs pa'i sbyor ba can zhes bya'o //
translated: The application by which one penetrates the measure of the two kinds of dharmas is called the application of penetrating engagement.

analyzed: gang zag gang gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: rnam pa gnyis la 'jug pa nye bar rtogs zhes bya ba ni yi ge rnams kyi tshad la 'jug pa nye bar rtogs pa dang / ming dang tshig gnyis kyi tshad la 'jug pa nye bar rtogs pa'o //

translated: Penetrating the two kinds of engagement is the penetration of the measure of syllables and the penetration of the measure of the two, name and phrase.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: yi ge rnams kyi tshad la 'jug pa dang / ming dang tshig gi tshad med pa la 'jug pa'o zhes smos te /

analyzed: yi ge rnams kyi tshad yod par shes pa ni yi ge rnams kyi tshad la 'jug pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: de yi ge'i phyi mo ni aa nas ka'i bar du bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad las med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there are only forty-eight letters from a to k·π£a.

analyzed: lha sbyin dang mchod spyin zhes ming du btags ba dang / 'dus byas mi rtag ces tshig tu btags pa rnams la tshad med par khong du chud pa ni ming dang tshig gi tshad med pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The understanding of the immeasurability of names and phrases is called the application to the immeasurability of names and phrases.

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde de dag gi nang nas ming dang tshig dpag tu med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in the sutras such as the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas, there are immeasurable names and phrases.

original: spyor ba can gyi yid la byed pa gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir kun rtog pa nye bar rtogs pa'i sbyor ba can ni /
analyzed: spyor ba can gyi yid la byed pa gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir kun rtog pa nye bar rtogs pa'i sbyor ba can ni /
translated: To explain the third mental application of the one with application, it is said:üîΩThe one with application who realizes the two conceptualizations

original: gang gis gnyis bzung nas kun rtog pa gnyis nye bar rtogs pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgang gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gis gnyis bzung nas kun rtog pa gnyis nye bar rtogs pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: through apprehending the two.üîΩAs for through apprehending the two,üîΩ it is asked: By whom?

original: gang zag gang gis she'am /
analyzed: gang zag gang gis she'am /
translated: Or what?

original: yid la byed pa gang gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid la byed pa gang gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúby which mental attention‚Äù is the same.

original: ming gzung ba dang don gzung ba'i sgo nas ming dang don gnyis rtogs na de gnyi ga nyid kyis don rtogs par 'gyur ba ni kun rtog pa nye bar rtogs pa'i sbyor ba can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ming gzung ba dang don gzung ba'i sgo nas ming dang don gnyis rtogs na de gnyi ga nyid kyis don rtogs par 'gyur ba ni kun rtog pa nye bar rtogs pa'i sbyor ba can zhes bya'o //
translated: When one understands the two, name and referent, by way of apprehending the name and apprehending the referent, then one understands the referent by means of both. This is called ‚Äúthe application of understanding the conception.‚Äù

analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu dang / lha sbyin dang mchod spyin zhes bya ba'i ming shes pa ni ming la kun rtog pas gzung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the names ‚Äúpot,‚Äù ‚Äúcloth,‚Äù ‚ÄúDevadatta,‚Äù and ‚ÄúYaj√±adatta‚Äù is called ‚Äúthe apprehension of the conception of the name.‚Äù

original: de ltar ming shes nas bum pa'i zhes bya ba'i ming la de'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ming shes nas bum pa'i zhes bya ba'i ming la de'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: Having understood the name in that way, one thinks, ‚ÄúWhat is the referent of the name ‚Äòpot‚Äô?‚Äù

original: lto zlum po ske dang sdeng sdeng po chu blugs su rung ba ste /
analyzed: lto zlum po ske dang sdeng sdeng po chu blugs su rung ba ste /
translated: It is a round-bellied thing with a flat base, suitable for collecting water.

original: rtogs pa ni ming gi sgo nas don la kun rtog pa gzung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni ming gi sgo nas don la kun rtog pa gzung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúthe apprehension of the conception of the referent by way of the name.‚Äù

original: de kun rtog pa gzung ste /
analyzed: de kun rtog pa gzung ste /
translated: One apprehends that conception.

original: kun rtog pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun rtog pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Imagined is the name.

analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba'i don lto zlum po ske dang sdeng sdeng po chu @172a * //
translated: The meaning of the word pot is a round container with a long neck and a flat bottom, suitable for holding water.

analyzed: blugs su rung ba de la ming du ji skad bya zhen /
translated: What is the name of that?

analyzed: de la ni bum pa zhes bya'o zhes rtogs pa ni don gyi sgo nas ming du btags pa yin no //
translated: It is called pot. The understanding of that is the designation of a name by means of the object.

analyzed: yi ge ni kun brtags pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yi ge ka dang aa la sogs pa gug skyed med pa rnams la ni kun brtags pa zhes bya bar mi bzhag ste /
translated: The letters are not imagined. The letters ka, a, etc., without the curves are not posited as imagined.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: yi ge 'bru gcig la ni ming med do //

analyzed: ming med pas ni de don rtag tu mi rung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sbyor ba can gyi yid la byed pa bzhi pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the fourth mental attention of the practitioner,

analyzed: rim pa nye bar rtogs pa'i sbyor ba can ni /
translated: the practitioner who understands the stages.

analyzed: gang gis ming kun 'dzin pa sngon byas pa'i don 'dzin pa la 'jug pa nye bar rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The one who previously formed the name engages in apprehending the object.

analyzed: sngar ming btags shing shes par byas nas de nas ming shes zin pa'i 'og tu don shes par byed pa ni rim pa nye bar rtogs pa'i sbyor ba can zhes bya ste /
translated: Having previously designated and understood the name, then after one has understood the name, one understands the object. This is called the application of understanding the order.

analyzed: de yang 'jig rten pa dag tha snyad la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir bum pa dang snam bu dang lha spyin dang mchod sbyin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ming ji ltar shes par byed do //

original: de ltar ming ji ltar shes par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar ming ji ltar shes par byas nas /
translated: Having understood the name in that way,

original: de nas don gyi dngos po 'di la ming du ji skad cas bya zhe'am ming 'di skad ces bya ba'i don ni 'di lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de nas don gyi dngos po 'di la ming du ji skad cas bya zhe'am ming 'di skad ces bya ba'i don ni 'di lta bu yin no //
translated: then they understand the object in dependence on the name, thinking, What is the name of this thing? or The meaning of this name is such and such.

original: ma zhes ming la brten nas don la rtogs so //
analyzed: ma zhes ming la brten nas don la rtogs so //
translated: They understand the object in dependence on the name.

original: sbyor ba can gyi yid la byed pa lnga pas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyor ba can gyi yid la byed pa lnga pas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the fifth mental attention of the application,

analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa'i sbyor ba de yang rnam pa bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
