analyzed: ming du btags pa dang don du btags pa'i chos 'di dag ni gyi na brnyan mar btags par zad do zhes khong du chud pa na glo bur du byung ba rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one understands that these dharmas designated by names and designated by meanings are mere adventitious designations, it is called full realization of adventitious occurrence.

original: gang gi phyir don la ming btags pa rnams kyang gyi na glo bur btags pa yin la ming la don du btags pa rnams kyang gyi na glo bur btags par khong du chud pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don la ming btags pa rnams kyang gyi na glo bur btags pa yin la ming la don du btags pa rnams kyang gyi na glo bur btags par khong du chud pa ste /
translated: Because one understands that names designated for meanings are also mere adventitious designations, and meanings designated in names are also mere adventitious designations.

original: de ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa drod kyi dus na khong du chud do //
analyzed: de ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa drod kyi dus na khong du chud do //
translated: That is understood in the stage of action in faith at the time of heat.

original: yang dag par snang ba'i mtshan ma rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag par snang ba'i mtshan ma rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Realization of the signs of correct appearance.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i chos de dag yod pa ma yin pa las yod pa lta bur snang ba ni yang dag par snang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i chos de dag yod pa ma yin pa las yod pa lta bur snang ba ni yang dag par snang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The nonexistence of the phenomena of subject and object appears as if it were existent, and this is called correct appearance.

original: 'di ltar snang bar byed @172b pa'i rgyu la mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar snang bar byed @172b pa'i rgyu la mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the cause of appearance is called a sign.

original: de ltar snang bar byed pa'i rgyu ni sems dang sems las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar snang bar byed pa'i rgyu ni sems dang sems las byung ba yin te /
translated: The cause of such appearance is mind and mental factors.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa 'di dag sems dang sems las byung ba la snang bar khong du chud pa ni yang dag par snang ba'i mtshan ma rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa 'di dag sems dang sems las byung ba la snang bar khong du chud pa ni yang dag par snang ba'i mtshan ma rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Understanding that these subjects and objects appear to mind and mental factors is called realization of the signs of correct appearance.

original: de yang mos pa spyod pa'i sa rtse mo'i dus na de ltar rtogs so //
analyzed: de yang mos pa spyod pa'i sa rtse mo'i dus na de ltar rtogs so //
translated: Moreover, this is realized on the stage of action in faith at the peak stage.

original: don mi dmigs pa rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don mi dmigs pa rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Realization of the nonapprehension of objects.

original: gzugs nas chos kyi bar du yul drug la bya ste yul drug po de dag la mi rtog cing de dag sems la snang ba thams cad spangs nas mi snang bar gyur nas don mi dmigs pa rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs nas chos kyi bar du yul drug la bya ste yul drug po de dag la mi rtog cing de dag sems la snang ba thams cad spangs nas mi snang bar gyur nas don mi dmigs pa rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The six objects are the six objects from form to mental objects. The non-conceptualization of those six objects is the abandonment of all appearances of those objects in the mind, and the non-appearance of those objects is called the realization of the non-apprehension of objects.

original: de yang mos pa spyod pa'i sa bzod pa'i dus na rtogs so //
analyzed: de yang mos pa spyod pa'i sa bzod pa'i dus na rtogs so //
translated: Moreover, that is realized in the stage of action in faith at the time of acceptance.

original: dmigs pa mi dmigs pa rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa mi dmigs pa rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The realization of the non-apprehension of apprehension is as follows:

original: yul drug la dmigs par byed pa'i sems mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du med par khong du chud pa ni dmigs pa mi dmigs pa rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul drug la dmigs par byed pa'i sems mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du med par khong du chud pa ni dmigs pa mi dmigs pa rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The comprehension that there is no mind that apprehends the six objects, from eye consciousness to mind consciousness, is called the realization of the non-apprehension of apprehension.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzung ba med pa dang de la 'dzin par byed pa'i sems kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes khong du chud pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzung ba med pa dang de la 'dzin par byed pa'i sems kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes khong du chud pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is comprehended that there is no object to be apprehended and also no mind that apprehends it.

original: de ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa'i 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi dus na khong du chud do //
analyzed: de ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa'i 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi dus na khong du chud do //
translated: This is comprehended at the time of the supreme mundane state on the level of earnest aspiration.

original: chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Realization of the expanse of reality.

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis spangs nas mthong ba'i lam nas chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du mthong ba ni chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis spangs nas mthong ba'i lam nas chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du mthong ba ni chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, having eliminated the duality of subject and object, the expanse of reality is seen on the path of seeing as having the nature of extending everywhere. This is called ‚Äúrealization of the expanse of reality.‚Äù

original: de'ang sa dang po'i tshe'i khong du chud do //
analyzed: de'ang sa dang po'i tshe'i khong du chud do //
translated: And that is comprehended on the first bodhisattva level.üîΩRealization of the individual no self.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la mthong ba'i lam na nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pas ni gang zag la bdag med pa la rab tu rtogs te /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la mthong ba'i lam na nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pas ni gang zag la bdag med pa la rab tu rtogs te /
translated: On the path of seeing, sravakas, stream enterers and so on realize the individual no self.

original: phung po lnga tsam du zad kyi mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag ni yod pa ma yin no zhes khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po lnga tsam du zad kyi mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag ni yod pa ma yin no zhes khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have comprehended that there are just the five aggregates and that the self imputed by the tƒ´rthikas does not exist.

original: chos la bdag med par rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos la bdag med par rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: and the realization of the selflessness of dharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni mthong ba'i lam la chos la bdag med par rab tu rtogs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni mthong ba'i lam la chos la bdag med par rab tu rtogs te /
translated: The bodhisattvas realize the selflessness of dharmas on the path of seeing,

original: phung po lnga nyid kyang rmi lam gyi gzugs bzhin du med do zhes khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po lnga nyid kyang rmi lam gyi gzugs bzhin du med do zhes khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they understand that the five aggregates are like a form in a dream and do not exist.

original: bsam pa chung du rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /üîΩnyan thos rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi @173a * //
analyzed: bsam pa chung du rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la / nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi @173a * //
translated: and the realization of the lesser resolve.

original: 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni bsam pa chung dus rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni bsam pa chung dus rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The sravakas who are stream-enterers, once-returners, nonreturners, arhats, and pratyekabuddhas are said to have the realization of the lesser resolve,

original: bdag gi don tsam du bya ba dang / gang zag la bdag med pa tsam las ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi don tsam du bya ba dang / gang zag la bdag med pa tsam las ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not realize anything beyond the mere activity for their own benefit and the mere selflessness of the person.

original: rgya chen por bdag nyid chen po'i bsam pa rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgya chen por bdag nyid chen po'i bsam pa rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: and the realization of the great resolve of the great beings.

original: sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rgya chen po'i bdag nyid chen po'i bsam pa rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rgya chen po'i bdag nyid chen po'i bsam pa rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas on the tenth stage and the tathagatas are called the realization of the great aspiration of the great vehicle.

original: bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba rtogs pa dang / gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba rtogs pa dang / gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they realize the benefit for themselves and all sentient beings and they realize the selflessness of persons and things.

original: ji ltar chos khong du chud pa'i chos rnam par gzhag pa'i rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar chos khong du chud pa'i chos rnam par gzhag pa'i rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: How is the realization of the classification of the Dharma that is realized through the Dharma?

original: mthong ba'i lam sa dang po'i dus na chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa ni ji ltar chos khong du chud pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam sa dang po'i dus na chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa ni ji ltar chos khong du chud pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At the time of the first stage, the path of seeing, the realization of the dharmadhatu is called the realization of the Dharma.

original: de ltar chos kyi dbyings khong du chud nas de khong du chud pa'i yon tan skad cig ma gcig la de bzhin gshegs pa brgya'i zhal lta ba la sogs pa rnams rtogs pa ni chos rnams par gzhag pa rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi dbyings khong du chud nas de khong du chud pa'i yon tan skad cig ma gcig la de bzhin gshegs pa brgya'i zhal lta ba la sogs pa rnams rtogs pa ni chos rnams par gzhag pa rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Having realized the dharmadhatu in that way, the realization of the qualities of that realization, such as seeing the faces of a hundred tathagatas in a single instant, is called the realization of the classification of the Dharma.

original: de yang sa dang po'i dus na yang dag pa'i lta bas rtogs so //
analyzed: de yang sa dang po'i dus na yang dag pa'i lta bas rtogs so //
translated: Moreover, on the first spiritual level, one acquires the correct view.

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i chos rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i chos rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Correctly determining the Dharma refers to

original: sa gnyis nas sa bcu man chad na bsgom par bya ba'i chos rnams kyang rab tu rtogs shing de'i yon tan skad cig gcig la de bzhin gshegs pa stong gi zhal mthong ba la sogs pa ni rnam par gzhag pa'i chos rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste
analyzed: sa gnyis nas sa bcu man chad na bsgom par bya ba'i chos rnams kyang rab tu rtogs shing de'i yon tan skad cig gcig la de bzhin gshegs pa stong gi zhal mthong ba la sogs pa ni rnam par gzhag pa'i chos rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste
translated: the spiritual levels from the second to the tenth. The Dharma that is to be cultivated is also correctly determined on these levels. The qualities of the latter, such as the vision of a thousand Buddhas in a single instant, are called correctly determining the Dharma.

original: / 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam na yang dag pa'i rtog pas rtogs so //üîΩdbang byed pa yid la byed pa ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam na yang dag pa'i rtog pas rtogs so // dbang byed pa yid la byed pa ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is acquired by means of correct thought on the path of meditative development.üîΩThe attention that is dominant refers to three kinds.

original: dbang byed pa'i yid la byed pa la rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: dbang byed pa'i yid la byed pa la rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: The attention that is dominant refers to three kinds:

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dag la dbang byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dag la dbang byed pa dang / da ltar mngon par bsgrub pa la dbang byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dag la dbang byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dag la dbang byed pa dang / da ltar mngon par bsgrub pa la dbang byed pa'o //
translated: mastery over the purification of the obscurations of the passions, mastery over the purification of the obscurations of the passions and the knowable, and mastery over the accomplishment of the present.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The purification of the obscurations of the passions is to be known as the purification of the obscurations of the knowable.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams la bya ste /üîΩnyon mongs pa de dag nyid rnam par thar pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa na sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams la bya ste / nyon mongs pa de dag nyid rnam par thar pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa na sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The passions are desire, etc., which are to be abandoned by the paths of vision and of cultivation.üîΩWhen they are obstacles to the attainment of liberation and Nirvana, they are called obscurations.üîΩThe purification of the obscurations of the passions is to be known as the purification of the obscurations of the knowable.üîΩThe purification of the obscurations of the knowable is to be known as the purification of the obscurations of the passions.

original: sgrib pa de dag spangs nas phyis @173b sems kyi rgyud la mi skye bar byas pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa de dag spangs nas phyis @173b sems kyi rgyud la mi skye bar byas pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The purification of the obscurations of the passions is to be known as the purification of the obscurations of the knowable.

original: 'dis ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dag pa la dbang byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dag pa la dbang byed pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the mastery over the purification of the obscurations of the passions.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe purification of the obscurations of the mental afflictions and of the knowable‚Äù is explained as follows.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni gong du bshad par zad do//
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni gong du bshad par zad do//
translated: The obscurations of the mental afflictions have already been explained above.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i chos la yod par chags pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i chos la yod par chags pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The attachment to the existence of the objects and the subject of knowledge is called the ‚Äúobscuration of the knowable.‚Äù

original: de yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pas na sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: de yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pas na sgrib pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is an obscuration because it is an obstruction to the attainment of the knowledge of an omniscient being.

original: sgrib pa de spangs nas phyis mi skye bar byas pa la shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa de spangs nas phyis mi skye bar byas pa la shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The purification of that obscuration, which is accomplished by preventing its arising in the future, is called the ‚Äúpurification of the obscuration of the knowable.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dag pa la dbang byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dag pa la dbang byed pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that the power of the bodhisattvas is directed toward the purification of the obscurations of the mental afflictions and of the knowable.

original: yon tan mngon par sgrub pa shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yon tan mngon par sgrub pa shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe purification of the accomplishment of the qualities‚Äù is explained as follows.

original: yon tan ni mngon par shes pa drug dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni mngon par shes pa drug dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa la bya'o //
translated: The qualities are the six forms of supernatural knowledge, the powers, the forms of intrepid confidence, and so forth.

original: yon tan de dag thob par bya ba la bar du gcod dang spangs nas yon tan de dag mngon sum du byas pa la yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yon tan de dag thob par bya ba la bar du gcod dang spangs nas yon tan de dag mngon sum du byas pa la yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The accomplishment of those qualities is called the very pure accomplishment of the qualities, because it is the direct realization of those qualities after having abandoned the obstacles to their acquisition.

original: 'dis ni yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa la dbang byed pa bstan to ;üîΩ/ chos la da khon nyid kyi don yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dis ni yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa la dbang byed pa bstan to ; / chos la da khon nyid kyi don yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This shows the mastery of the accomplishment of the qualities.üîΩTwo verses on the investigation of the meaning of reality in the teaching.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos so //
translated: The teaching is twofold: the teaching of addictive reality and the teaching of purification.

original: chos de dag gi de kho na nyid ni chos de dag gi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: chos de dag gi de kho na nyid ni chos de dag gi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The reality of those teachings is the nature of their undistorted characteristics.

original: de yang kun btags kyi rang bzhin dang / gzhan dbang gi rang bzhin dang / yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang kun btags kyi rang bzhin dang / gzhan dbang gi rang bzhin dang / yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the imagined nature, the relative nature, and the perfect nature.

original: chos de dag kyang 'jig rten las 'das ba'i ye shes thob pas ni khong du chud do //
analyzed: chos de dag kyang 'jig rten las 'das ba'i ye shes thob pas ni khong du chud do //
translated: And those phenomena are penetrated by attaining supramundane wisdom.

original: yid la byed pa'i tshol ba'i skabs bshad pa'i rjes la chos la de kho na nyid kyi don yongs su tshol ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i tshol ba'i skabs bshad pa'i rjes la chos la de kho na nyid kyi don yongs su tshol ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the explanation of the search for mental attention and the explanation of the search for the meaning of reality in phenomena?

original: yid la byed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid la byed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: In what is called mental attention,

original: rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba dang / ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba dang / mnyam par gzhag ba rnams ni don gcig ste /
analyzed: rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba dang / ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba dang / mnyam par gzhag ba rnams ni don gcig ste /
translated: one-pointedness, concentration, and equipoise have the same meaning.

original: mdo las sems mnyam par gzhag pa thob na de kho na nyid khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas yid la byed pa'i skabs kyi rjes la de kho na'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: mdo las sems mnyam par gzhag pa thob na de kho na nyid khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas yid la byed pa'i skabs kyi rjes la de kho na'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Since it is said in the sutras that when one attains mental equipoise, one penetrates reality, the explanation of the search for reality is connected to the explanation of the search for mental attention.

original: de nyid gang ni gnyis kyis rtag tu spangs //
analyzed: de nyid gang ni gnyis kyis rtag tu spangs //
translated: That reality is always abandoned by the two.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩgang zag dang chos @174a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / gang zag dang chos @174a * //
translated: Here,

original: la bdag med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid la de nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: la bdag med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid la de nyid ces bya'o //
translated: the emptiness that is the nature of the selflessness of persons and phenomena is called reality.

original: stong pa nyid so so'i skye bo nas 'phags pa'i dus na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid so so'i skye bo nas 'phags pa'i dus na /
translated: Emptiness is free from the duality of subject and object at the time of ordinary beings and at the time of ƒÅryas.

original: yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba yin pas rtag tu gnyis kyis spangs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba yin pas rtag tu gnyis kyis spangs zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is always free from the duality of subject and object.

original: de ltar rtag tu gzung 'dzin dang bral yang /
analyzed: de ltar rtag tu gzung 'dzin dang bral yang /
translated: Thus, although it is always free from subject and object,

original: gzung 'dzin lta bur sdang ba 'di ni kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩnong pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la nor ba'i gnas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de thag pa la sprul du rtogs pa bzhin du gzhan dbang ste /
analyzed: gzung 'dzin lta bur sdang ba 'di ni kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to // nong pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la nor ba'i gnas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de thag pa la sprul du rtogs pa bzhin du gzhan dbang ste /
translated: it appears as if it has subject and object. This is the imagined characteristic.üîΩThe basis of error is the dependent characteristic, like a rope that is imagined to be a snake.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa lta bur rtogs pa'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir nor pa'i gnas zhes bya'o//
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa lta bur rtogs pa'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir nor pa'i gnas zhes bya'o//
translated: It is called the basis of error because it is the cause for the realization of subject and object, like a rope imagined to be a snake.

original: gzhan dbang gis gzung 'dzin lta bur rtogs pas so //
analyzed: gzhan dbang gis gzung 'dzin lta bur rtogs pas so //
translated: The dependent characteristic is the cause for the realization of subject and object.

original: spros pa med par rnam pa kun du spyod mi nus zhes bya ba la spros pa med cing brjod par mi nus pa ni yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: spros pa med par rnam pa kun du spyod mi nus zhes bya ba la spros pa med cing brjod par mi nus pa ni yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: It is impossible to engage in all activities without conceptualization. The nature of the perfected is free from conceptualization and inexpressible.

original: yongs su grub pa gzung 'dzin gyi chos med pas na spros pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa gzung 'dzin gyi chos med pas na spros pa med pa'o //
translated: The fulfilled is without the phenomena of subject and object, and so is without conceptual elaboration.

original: yongs su grub pa de ming dang tshig dang yi ges 'di 'dra'o zhes tha snyad du mi rung bas na rnam pa kun du brjod mi nus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa de ming dang tshig dang yi ges 'di 'dra'o zhes tha snyad du mi rung bas na rnam pa kun du brjod mi nus zhes bya'o //
translated: The fulfilled cannot be conventionally expressed by names, phrases, and letters as being like this, and so it is said that it cannot be expressed in any way.

original: shes bya zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes bya zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to what is to be known,

original: dang po kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid ni shes par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dang po kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid ni shes par bya ba yin te /
translated: the first, the imagined characteristic, is to be known.

original: ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it to be known?

original: kun brtags kyi chas 'di dag ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du yod pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi chas 'di dag ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du yod pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: It is to be known that these things, in terms of the imagined aspect, do not exist, like the horns of a rabbit.

original: spangs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spangs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to what is to be abandoned,

original: gnyis pa gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid ni spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid ni spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: the second, the dependent characteristic, is not to be abandoned.

original: gzhan dbang la yod pa'i gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma spyang dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dbang la yod pa'i gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma spyang dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The stains of subject and object that exist in the dependent must be purified.

original: rnam sbyangs rang bzhin dri ma med par rig / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam sbyangs rang bzhin dri ma med par rig / ces bya ba la /
translated: The fulfilled is to be known as the nature that is pure of stains.

original: gsum pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par sbyangs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gsum pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par sbyangs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The characteristic of the consummate is to be known as purification.

original: yongs su grub pa nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid rnam par dag cing dri ma med pa yin yang glo bur gyi dri ma sbyang bar mi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid rnam par dag cing dri ma med pa yin yang glo bur gyi dri ma sbyang bar mi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Even though the nature of the consummate itself is pure and stainless, it is not that adventitious stains are not purified,

original: spyang dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyang dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they must be purified.

original: de ltar yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin yang glo bur gyi dri ma sbyang dgos pa'i rnam pa gsum bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde ni nam mkha' gser dang chu 'dra nyon mongs rnam dag 'dod //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin yang glo bur gyi dri ma sbyang dgos pa'i rnam pa gsum bstan pa'i phyir / de ni nam mkha' gser dang chu 'dra nyon mongs rnam dag 'dod //
translated: Thus, even though the nature of the consummate is pure, it is taught that the three aspects of adventitious stains must be purified.

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: It is asserted that the afflictions are purified like space, gold, and water.

original: dper na nam mkha' dang gser dang chu rnams rang bzhin gyis dag kyang glo bur gyi dri ma sprin dang sa rdo dang rnyog pa bsal dgos pa de bzhin du yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin yang rang bzhin gyis rnam @174b par dag pa yin mod kyi glo
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' dang gser dang chu rnams rang bzhin gyis dag kyang glo bur gyi dri ma sprin dang sa rdo dang rnyog pa bsal dgos pa de bzhin du yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin yang rang bzhin gyis rnam @174b par dag pa yin mod kyi glo
translated: Likewise, the nature of the consummate is indeed naturally pure, but adventitious stains must be purified.

original: bur gyi dri ma sbyang dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bur gyi dri ma sbyang dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: de las gzhan ni 'jig rten dag na ci yang med //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: de las gzhan ni 'jig rten dag na ci yang med // ces bya ba la /
translated: There is nothing else in the world apart from that.

original: de'i spras ni chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: de'i spras ni chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid la bya ste /
translated: The ornament of that is the emptiness of the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: stong pa nyid las gzhan pa'i chos stong par ma 'dus pa'i chos ni 'jig rten na gzugs la sogs pa gang yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid las gzhan pa'i chos stong par ma 'dus pa'i chos ni 'jig rten na gzugs la sogs pa gang yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Apart from emptiness, there is no phenomenon that is not included in emptiness. There is no phenomenon whatsoever, such as form, that exists in the world.

original: ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyi nang gi chos thams cad stong pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi nang gi chos thams cad stong pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all outer and inner phenomena are pervaded by emptiness.

original: 'gro ba ma lus pa yang de la rmongs pa'i blo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus pa yang de la rmongs pa'i blo zhes bya ba la /
translated: And the minds of all beings are confused about that.

original: de ltar stong pa'i mtshan nyid kyis chos thams cad la khyab pa la /
analyzed: de ltar stong pa'i mtshan nyid kyis chos thams cad la khyab pa la /
translated: Thus, the characteristic of emptiness pervades all phenomena.

original: stong pa'i chos tsam zhig yod par zad kyi /
analyzed: stong pa'i chos tsam zhig yod par zad kyi /
translated: There is only the mere phenomenon of emptiness.

original: de las lhag pa gzhan med na sems can thams cad kyang stong pa'i chos de la mgo rmongs te /
analyzed: de las lhag pa gzhan med na sems can thams cad kyang stong pa'i chos de la mgo rmongs te /
translated: If there is nothing else beyond that, all sentient beings are confused about that phenomenon of emptiness.

original: stong pa'i chos ma rtogs ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa'i chos ma rtogs ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they do not realize or see the phenomenon of emptiness.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten gti mug rnam pa ni mngon 'phel zhes bya ba la 'di ni 'jig rten du ngo mtshar du bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten gti mug rnam pa ni mngon 'phel zhes bya ba la 'di ni 'jig rten du ngo mtshar du bya ba ste /
translated: How is it that the world is deluded?

original: stong pas kun du khyab tu zin kyang stong pa mi mthong ba'i gti mug dang ma rig pa 'di 'khor ba thog ma med ba nas ji ltar rnyed cing ba skyed nas 'phel ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stong pas kun du khyab tu zin kyang stong pa mi mthong ba'i gti mug dang ma rig pa 'di 'khor ba thog ma med ba nas ji ltar rnyed cing ba skyed nas 'phel ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is a wonder of the world: although it is pervaded by emptiness, it does not see emptiness. This delusion and ignorance have been acquired since beginningless samsara and are said to increase.

original: yod pa kun du rnam spangs med la mngon par chags //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yod pa kun du rnam spangs med la mngon par chags // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Totally abandoning existence, they are attached to nonexistence.

original: de ltar stong pas kun du khyab ste /
analyzed: de ltar stong pas kun du khyab ste /
translated: Thus, it is pervaded by emptiness.

original: stong par ma 'dus pa med na yod pa'i chos stong pa ni ma spangs te ;
analyzed: stong par ma 'dus pa med na yod pa'i chos stong pa ni ma spangs te ;
translated: If there is nothing that is not included in emptiness, then the empty nature of existent things is not abandoned.

original: ma mthong ba med pa'i chos gzugs la sogs pa ri bong gi rva bzhin med pa yin mngon par chags shing yod par 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: ma mthong ba med pa'i chos gzugs la sogs pa ri bong gi rva bzhin med pa yin mngon par chags shing yod par 'dzin par byed do //
translated: One does not see the non-existent things such as form, etc., which are like the horn of a donkey, and one becomes attached to them and grasps them as existent.

original: de ni ngo mtshar du bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni ngo mtshar du bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the point of the statement, ‚ÄúThis is amazing!‚Äù

original: yang na mtshan nyid gsum las gzhan pa'i chos ni 'jig rten na ci yang med de /
analyzed: yang na mtshan nyid gsum las gzhan pa'i chos ni 'jig rten na ci yang med de /
translated: Or else, there is nothing in the world that is a thing other than the three natures,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad kyang mtshan nyid gsum du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad kyang mtshan nyid gsum du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all things, whether afflicted or pure, are included in the three natures.

original: de ltar mtshan nyid gsum tsam du zad na sems can thams cad kyang de la rmongs te /
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid gsum tsam du zad na sems can thams cad kyang de la rmongs te /
translated: Thus, since there are only three natures, all sentient beings are confused about them.

original: mtshan nyid gsum ma mthong ba'i gti mug 'di lta bur ji ltar spel te bskyed na yod pa'i chos mtshan nyid gsum ni ma mthong la med pa'i chos gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la ni chags par byed cas bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum ma mthong ba'i gti mug 'di lta bur ji ltar spel te bskyed na yod pa'i chos mtshan nyid gsum ni ma mthong la med pa'i chos gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la ni chags par byed cas bya ba'i don to //
translated: How can such delusion, which does not see the three realities, be increased? The meaning of the expression is that one does not see the existent reality of the three realities, but is attached to the nonexistent reality of subject and object.

original: chos kyi dbyings de lta bu'i mtshan nyid las /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de lta bu'i mtshan nyid las /
translated: From the reality of the ultimate element,

original: 'jig rten na gzhan chi yang med de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig rten na gzhan chi yang med de zhes bya ba la /
translated: there is nothing else in the world.

original: chos kyi dbyings gzung 'dzin dang bral ba la ni stong ba nyid las ma gtogs pa'i chos @175a * //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings gzung 'dzin dang bral ba la ni stong ba nyid las ma gtogs pa'i chos @175a * //
translated: In the ultimate element, which is free from subject and object, there is nothing at all apart from emptiness,

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa ci yang med de /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa ci yang med de /
translated: such as form, sound, and so on.

original: thams cad stong bas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad stong bas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because everything is pervaded by emptiness.

original: chos nyid las chos tha dad ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos nyid las chos tha dad ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the phenomena are not different from reality.

original: ci'i phyir stong pas khyab ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir stong pas khyab ce na /
translated: Why is it pervaded by emptiness?

original: chos nyid de stong pa las chos te /
analyzed: chos nyid de stong pa las chos te /
translated: From that emptiness, which is reality, there are phenomena.

original: gzugs la sogs pa logs shig na tha snyad tha dad par yod pa ma yin pas na thams cad stong pas khyab ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa logs shig na tha snyad tha dad par yod pa ma yin pas na thams cad stong pas khyab ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since form, etc. do not exist separately with a different name, the meaning is that all are empty.

original: de kho na nyid la sgyu ma lta bur yongs su tshol ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bco lnga'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de kho na nyid la sgyu ma lta bur yongs su tshol ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bco lnga'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Fifteen verses investigating illusion-like reality.

original: de kho na tshol ba'i skabs kyi rjes la de kho na la sgyu ma lta bur yongs su tshol ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de kho na tshol ba'i skabs kyi rjes la de kho na la sgyu ma lta bur yongs su tshol ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel ba ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the section on the investigation of reality and the section on the investigation of reality as illusion-like that is to be explained after it?

original: de kho na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de kho na zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for reality,

original: phyin ci ma log pa zhes bya ba dang / ma nor ba zhes bya ba dag don gcig ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa zhes bya ba dang / ma nor ba zhes bya ba dag don gcig ste /
translated: unmistaken and nonerroneous have the same meaning.

original: de yang yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / yang dag pa ste rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / yang dag pa ste rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Moreover, it is twofold: unreal and real.

original: de la yang dag pa ma yin pa la yang yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid du mthong ba dang yang dag pa la yang yang dag pa nyid du mthong ba na de nyid la kho na shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa ma yin pa la yang yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid du mthong ba dang yang dag pa la yang yang dag pa nyid du mthong ba na de nyid la kho na shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: There, when the unreal is seen as unreal and the real is seen as real, that is called knowledge of reality.

original: 'di ltar gong du /
analyzed: 'di ltar gong du /
translated: As it was said above:

original: de nyid gang ni rtag tu gnyis kyis spangs dang nor pa'i gnas //
analyzed: de nyid gang ni rtag tu gnyis kyis spangs dang nor pa'i gnas //
translated: Thatness is always free from the two, and is the basis of error.

original: spros pa med pa rnam pa kun du brjod mi nus //
analyzed: spros pa med pa rnam pa kun du brjod mi nus //
translated: It is free from elaborations and cannot be expressed in any way.

original: zhes bya'o // kun pa rtags dang gzhan dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin gsum rim bzhin du gnyis dang bral ba dang / 'khru ba'i gnas dang / brjod du med cing spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid du bshad /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // kun pa rtags dang gzhan dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin gsum rim bzhin du gnyis dang bral ba dang / 'khru ba'i gnas dang / brjod du med cing spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid du bshad /
translated: The three natures‚Äîthe imaginary, the dependent, and the consummate‚Äîare explained respectively as free from the two, as the basis of error, and as having an inexpressible nature free from elaborations.

original: de kho na rnam pa gsum po de la rnam pa gang gis na sgyu ma lta bur yin par brtag cing btsal dgos te /
analyzed: de kho na rnam pa gsum po de la rnam pa gang gis na sgyu ma lta bur yin par brtag cing btsal dgos te /
translated: In regard to those three aspects of thatness, by what aspect should one investigate and seek the illusion-like nature?

original: de'i phyir de kho na nyid tshol ba'i skabs kyi rjes la de kho na nyid la sgyu ma lta bur yongs su tshol ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na nyid tshol ba'i skabs kyi rjes la de kho na nyid la sgyu ma lta bur yongs su tshol ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, after the section on the investigation of thatness, the section on the investigation of thatness as illusion-like is explained, and it is relevant.

original: yang na theg pa chen po'i mdo sde de dang de dag gi nang nas chos thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: yang na theg pa chen po'i mdo sde de dang de dag gi nang nas chos thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bshad de /
translated: Or else, in the MahƒÅyƒÅna s≈´tras, it is explained that all phenomena are like illusions.

original: ji ltar na chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu yin par brtag cing btsal ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa bco lnga rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩji ltar sgyu ma de bzhin du //
analyzed: ji ltar na chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu yin par brtag cing btsal ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa bco lnga rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to // ji ltar sgyu ma de bzhin du //
translated: How should one investigate and seek all phenomena as being like illusions?

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ste //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ste // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fifteen verses begin with the words, ‚ÄúJust as an illusion is, so is imagination of what is unreal.‚ÄùüîΩAn illusion is a cause that appears as a horse, an elephant, etc.,üîΩthrough the power of spells and medicine, etc.,üîΩand is composed of sticks, clods, and so on.

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sngags dang sman gyis yongs su zin pa'i mthu las sgyu ma'i rta dang glang po la sogs pa snang ba'i rgyu rdo dang shing la sogs pa lta bur ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du brtags te /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sngags dang sman gyis yongs su zin pa'i mthu las sgyu ma'i rta dang glang po la sogs pa snang ba'i rgyu rdo dang shing la sogs pa lta bur ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du brtags te /
translated: So too is the imagination of what is unreal,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rten cing 'brel te 'gyur @175b ba gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rten cing 'brel te 'gyur @175b ba gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid yin par 'dod de /
translated: which is the dependent characteristic, consisting of mind and mental functions, and is produced through the power of beginningless predispositions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: sngags dang sman gyis zin pa'i rdo dang shing bus yang rta dang glang por snang ba'i rgyu byed pa de bzhin du gzhan dbang yang gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa lta bur snang ba'i rgyu byed pas na rdo shing gi tshul lta bur blta'o //
analyzed: sngags dang sman gyis zin pa'i rdo dang shing bus yang rta dang glang por snang ba'i rgyu byed pa de bzhin du gzhan dbang yang gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa lta bur snang ba'i rgyu byed pas na rdo shing gi tshul lta bur blta'o //
translated: Just as a stone or a stick, by the power of mantra and medicine, causes the appearance of a horse or an elephant, in the same way, the other-dependent, by the power of the error of duality, causes the appearance of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma byas pa ltar//
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma byas pa ltar//
translated: The imagined should be regarded as like a magical creation.

original: nor pa gnyis zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: nor pa gnyis zhes bya ba la //
translated: The two errors are said to be like that.

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyi sman dang sngags kyi mthus rdo dang shing la sogs pa las sgyu ma'i gzugs rta dang glang po la sogs pa sgyu ma'i dbyibs sna tshogs snang ba ltar ni gzhan dbang la kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid nor pa gnyis su snang bar
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyi sman dang sngags kyi mthus rdo dang shing la sogs pa las sgyu ma'i gzugs rta dang glang po la sogs pa sgyu ma'i dbyibs sna tshogs snang ba ltar ni gzhan dbang la kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid nor pa gnyis su snang bar
translated: For example, by the power of mantra and medicine, a magician causes the appearance of various forms of magical creations, such as horses, elephants, and so on, from things such as sticks, stones, and so on. In the same way, the imagined characteristic in the other-dependent is seen to be like the appearance of the two errors.

original: bltas ta / nor ba gnyis ni gzung ba lta bur snang ba dang / 'dzin pa lta bur snang ba'o //
analyzed: bltas ta / nor ba gnyis ni gzung ba lta bur snang ba dang / 'dzin pa lta bur snang ba'o //
translated: The two errors are the appearance as the apprehended and the appearance as the apprehender.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtogs pa la nor pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtogs pa la nor pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The two errors are in the imagination of what is unreal.

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The imagination of what is unreal is the relative reality.

original: de la nor pa gnyis snang ba ni kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la nor pa gnyis snang ba ni kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The error of duality appearing therein is the imagined reality.

original: ji ltar de la de med bzhin /üîΩde ltar dam pa'i don du 'dod //
analyzed: ji ltar de la de med bzhin / de ltar dam pa'i don du 'dod //
translated: Just as it does not exist in that way,

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: so it is held to be ultimately.

original: mdo sde dag gis nang nas don dam pa'i bden pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes 'byung ba bden pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid spyod de /
analyzed: mdo sde dag gis nang nas don dam pa'i bden pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes 'byung ba bden pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid spyod de /
translated: In the sutras, the two realities are taught as ultimate reality and conventional reality.

original: dper na sgyu ma'i rta dang glang po la sogs pa'i dbyibs rdo dang shing la sogs rgyu las rta dang glang por snang mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i rta dang glang po la sogs pa'i dbyibs rdo dang shing la sogs rgyu las rta dang glang por snang mod kyi /
translated: For example, the shape of an illusory horse or elephant, which appears in a cause such as a stone or a piece of wood, is a horse or an elephant.

original: rdo dang shing de la rta dang glang po'i rang bzhin med pa de ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun du rtog pa'i rang bzhin gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med de /
analyzed: rdo dang shing de la rta dang glang po'i rang bzhin med pa de ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun du rtog pa'i rang bzhin gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med de /
translated: But the nature of a horse or an elephant does not exist in that stone or wood. In the same way, the relative reality has no nature of duality, of subject and object, which is imagined.

original: gzung 'dzin dang bral nas yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin par 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: gzung 'dzin dang bral nas yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin par 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that the perfected characteristic, which is free from the duality of subject and object, is not asserted to be ultimate reality.

original: 'dis ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid bshad do //üîΩji ltar de dag dmigs pa bzhin //
analyzed: 'dis ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid bshad do // ji ltar de dag dmigs pa bzhin //
translated: This explains the characteristic of ultimate reality.üîΩAs they appear, so they are

original: de dag kun rdzob bden ba'o //
analyzed: de dag kun rdzob bden ba'o //
translated: conventionally real.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩdper na sgyu ma'i shing dang / rdob las rta dang glang po la sogs pa'i dbyibs sna tshogs snang ba ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / dper na sgyu ma'i shing dang / rdob las rta dang glang po la sogs pa'i dbyibs sna tshogs snang ba ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid las /
translated: The meaning is this:

original: kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid gzung ba dang / 'dzin par snang ba thams cad ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid gzung ba dang / 'dzin par snang ba thams cad ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as various shapes such as horses and elephants appear in a magical creation of wood and stone, so all the appearances of the imagined characteristic as subject and object in the relative characteristic are conventional reality.

original: 'dis ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: This explains the characteristic of conventional reality.

original: ji lta bur ni de med na //
analyzed: ji lta bur ni de med na //
translated: How is it that they do not exist?

original: de yi rgyu yang snang bar byed //
analyzed: de yi rgyu yang snang bar byed //
translated: The cause of that appears.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: The meaning is this:

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyi sngags dang sman gyi mthus rdo dang shing las rta dang @176a * //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyi sngags dang sman gyi mthus rdo dang shing las rta dang @176a * //
translated: For example, by the power of the mantra and medicine of a magician, a horse, an elephant, and so on appear from a stone and a piece of wood.üîΩWhen the power of the mantra and medicine is exhausted, the shape of the horse and elephant does not exist and disappears.

original: glang po la sogs pa snang ba dang sngags dang sman gyi mthu tshad nas rta dang glang po'i dbyibs med de mi snang bar gyur na glang po la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi rgyu las snang ba rnyed de rta dang glang po ni mi mthong gi rdo dang shing
analyzed: glang po la sogs pa snang ba dang sngags dang sman gyi mthu tshad nas rta dang glang po'i dbyibs med de mi snang bar gyur na glang po la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi rgyu las snang ba rnyed de rta dang glang po ni mi mthong gi rdo dang shing
translated: When the shape of the horse and elephant is sought in the cause, the shape of the elephant and so on, one does not see the horse and elephant, but one sees the stone and the wood.

original: bu mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bu mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de bzhin shin tu gnas gyur na //
analyzed: de bzhin shin tu gnas gyur na //
translated: Likewise, when there is a complete transformation,

original: med par rtogs pa dmigs par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: med par rtogs pa dmigs par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the non-existent is realized and becomes the object.

original: de bzhin du nam gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gnyis med par rtogs na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid gnas gyur na gnyis dang bral ba'i rnam par yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du nam gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gnyis med par rtogs na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid gnas gyur na gnyis dang bral ba'i rnam par yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when the dependent characteristic of the foundation consciousness is realized to be non-dual apprehender and apprehended, and there is a complete transformation, the perfected characteristic free from duality becomes the object.

original: dper na thag pa la sbrul du mthong ba dang bral na thag pa mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na thag pa la sbrul du mthong ba dang bral na thag pa mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, when one is free from seeing a rope as a snake, one sees the rope.

original: gnas gyur na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa'i don yang dag par dmigs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas gyur na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa'i don yang dag par dmigs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: When there is a transformation, the meaning of unreal imagination is perceived correctly.

original: nam kun gzhi gnas gyur na gzhan dbang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i nor pa gnyis med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam kun gzhi gnas gyur na gzhan dbang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i nor pa gnyis med par 'gyur te /
translated: When the foundation consciousness is transformed, the dependent nature becomes free from the error of the duality of subject and object.

original: gzung 'dzin dang bral nas de'i tshe dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes rgyab nas thob pas yang dag pa ma yin par kun du rtog pa gzhan gyi dbang gi don ma nor bar rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzung 'dzin dang bral nas de'i tshe dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes rgyab nas thob pas yang dag pa ma yin par kun du rtog pa gzhan gyi dbang gi don ma nor bar rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: When it is free from subject and object, at that time, one obtains the subsequent pure mundane gnosis, and one realizes the meaning of the dependent nature, which is unreal imagination, without error.

original: ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: How is it realized?

original: gnyis dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid du rtogs shing mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid du rtogs shing mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is realized and seen as having the characteristic of being free from duality.

original: de yi rgyu las ji lta bur //üîΩ'jig rten ma nor 'dod bzhin spyod //
analyzed: de yi rgyu las ji lta bur // 'jig rten ma nor 'dod bzhin spyod //
translated: How does it act as the cause of that?

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: It is like the desire of the world, which is not erroneous.

original: de'i sgras ni rta dang glang po'i byad gzugs su snang ba la bya ste /
analyzed: de'i sgras ni rta dang glang po'i byad gzugs su snang ba la bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúit‚Äù refers to the appearance of the forms of horses and elephants.

original: de'i rgyu ni rdo dang shing bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni rdo dang shing bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Their causes are stones, sticks, and so on.üîΩFor example, when the forms of horses and elephants that appear from stones and sticks cease to appear, worldly people use the stones and sticks that are their causes without error and as they wish.

original: dper na rdo dang shing bu las rta dang glang po'i byad gzugs su snang ba'i byad gzugs rnams mi snang bar gyur na de'i rgyu rdo dang shing bu la 'jig rten pa rnams ma nor bar spyod pa dang / 'dod bzhin spyod do ma nor bar spyod pa ni rta dang glang po lta bur nor pa ma mthong gi rdo dang shing nyid du ma nor bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na rdo dang shing bu las rta dang glang po'i byad gzugs su snang ba'i byad gzugs rnams mi snang bar gyur na de'i rgyu rdo dang shing bu la 'jig rten pa rnams ma nor bar spyod pa dang / 'dod bzhin spyod do ma nor bar spyod pa ni rta dang glang po lta bur nor pa ma mthong gi rdo dang shing nyid du ma nor bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They use them without error because they do not see the error of horses and elephants but see only stones and sticks without error.

original: 'dod bzhin spyod pa ni de dag la chags pa dang 'jigs par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod bzhin spyod pa ni de dag la chags pa dang 'jigs par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They use them as they wish because they use them with attachment and fear.

original: de bzhin shin tu gyur na yang //
analyzed: de bzhin shin tu gyur na yang //
translated: Likewise, when the dependent nature is transformed,

original: ma log rnal 'byor 'dod bzhin spyod //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: ma log rnal 'byor 'dod bzhin spyod // ces bya ba la /
translated: the yogi uses it without error and as he wishes.

original: de dang 'dra bar gzhan dbang gnas gyur te //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar gzhan dbang gnas gyur te //
translated: Here, the dependent nature is transformed in the same way that the forms of horses and elephants are transformed.

original: gzung 'dzin gnyis spangs na phyin ci ma log pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams ma log par spyod pa dang de bzhin spyod do //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin gnyis spangs na phyin ci ma log pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams ma log par spyod pa dang de bzhin spyod do //
translated: If one abandons the duality of subject and object, one is a yogi who abides in non-error, and one practices without error.

original: ji ltar ma log par spyod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar ma log par spyod ce na /
translated: How does one practice without error?

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin @176b pa'i 'khrul pa ma mthong bas nam nor bar spyod do //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin @176b pa'i 'khrul pa ma mthong bas nam nor bar spyod do //
translated: One practices without error because one does not see the error of subject and object.

original: ji ltar 'dod bzhin spyod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod bzhin spyod ce na /
translated: How does one practice as one wishes?

original: de phan chad chags pa dang 'jigs pa med par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de phan chad chags pa dang 'jigs pa med par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one practices without attachment and fear after that.

original: de yi snang ba de la yod //
analyzed: de yi snang ba de la yod //
translated: That appearance exists for it,

original: de yi dngos po med pa ste //
analyzed: de yi dngos po med pa ste //
translated: but its entity does not exist.

original: de phyir sgra la sogs pa la //
analyzed: de phyir sgra la sogs pa la //
translated: Therefore, with regard to sound and so on,

original: yod dang med par brjod pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yod dang med par brjod pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: existence and nonexistence are said.

original: de'i sgra ni sgyu ma'i rta dang glang po'i dbyibs su snang ba'i rgyu rdo dang shing bu la bya ste /
analyzed: de'i sgra ni sgyu ma'i rta dang glang po'i dbyibs su snang ba'i rgyu rdo dang shing bu la bya ste /
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúit‚Äù refers to the cause of the appearance of the shape of an illusory horse or elephant, such as a stick or a pebble.

original: rdo dang shing bu de la rta dang glang po la sogs pa'i byad gzugs su 'khrul pa snang ba tsam ni med pa ma yin pas sgyu ma la sogs pa la yod pa zhes kyang mi brjod de /
analyzed: rdo dang shing bu de la rta dang glang po la sogs pa'i byad gzugs su 'khrul pa snang ba tsam ni med pa ma yin pas sgyu ma la sogs pa la yod pa zhes kyang mi brjod de /
translated: The mere appearance of the illusion of the form of a horse or elephant in the pebble or stick is not nonexistent. Therefore, it is not said that it exists in the illusion, etc.

original: de ltar 'khrul bar snang ba tsam yod kyang rta dang glang po'i dngos po nyid yod kyang ma yin pas med pa zhes brjod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar 'khrul bar snang ba tsam yod kyang rta dang glang po'i dngos po nyid yod kyang ma yin pas med pa zhes brjod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Although the mere appearance of the illusion exists in that way, since the thing, the horse or elephant, does not exist, it is not said that it exists. This is the meaning.

original: dngos po de la dngos med min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dngos po de la dngos med min // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not a non-thing in regard to that thing.

original: dngos po'i sgras ni rta dang glang po snang bar byed pa'i rgyu rdo dang shing bu la bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i sgras ni rta dang glang po snang bar byed pa'i rgyu rdo dang shing bu la bya ste /
translated: In this regard, the word ‚Äúthing‚Äù refers to the pebble or stick that is the cause of the appearance of the horse or elephant.

original: rdo dang shing bu las rta dang glang po'i dbyibs su snang ba 'khrul pa tsam du med pa ma yin pas na dngos med min zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdo dang shing bu las rta dang glang po'i dbyibs su snang ba 'khrul pa tsam du med pa ma yin pas na dngos med min zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the mere illusion of the appearance of the form of a horse or elephant in the pebble or stick is not nonexistent, it is not said to be a non-thing.

original: dngos med dngos po nyid ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dngos med dngos po nyid ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: A non-thing is not a thing.

original: de ltar 'khrul pa tsam du ni snang yang rta dang glang po'i dngos po nyid med de /
analyzed: de ltar 'khrul pa tsam du ni snang yang rta dang glang po'i dngos po nyid med de /
translated: Thus, although they appear as mere error, the entities of horses and elephants do not exist.

original: de bas na rta dang glang po'i dngos po nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na rta dang glang po'i dngos po nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that the entities of horses and elephants do not exist.

original: dngos dang dngos med bye brag med //üîΩrgyu la sogs pa brjod pa yin //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med bye brag med // rgyu la sogs pa brjod pa yin //
translated: Things and nonthings are not differentiated.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are described as causes and so on.

original: de ltar 'khrul pa tsam du ni yod kyi dngos po nyid med pas na dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis bye brag med cing don gcig par sgyu ma la sogs pa brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'khrul pa tsam du ni yod kyi dngos po nyid med pas na dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis bye brag med cing don gcig par sgyu ma la sogs pa brjod pa yin te /
translated: Thus, they exist as mere error, but since they are not entities, things and nonthings are not differentiated, and they are described as illusions and so on.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: gang 'khrul pa'i dngos po tsam du yod pa de nyid la brtags na don dam par ba lang la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du med pa yin pas yod pa dang med pa gnyis bye brag med de don gcig par brjod pa dang / gang pa lang la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa nyid la 'khrul pa tsam du snang ba'i dngos po med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang 'khrul pa'i dngos po tsam du yod pa de nyid la brtags na don dam par ba lang la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du med pa yin pas yod pa dang med pa gnyis bye brag med de don gcig par brjod pa dang / gang pa lang la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa nyid la 'khrul pa tsam du snang ba'i dngos po med pa ma yin te /
translated: The nonexistence of the entity that is a cow, etc. is not a nonentity that appears as a mere error.

original: yod pas na dngos po med pa dang dngos po gnyis su yang bye brag med de don gcig go //üîΩdngos med ma yin de ma yin //
analyzed: yod pas na dngos po med pa dang dngos po gnyis su yang bye brag med de don gcig go // dngos med ma yin de ma yin //
translated: Since it exists, nonentity and entity are not different, but are the same.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not a nonentity, nor is it that.

original: dngos po med pa ma yin pa ni 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir te /üîΩ'khrul pa tsam du yod pa de la yang ba lang la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid med pas de ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ma yin pa ni 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir te / 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa de la yang ba lang la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid med pas de ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is not a nonentity because it exists as a mere error.üîΩThat which exists as a mere error does not have the nature of a cow, etc. Therefore, it is called ‚Äúnot that.‚Äù

original: de dngos por yod pa ma yin no zhes bya @177a * //
analyzed: de dngos por yod pa ma yin no zhes bya @177a * //
translated: It is not an entity.

original: ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de la de lta bur snang ba la sogs pa yod pa gang yin pa de nyid ba lang la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis bye brag med par ston to //
analyzed: de la de lta bur snang ba la sogs pa yod pa gang yin pa de nyid ba lang la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis bye brag med par ston to //
translated: In that case, whatever exists as such an appearance, etc., is the very non-entity of the entity, the cow, etc. Thus, he shows that entity and non-entity are not different.

original: rta dang glang po la sogs par 'khrul pa tsam du snang bar yod pa gang yin pa de nyid la ba lang la sogs pa'i rang bzhin med pas na /
analyzed: rta dang glang po la sogs par 'khrul pa tsam du snang bar yod pa gang yin pa de nyid la ba lang la sogs pa'i rang bzhin med pas na /
translated: Whatever exists as the mere appearance of the error of horse, elephant, etc., is the very non-nature of the cow, etc.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis don gcig go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis don gcig go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, entity and non-entity are synonymous.

original: ba lang la sogs pa med pa ste yin pa de nyid de lta bu'i snang bar yod pa'o zhes bya ba la don dam par ba lang la sogs par snang yang ba lang la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa de nyid la 'khrul pa tsam du snang ba'i
analyzed: ba lang la sogs pa med pa ste yin pa de nyid de lta bu'i snang bar yod pa'o zhes bya ba la don dam par ba lang la sogs par snang yang ba lang la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa de nyid la 'khrul pa tsam du snang ba'i
translated: That very non-existence of the cow, etc., is the existence of such an appearance. In that case, although it appears as a cow, etc., in the ultimate, the non-existence of the entity of the cow, etc., is the very existence of the entity of the mere appearance of error.

original: dngos po yod pas na de dngos po med pa dang dngos po gnyis su don gcig go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po yod pas na de dngos po med pa dang dngos po gnyis su don gcig go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, non-entity and entity are synonymous.

original: de bzhin gnyis snang de la yod //
analyzed: de bzhin gnyis snang de la yod //
translated: Likewise, dualistic appearance exists

original: de yi dngos po med pa ste //
analyzed: de yi dngos po med pa ste //
translated: In that, its thingness does not exist.

original: de phyir yod dang med par ni //
analyzed: de phyir yod dang med par ni //
translated: Therefore, existence and nonexistence

original: gzugs la sogs pa brjod pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩdper na sgyu ma'i rgyu shing dang rdo ba la rta dang glang po tsam du 'khrul par snang ba yod pas de bzhin du yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rtog pa gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de la gzung ba la sogs pa'i gzung ba dang
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa brjod pa'o // zhes bya ba la / dper na sgyu ma'i rgyu shing dang rdo ba la rta dang glang po tsam du 'khrul par snang ba yod pas de bzhin du yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rtog pa gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de la gzung ba la sogs pa'i gzung ba dang
translated: Are ascribed to form and so on.üîΩFor example, in an illusion, the causes, such as a stick and so on, appear to be a horse or an elephant, and there is the error of the appearance of a horse or an elephant.

original: 'dzin pa gnyis su snang ba 'khrul pa tsam dang kun rdzob tu yod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa gnyis su snang ba 'khrul pa tsam dang kun rdzob tu yod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Likewise, in the imagination of what is unreal, the dependent characteristic, there is the mere error of the appearance of the duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject, and it is said to exist conventionally.

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa la yang yod par yang brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa la yang yod par yang brjod do //
translated: Therefore, existence is ascribed to form and so on.

original: de'i phyir dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las kyang /
translated: Hence, Distinguishing the Middle from Extremes states:

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtogs yod //üîΩces bshad de /
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtogs yod // ces bshad de /
translated: The imagination of what is unreal exists.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su kun rdzob tu yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su kun rdzob tu yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This explains that the duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject exists conventionally.

original: de ltar gzung 'dzin gnyis 'khrul par snang ba tsam du kun rdzob tu yod kyang don dam par na gzung pa'i dngos po dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po nyid med de /
analyzed: de ltar gzung 'dzin gnyis 'khrul par snang ba tsam du kun rdzob tu yod kyang don dam par na gzung pa'i dngos po dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po nyid med de /
translated: Thus, the two, the apprehended and apprehender, exist conventionally as mere appearances of error. But ultimately, the entity of the apprehended and the entity of the apprehender do not exist.

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa la med pa zhes brjod do //

translated: Or else, when one attains nonconceptual intuition, which is free from all embellishment, which is the removal of all counteragents, one sees that the phenomena of form, etc., imagined by the na√Øve do not exist.

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa brjod pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /

analyzed: med pa'i sems dang sems las mthong ba tsam du 'gyur te /

analyzed: de ltar na gnyis por snang ba yod pa gang yin pa de nyid gnyis po med pa zhes bya'o //

original: ci'i phyir na gcig tu yod pa kho nar yang chad par mi bshad med pa kho nar yang chad par mi bshad de gnyis bye brag med par yang ci'i phyir mi bshad ce na /üîΩde'i phyir / sgro btags pa dang skur 'debs mtha' //

translated: Why is it not said that it exists as only one, or that it does not exist at all? Why is it not said that it is not different?üîΩTherefore he says:

analyzed: dgag pa'i phyir ni 'dod pa yin // theg pa chung bas 'gro ba yang //
translated: In order to refute superimposition and denial,

original: dgag pa'i phyir ni de nyid do //
analyzed: dgag pa'i phyir ni de nyid do //
translated: and in order to refute the Hƒ´nayƒÅna,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: that is asserted.

analyzed: yod pa dang med pa gcig tu chad par bshad pa dang / bye brag med par bshad pa ni go rims bzhin du rnam pa gsum @178a * //

analyzed: dgag pa'i phyir bshad de /

analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa drod dang rtse mo'i dus na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis 'khrul bar snang ba tsam du yod par khong du chud pas kun rdzob kyi dngos po la kun rdzob tsam du yod par rig ste med do zhes skur pa mi 'debs pa'i

analyzed: mtha' bkag go //

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni gang gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid las rnam pa gnyis su snang ba tsam du yod par bshad pa de nyid rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs par gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags kyi chos yod pa ma yin par khong
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni gang gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid las rnam pa gnyis su snang ba tsam du yod par bshad pa de nyid rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs par gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags kyi chos yod pa ma yin par khong
translated: But the Bodhisattvas, having understood that apart from consciousness there is no such thing as form, etc., which are imagined to exist in the imagined reality, and which are the two appearances that exist as mere thisness in the other-dependent reality,

analyzed: nor pa'i rgyu dang nor pa'o //

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The other does not exist because of the non-existence of the thing.

analyzed: dbang po dang yul la brten cing dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang med par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gzugs su nor pa'i rgyu rnam par rig pa de ni gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa gzugs zhes bya bar 'dod do zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de ni rnam par rig pa gzugs med do zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because there is no cause.

original: sa bon med na 'bras bu mi skye ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa rnams skye ba'i rgyu ni yul lnga dang dbang po lnga yin te /
analyzed: sa bon med na 'bras bu mi skye ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa rnams skye ba'i rgyu ni yul lnga dang dbang po lnga yin te /
translated: Just as a result does not arise without a seed, the cause of the arising of consciousnesses is the five sense objects and the five sense faculties.

analyzed: yul lnga dang dbang po lnga med par gyur na rnam par shes pa rnams kyang mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the five sense objects and the five sense faculties did not exist, the consciousnesses would not arise. That is the meaning.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa dbang po yang ming /

translated: If the sense faculties such as the eyes are also names,

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul yang med //
translated: Objects such as form do not exist.

original: de dag med pas rnam par shes pa rnams kyang med pa yin na /
analyzed: de dag med pas rnam par shes pa rnams kyang med pa yin na /
translated: Since those do not exist, consciousnesses also do not exist.

original: ci'i phyir @179a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir @179a * //
translated: Why is that?

original: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa lta bur snang ba mnyam pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dbang po med kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa lta bur snang ba srid pa 'jig rten du grags pa'i dpe dang gsung rab las 'byung ba'i dpe bstan te
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa lta bur snang ba mnyam pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dbang po med kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa lta bur snang ba srid pa 'jig rten du grags pa'i dpe dang gsung rab las 'byung ba'i dpe bstan te
translated: Although there is no apprehended object and apprehending subject, like the equality of the appearance of objects, sense faculties, and consciousnesses, it is possible for the appearance of apprehended objects and apprehending subjects to occur.

original: / 'jig rten du grags pa'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / 'jig rten du grags pa'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, the following is stated:
